The prices are more reasonable than others in town, and there are no contracts. Each person is offered a safety pendent, worn around the neck, which can be pushed in case of a fall.
It is a great place to live and I highly recommend it.

reviews_list.author: Elizabeth Shoats
reviews_list.text:
My husband and I are real estate investors and as of the last year or so we have met many senior folks wishing to down size. We have been visiting approx 3 senior facilities per week for a month now.
Our goal is to expand our knowledge so we can guide others through life’s difficult choices. We hope to empower them with clarity and confidence.
We met with Rachel Guerrero in Community Sales. We left feeling hopeful and empowered. She shared your communities vision and The Oaks in Georgetown is a property we would be proud to recommend.
Rachel is a great asset to your community, and will continue to follow up with her in the future.

reviews_list.author: Julie Hart
reviews_list.text:
We thoroughly enjoyed our tour at The Oaks!
It's so beautiful,  inside and out!
The courtyard area is gorgeous and we loved  the landscaping and the huge oak trees. They light up at night. Very impressive!
We love the fact that it's an all-inclusive inclusive community and also that it's month to month.
After we toured,  they invited us to stay for a meal.
The food was incredible!
I highly recommend The Oaks!

reviews_list.author: Benjamin Morgan
reviews_list.text:
TOP NOTCH RETIREMENT COMMUNITY.

My experience at The Oaks Gracious Retirement Living has been nothing short of phenomenal. As someone who recently had the pleasure of cleaning the windows for their residents, I can honestly say I've never encountered a community quite like this. Every single resident I spoke with was beaming with happiness and absolutely raved about their home here.

What truly sets The Oaks apart is the incredible, palpable care they provide. It's not just about meeting needs; it's about going the extra mile. I witnessed firsthand how the team goes above and beyond to make residents comfortable, even extending to thoughtful gestures like ensuring windows are sparkling clean for their elderly and senior members – a small detail that speaks volumes about their dedication.

The entire team is outstanding, but I must give a special shout-out to Scott, Oksana, Janet, and Clifford. They are among the best professionals I have ever worked with, demonstrating genuine compassion, efficiency, and a true commitment to the well-being of the residents.

The level of extra care, the vibrant atmosphere, and the sheer joy radiating from the residents are testaments to the exceptional environment The Oaks has cultivated. I am truly looking forward to a long and beneficial relationship with this wonderful community.

reviews_list.author: Albert Fisher
reviews_list.text: I'm returning to the Oaks. I moved to nearby Oscar thinking grass was greener on the other side of the fence. WOW was I wrong. There are / were so many disappointments at the Oscar,  I cannot describe in words.  There is a new set of managers and assistant managers at the Oaks and they have really made me feel welcome coming back. The place has changed since I left with   renovations and furniture making the place look very refreshing. The smoking which was a major factor for my leaving has been resolved and the place is now smoke free. It's only been a few weeks since back but I'm truly amazed of the difference. Continue checking reviews, because I'm sure you will find the Oaks at the top of ladder as far as recommendations are concerned.

reviews_list.author: Billie Duncan-Smith
reviews_list.text: We’ve been at The Oaks for 7 months, and it truly feels like a little slice of paradise. My husband and I aren’t in our 70s yet, but the move was incredibly easy, and it already feels like home. From the moment you walk through the doors, there’s a warm and welcoming atmosphere. The staff is absolutely amazing—friendly, caring, and they’ve been with The Oaks for years, which speaks volumes about the community. We couldn’t be happier with our decision!"

reviews_list.author: Dan McNeil
reviews_list.text: Very inviting appearance (not clinical or institutional feeling) and both staff and residents were very friendly. Rachel K, our staff contact, was very informative and answered all of our questions.  Interviewed several residents, all of whom were very happy with The Oaks. In addition to many activities and on site services being available, we appreciated the dedicated chapel. Since starting our research on independent senior living facilities (7 thus far), The Oaks has stood out as the best and would probably be the one chosen if we had to decide today. Dan

reviews_list.author: Judy Finnell
reviews_list.text:
My mom has been living here for 5 years. She has memory loss. We hire great caregivers to help her. She says always “I live in a very nice place. How did you find it?”

It was the first of 5 places we interviewed. Rachel, was the selling factor, as most of the places looked very nice. Rachel said, “ This is her home. If you need help, they will come to her, just like they would at her home”.  She has been in the same room and knows her way around.

Our family highly recommends The Oaks Gracious Retirement Living in Georgetown TX.

name: The Wesleyan Independent Living
description: The Wesleyan Independent Living is a retirement community in Georgetown, TX, offering retirement community services. Rated 4.8 stars based on 6 reviews, they provide quality senior living communities for Williamson County seniors.
shortDescription: The Wesleyan Independent Living provides quality senior living communities for seniors in Georgetown, TX.

reviews_list.author: Kevin Karschnik
reviews_list.text:
My dad recently toured two independent living communities, and we ultimately chose The Wesleyan Independent Living — and we couldn’t be happier! From the moment we walked in, everyone was so welcoming and kind. Cristy Schuler was especially wonderful to work with — friendly, knowledgeable, and genuinely caring. She took the time to answer all our questions and made the whole process easy and enjoyable.

My dad absolutely loves it here — the people are great, the activities are endless, and the food is delicious! He’s already made friends playing cards and dominos and looks forward to every meal. We are so grateful to Cristy and the entire team at The Wesleyan for creating such a warm, vibrant community.

reviews_list.author: Dan Bonner
reviews_list.text: I live here. Every service and every attitude is just like home should be. You can fellowship, exercise, walk, eat, read or rest in Central Texas Texas Hill Country beauty, and live in an absolutely beautiful and accessible home.

reviews_list.author: Ruby Ramirez
reviews_list.text: I am a visiting angel...I went to wk with my client and the place is very nice and and the employees are super sweet

name: Truewood by Merrill, Georgetown
description: Truewood by Merrill, Georgetown is a assisted living facility in Georgetown, TX, offering retirement community, assisted living facility, retirement home services. With a 4.5-star rating from 65 reviews, they are one of the highest-rated senior living communities providers in Williamson County.
shortDescription: Truewood by Merrill, Georgetown provides quality senior living communities for seniors in Georgetown, TX.

reviews_list.author: Patti Johnston
reviews_list.text: The caregivers in the memory care were so wonderful to my mom during the last months of her life.  They were compassionate and caring.  Recommending them for anyone’s family member

reviews_list.author: Nancy Talamantez
reviews_list.text: Although my 95 year old father had been independent, I  recently found that he needed to be in a safer place with assistance. I moved him from Illinois, where he lived for 95 years, to Texas to be closer to me and so I could monitor his health and well being. Obviously the whole move was quite the upheaval for him. He was very resistant to move into assisted care, but Caitlin in her kind, caring, and professional manner came to our home and assured him that he would be well taken care of with a huge dose of fun along the way.  I had researched Truewood earlier and I felt this would be a good match for him and with Caitlin’s help we were able to smoothly transition him into Truewood. Once he arrived there Evelyn, the LVN on staff, went out of her way to welcome  and assure him that he would be well taken care of.  It was a hard decision to move my my dad from Illinois, to Texas, and then to assisted living, but I know he is in a safe place and well taken care of.  When I go visit him, he is always on his way to one activity or another.  I expected a difficult transition, but they keep him so busy I doubt he even thinks much about being bored or sad.  Thank you to the administration and caregivers for giving my dad a safe and happy setting to age in place. I will forever be grateful.

reviews_list.author: Angela Achee
reviews_list.text: Truewood by Merrill has provided a great experience for our family since the first moment we visited. Caitlyn Bickerstaff met with us, discussed all of the aspects of care here, answered our multitude of questions and gave us a tour. We were so impressed we didn’t visit any other facilities. Caitlyn and I talked almost every day prior to decision making and move in. Mom needed memory care and facility and staff were awesome from the first moment. We moved Mom in about 5 weeks after that first encounter and have been very pleased with the care Mom has received since. Can’t recommend it enough. It’s a well run, clean, happy place with excellent care and compassion by all.

reviews_list.author: Vickie Keith
reviews_list.text: My mom recently had some health issues & had to be moved from living independently in SETX, to memory care here in Georgetown. I visited almost all memory facilities within a 10 mile radius…& all had their strengths & weaknesses, but I felt that Truwood (formerly Legacy) would be the best fit for my mom. I don’t think I could have made a better choice - she LOVES it there! Her room is beautiful & spacious, the food is delicious & the staff is caring & kind! They have all sorts of fun daily programs & activities for the residents & try to integrate the memory residents in with the others as much as possible…which is nice. I hear a lot of laughter in the community…which is very telling to me!  Both the staff and the residents seem very happy, and I didn’t always find that with the other communities. I also appreciate the frequent communication & updates about my mom.  I feel like my mom is getting the best of care, and she is as happy as a clam! Who could ask for anything more?

reviews_list.author: Cliff Luckey
reviews_list.text: When I see exemplary customer care, I make certain to take the time to share with others. I knew Truewood was different and special as we were taking the tour of the facility. Caitlin knew the names of every resident and their loved ones we passed, and stopped to take the time to chat with each person. I could see the smiles on their faces as she was approaching, so I knew it wasn’t manufactured for our benefit. Everyone we have met during the transition - from the rehab, to the move-in process, has been kind and genuinely cares about the people they serve. Kindness and authentic passion for the social services people provide can’t be faked. Organizations either have genuine customer care built into their culture’s DNA or they don’t. If the leadership team models the way of customer excellence, then almost all others do the same. Truewood is what “right looks like” to us for the care of our dear loved one. Cliff and Janet

reviews_list.author: Al Gaskell
reviews_list.text: Oct'24    I've been living here for a little over a year and my experience has been very good. The professional staff has been very helpful. Cristina Gonzalez has provided exceptional help with my care including medications and other services. Rachel Leupold and Don Nichols are good leaders for all the activities in Truewood.

reviews_list.author: Susan Hannan
reviews_list.text:
My mother (now 98) has lived in The Legacy since it opened in 8/2013. She originally lived in the assisted living area, but 6 months ago, transitioned to the memory care area.  When making the decision to move from the assisted living to memory care, I received excellent guidance from the director and nursing staff. I usually visit 3 times a week, at various times during the day. The atmosphere is welcoming and tastefully appointed. Over the years, The Legacy has been consistently clean; meals are varied, delicious and well prepared. My mother has an ostomy and her cleanliness has never been an issue and she has always been treated with respect. The staff has changed over time, but always improving with the replacements. I know it is challenging to find and keep good employees, but The Legacy continues to strive to get and retain well trained and caring staff. Although my mother usually does not participate in many activities, Shannon, the memory care activities director continues to encourage her and many times is successful!  I have found that the core staff is sincere in their caring for our family members. My mother enjoys living at The Legacy and continues to mention this and how the people are so nice and friendly.

Suggestions:
•	Staff should be more proactive in shampooing apartment’s rugs.
•	Residence supplies that are ordered by The Legacy should be documented better so there is no interruption is process due to staff changes.

reviews_list.author: Cheryl Rowder
reviews_list.text: Kind and caring staff eased the transition for my husband when he arrived. The food is tasty, especially the soups. This facility is just the right size with fun activities throughout the day!

reviews_list.author: Steve Frank
reviews_list.text:
We brought my mother-in-law from Indiana this last January to live near us here in Georgetown. We had visited many assisted living facilities before deciding which one would (hopefully) be the best for her.
The decision wasn’t at all difficult as one would think. We visited Legacy first. Both my husband, Steve, and I were impressed for many reasons. However, since this was our first facility to visit, we hesitated only because we didn’t want to make a “hasty” or quick decision. So we continued to view quite a few others. Nothing even compared to Legacy, not even close!
What we were so impressed with is Legacy’s ability to make everyone feel at home. And that, dear friends, is the very best quality you can hope for. Whether it be the facility’s actual appearance both inside and out, or the courteous and genuinely warm staff and helpers, it wasn’t a hard decision at all for us to make. We have been so pleased with all the care and attention my mother-in-law has received, all the activities that she is offered and, above all else, the communication afforded us by Legacy.

Thank you,

reviews_list.author: elizabeth hinds
reviews_list.text: I cannot say enough good things about The Legacy. My family’s experience with this facility had been nothing but positive. It’s such an emotional decision to move a loved one to assisted living. The kindness and professionalism of the staff made the process as easy as it could possibly be. My dad’s dementia makes transitions hard for him. The entire team worked together with our family to make sure he was comfortable and happy. You can tell they truly love what they do and genuinely care for the residents. I wholeheartedly recommend The Legacy.

name: Sun City Texas by Del Webb- 55+ Retirement Community
description: Sun City Texas by Del Webb- 55+ Retirement Community is a retirement community in Georgetown, TX, offering retirement community, home builder, real estate agent services. With a 4.5-star rating from 192 reviews, they are one of the highest-rated senior living communities providers in Williamson County.
shortDescription: Sun City Texas by Del Webb- 55+ Retirement Community provides quality senior living communities for seniors in Georgetown, TX.

reviews_list.author: Cindy Schettino
reviews_list.text: We are extremely pleased with our entire new build process from sales w/ Marjan, options w/Rachel, construction managers Glenn and Adrian, the title company and home warranty w/ Wes! All employees have been congenial, professional, informative, patient with all of our questions, thorough and all genuinely desiring our complete satisfaction! We love our new home, friendly neighbors, and all the amenities we’ve experienced so far and are looking forward to joining groups with common interests! Thank you to all who have made our move to Sun City a pleasurable experience!

reviews_list.author: bert joseph
reviews_list.text: My Del Webb home in Sun City, Georgetown, TX, built by Pulte, is an excellent building. I am particularly grateful to Patrick Estrada, who truly believes it is the service after the sale that counts!!

reviews_list.author: KT KT
reviews_list.text: I was recently visiting a sister who is a Sun City Georgetown resident and stopped in 2-days-in-a-row at the Pulte Homes Sales  Center located in the Northpoint Amenity Center. I met and spoke with LISA MEDINA one of the days and YOLANDA LAMBRECHT on the other day! They both exhibited outstanding welcoming demeanors and very engaging stellar communications expertise! Having worked all my career in public relations/marketing in the real estate arena, I was very impressed! If one's initial encounter when arriving at a company, venue, office, etc. isn't positive it becomes irrevalent how excellent the building/office, amenities, sales team are if that initial encounter, whether over a phone call, or in person is less than the above described profiles of these two awesome Pulte Homes representatives!

reviews_list.author: George H
reviews_list.text: Our Del Webb Sales Consultant, Janet, was extremely helpful and very professional. In our opinion, Janet is a terrific person and a great asset for Del Webb!  Our Design Consultant, Rachel, was awesome and so talented! Communication with our Construction Manager was fair at best in our view. In our opinion, Pulte Homes dropped the ball on several things during construction.   Our Purchase Agreement with Pulte Homes included installation of a Home Standby Generator. The installation of our generator was unfortunately not completed until many days after our closing. We believe that this was due to poor communication between Pulte, its subcontractors and the City of Georgetown and due to the necessary paperwork not being handled in a proper and timely manner.  Our foundation was chiseled after it was poured for the installation of two electrical outlets.  These electrical outlets were included in our original paperwork. We also contracted with Pulte Homes for the installation of window blinds.  After moving into our new home, we experienced several issues with our window blinds including not being able to open or close them easily, several of the blinds were warped and most of the valances were apparently damaged, defective or improperly installed causing them to fall to the floor. Our Pulte Customer Service Representative, Wesley, has been kind and very responsive! Finally, before we signed our Purchase Agreement we were told by Del Webb that a new Amenity Center was going to be built within walking distance of our new home.  In February 2025 we were advised by Del Webb that construction on the new Amenity Center was scheduled to start in April 2025 and that the target date for completion was some time in Q2 or Q3 2026. As of this writing, construction on the new Amenity Center has not commenced and we have not been able to obtain a target date range for the commencement of construction from Del Webb. Overall, our construction experience was good in part and not so good in part. We are happy to be living in Sun City Texas!

reviews_list.author: Wilson Delasalas
reviews_list.text: We moved here a year ago from Hawaii. We are retired nurses and covid survivors. We have looked at other places but as soon as we entered this community we know right away its the right place for us to continue to heal . Lots of nature and very peaceful and the amenities have kept us to be active . There’s great support from the  builder and the neighbors are kind and friendly . We cannot asked for more and feel so blessed to have found this place .

reviews_list.author: Robin Vickers
reviews_list.text: We closed on our newly built home 12/25 and are thrilled to be in Sun City and love our home. Each person on our team from sales to design to construction was outstanding. We were kept up to date, any concerns addressed and the process was smooth. We recommend Sun City and Del Web because of this team.

reviews_list.author: Steve T
reviews_list.text: We were happy in Dallas and knew nothing about 55+ communities, but we visited some friends who had recently moved to Sun City, met Marjan, and bought a house all in the same weekend.  We’ve had a great experience with Pulte and love our new home.  We are thrilled to be here!!!

reviews_list.author: brian brockman
reviews_list.text: The entire team involved in our home and lot purchase was incredible. We had the most dealings with Sara and Adrian who were professional, friendly, patient and made the process very smooth. We highly recommend  Del Webb. Thank you all so much. The team made it a wonderful experience and recommend everyone to work with these wonderful individuals.

reviews_list.author: Amy Cavaness
reviews_list.text: Just moved from an older home in Sun City to a brand new larger home. The build quality on our new home is great and the construction manager went over every detail of the house with us to be sure we were satisfied. We wanted a bigger house but didn’t want to leave Sun City—we have such a great time here!

reviews_list.author: Georgienne Nassauer
reviews_list.text: Great experience dealing with Janet Moore in sales,  construction process with Adrian Perez and customer service follow up and remediation with Eric Estrada.  Neighbors are top notch and facilities are very nice.

name: Platinum Resort At Berry Springs
description: Platinum Resort At Berry Springs is a assisted living facility in Georgetown, TX, offering assisted living facility services. With a 5-star rating from 23 reviews, they are one of the highest-rated senior living communities providers in Williamson County.
shortDescription: Platinum Resort At Berry Springs provides quality senior living communities for seniors in Georgetown, TX.

reviews_list.author: Deziree Berube
reviews_list.text:
Berry Springs Platinum Resort Assisted Living truly lives up to its name — it’s a place where compassion, comfort, and quality care come together beautifully. From the moment you walk in, the environment feels warm, inviting, and full of life. The staff go above and beyond to ensure every resident feels valued, respected, and cared for like family.

The facility itself is clean, modern, and thoughtfully designed, with plenty of cozy spaces and engaging activities that make each day enjoyable. The management team is attentive and professional, always keeping families informed and involved. You can tell they genuinely care about the residents’ well-being and happiness.

Whether it’s the friendly caregivers, the delicious meals, or the peaceful atmosphere, Berry Springs sets the standard for what assisted living should be. I would highly recommend this community to anyone looking for a safe, supportive, and truly loving home for their loved ones.

reviews_list.author: Kenzie Davis
reviews_list.text: This is a gorgeous home for all of our grandparents. The owners did an outstanding job to provide our grandparents with a place that not only looks, but feels like home. All Of our staff work hard to provide the care and love that our grandparents deserve. I truly love how each person here is dedicated to caring for our residents. This is the only place I would ever trust with my own family!

reviews_list.author: Daisy Rodriguez
reviews_list.text: Platinum Resort at Berry Springs has it all. In addition to the original charm of the caregivers, Berry Springs also offers the modern conveniences of luxurious amenities, such as the library and its state-of-the-art industrial kitchen. With its compassionate Angel caregivers and its amenities, “Luxurious comfort” is the way I would describe the ambience of this assisted living home. ❤️

reviews_list.author: Ashley Freeman
reviews_list.text: Beautiful newly built homes for grandparents...the tentaveness and caring of the staff from the serenada location carries over to this new location. Everyone works hard to give to our family members the best care available

reviews_list.author: Kimberly Ford
reviews_list.text: This home is a gorgeous new addition to the platinum mansions and the owners couldn’t have done a better job! It’s so beautiful and peaceful and though large intimate.

reviews_list.author: Angela Augustus
reviews_list.text:
I absolutely love coming to Platinum in Serenada! The home is bright, beautiful, and has such a cozy, welcoming feel—just like home. The owners have truly outdone themselves with the new buildings at Berry Springs, and I can’t wait to see Mandy, Eva, and the entire team fill them with the same love and care they’ve put into the Mesa location.

The staff is incredibly knowledgeable, creative, and so patient with the grandparents. Every time I walk through the doors, I’m greeted with a warm smile and get to witness firsthand just how loved and well-cared-for everyone is. Platinum is unlike any other place I’ve visited—and I’ve seen many!

Keep up the amazing work, Platinum Team! You are truly making a difference.

reviews_list.author: Martina Jefferson
reviews_list.text:
WOW, what a beautiful home!

I toured Platinum Mesa before visiting Berry Springs, and I was already impressed by the warm and loving environment at Mesa. Now, after seeing the stunning homes at Berry Springs, I’m truly amazed! Eva, Mandy, and the entire team are incredibly welcoming, and the atmosphere at the Serenada location is filled with warmth and care.

It’s so exciting to see these new homes opening and to witness the expansion of the incredible work they do. If I ever need to place a loved one somewhere, there’s no doubt—it will be at Platinum Resort.

reviews_list.author: Shelbi McDonald
reviews_list.text: An amazing facility with exceptional care. It’s a stunning environment that was well thought out for comfort and safety. They truly love their residents and strive to go above and beyond. Their care angels are compassionate, professional, and always have a smiling face. You couldn’t ask for a better place to entrust your loved one!

reviews_list.author: Lili Moses
reviews_list.text: Absolutely incredible place! The staff are compassionate, attentive, and truly treat residents like family. The mansion itself is stunning—elegant, clean, and full of warmth. Highly recommend to anyone looking for a place that feels like home, with top-notch care!

reviews_list.author: Alexander Strubbe
reviews_list.text: Beautiful facility! The tour was extremely beneificial and full of information! Eva and Mandy did an amazing job explaining the benefits of Platinum to provide me ease and comfort to send my grandmother there to her new home.

name: The Wesleyan Independent Living West
description: The Wesleyan Independent Living West is a retirement community in Georgetown, TX, offering retirement community services. Rated 4.3 stars based on 47 reviews, they provide quality senior living communities for Williamson County seniors.
shortDescription: The Wesleyan Independent Living West provides quality senior living communities for seniors in Georgetown, TX.

reviews_list.author: Bill Marsh
reviews_list.text: We moved  here, but to the  East  building, over  a  year  ago .  We  are thankful  that  we  were  here  during  the  ice storm !  We have  one  meal  a day  delivered  to  our  door .  Some  of the  staff  stayed  in the  building  overnight  to ensure  our  safety .  Very  caring  staff  and great  facilities .  As you  can  tell ,  we love  it  here !

reviews_list.author: Anna Clawson
reviews_list.text: We had a great Christmas meal! And an excellent Chicken fried steak for dinner!; I'm the evening Cook Anna! I Love my People! Merry Christmas to all my Wesleyan people! Their my Family Too!

reviews_list.author: Sheron Scur
reviews_list.text: I visited a friend that has an apartment here. The grounds are very nice, the apartments are very nice, and there are many amenities to be enjoyed by residents.

reviews_list.author: Dezmeray Lake
reviews_list.text: Horrible drivers, that are transporting. I have almost crushed my car into the back of one of these vans. He decided he would pull out right in front of me going down Williams drive. I slammed on my breaks just into and switched lanes. I am so thankful the lane to my right was empty.

reviews_list.author: Becky May
reviews_list.text: Wonderful, caring, faith-based, not-for-profit community!   Not sure who the two people are who gave us low reviews.  As far as I can tell, they have no association to our community whatsoever.  They may be confusing us with another community with a similar name.  It happens all the time.

reviews_list.author: Jean Solana
reviews_list.text: Good food, nice people but my 91 year old mother has been there a month and promised items at move in are not happening…closet shelves never added, closet door won’t close, no ice maker delivered…???

reviews_list.author: Lisa Davis
reviews_list.text: It is nice, friendly, and clean. Staff is great. Easy to get to. I'd recommend it.

reviews_list.author: Donna Wallace
reviews_list.text: When I get old I want to live here - lovely facilities happy residents and so many activities.  It seriously is the nicest place I have ever visited.

reviews_list.author: Ben Lake
reviews_list.text: A great place to be! Caring staff really make a difference.

reviews_list.author: Cs Ortiz
reviews_list.text: Awesome place. We're wishing Wesleyan's team tons of fortune, health and harmony. Happy New Year!

name: Watermere at Round Rock
description: Watermere at Round Rock is a retirement community in Round Rock, TX, offering retirement community, apartment complex, retirement home services. With a 4.8-star rating from 29 reviews, they are one of the highest-rated senior living communities providers in Williamson County.
shortDescription: Watermere at Round Rock provides quality senior living communities for seniors in Round Rock, TX.

reviews_list.author: T.J. Max
reviews_list.text: Watermere at Round Rock, a new living experience, is not for everyone.  It is, however, perfect for seniors like my husband and I who desire to live a happy, healthy and fun life.  The amenities at Watermere are too numerous to list.  Think back to when you were last on a cruise where the choices of activities and entertainment were unlimited.  The choice is now so consider taking advantage of this lifestyle opportunity.

reviews_list.author: Helene Kutnick
reviews_list.text: We love living in our Watermere Villa but there are many wrinkles to be ironed out when moving to a new facility.  I feel the staff is working very hard to make it a success.  I also believe, in time, I would be able to give it a 5 star rating.

reviews_list.author: Kathleen Morgan
reviews_list.text: My move-in experience has been enhanced by the responsiveness of Jenny and her crew. Very accessible and responsive. (Welcome basket was a wonderful surprise!) Any concerns were immediately addressed. I look forward to my stay.

reviews_list.author: Paula Weedon
reviews_list.text: We've lived at the Watermere since the end of March..Our new home is lovely with a nicely landscaped small yard that we enjoy. Ee have an outstsnding Activitu Director who plsn many activities eith our inout. Adfitionally, the Budiness Managet is also responsive to our concetnd and needs. Because this is a new facility, there are still a few things that need improvement as any new facility of this nature might. The Administration is listening to us and adjusting as quickly as possible to changes that are beneficial to the residents. Overall, my husband and I are very satisfied with our experiences here.

reviews_list.author: Joel Kutnick
reviews_list.text: I love living at Watermere but as a new facility there still issues  which have to be resolved.  This is why I did not give it a 5 star rating.  However, I do believe  the staff will eventually resolve the problems to the point where I can say it is 5 stars

reviews_list.author: Tolu Adeogba
reviews_list.text:
I’ve recently been exploring senior living options with my parents. We have considered options all over and nothing quite compares to our experience at Watermere.

Their sales team member, Breanna, is passionate, understanding, knowledgeable and helpful.

Watermere offers the best value, is competitively priced and has the largest floor plans. Additionally, the company is vertically owned meaning they own the construction, management and operations team. A rarity from what I’ve seen.

reviews_list.author: Janie Wray
reviews_list.text: I have been following the development of Watermere since the sign first went in the ground on University Blvd. Early on, my husband and I took a day trip to their Preserve location at N Richmond  Hills to see the campus there. It was A+.  I have enjoyed watching every phase being built here in Round Rock. Brianna, to me, is their absolute biggest asset. She is in tune with us seniors and what we want and need. Their entire team make us feel welcome each time we come see the progress. It's going to be an exciting place to live.

reviews_list.author: Amy Plate
reviews_list.text:
I've had the pleasure of meeting so many wonderful people who have already chosen Watemere as their home!  The building is shaping up to be absolutely stunning, with top-notch amenities that truly set it apart.  Located in a fantastic area, Watermere offers the perfect balance of comfort, convenience, and community.
We've already started making new friends and creating lasting memories, and we can't wait for more to join us on this exciting journey.  If you're looking for a beautiful place to call home, come see Watermere for yourself and experience what makes it so special.  Your forever home is waiting-join us

reviews_list.author: Jenelle
reviews_list.text: Luxury senior living in a prime location! Absolutely gorgeous and beautiful place to call home 🩵 Watermere Round Rock is brand new and a must to see and meet the staff if you haven’t already!

reviews_list.author: Scott Allen
reviews_list.text: Watermere at Round Rock is still under development, but I'm already excited about what it promises to offer. One of the things that really stands out is where it's being built. Breanna has helped our family and especially my grandmother see beyond the construction and she is excited about the move. This place seems like it’s going to be a wonderful option for my Grandmother and I am happy she is happy.

name: Provident Crossings Retirement Resort
address: 1950 S A W Grimes Blvd, Round Rock, TX 78664
description: Provident Crossings Retirement Resort is a retirement community in Round Rock, TX, offering retirement community, apartment building, apartment complex services. Rated 4.4 stars based on 30 reviews, they provide quality senior living communities for Williamson County seniors.
shortDescription: Provident Crossings Retirement Resort provides quality senior living communities for seniors in Round Rock, TX.

reviews_list.author: Pat Newman
reviews_list.text:
We have fun at Provident Crossings - mariachi band celebrating Cinco de Mayo, New Year’s Eve dancing, Johnny McGowan entertaining, Halloween costumes, dinner out at Tokyo Steakhouse, Country Music. Come join us!

We play games at Provident Crossings - Mahjongg, nickel bingo, Wii bowling (a perfect score), horse racing and many more. Come join us!

We eat good food at Provident Crossings - take a look at some of the delicious and beautiful meals served at the monthly celebration dinners and on holidays. Come join us!

reviews_list.author: Susan Likon
reviews_list.text:
I am so grateful to call this place my home. They have so much to offer. The cost may seem high at first but when you realize you get 3 hot meals a day plus snacks available 24 hours, all utilities paid except for cell phone plus weekly housekeeping,
you can't go wrong. Also our activities director offers us many opportunities for fun filled adventures. If you no longer drive, we are offered weekly shopping trips as well as medical appointments. Come make your home with us. We would love to have you as a neighbor
Sue L. (Resident for almost 4 years)

reviews_list.author: Tracy Flores
reviews_list.text:
I go to provident crossings on a fairly regular basis to visit family friends who live there Mr. Sean & Ms.Patty. We always have a great time & the food is outstanding.
We attended tonight for birthday and anniversary night, There's always fun and interactive things going on over there and they always allow family and friends to attend.
It really is a nice facility!

reviews_list.author: Shelley Troxell
reviews_list.text: I wish I could give more than 5 stars!!  My father is  having a great experience at Provident Crossings Round Rock - and I am, too!  The facility is fabulous, but what really stands out is the people - the staff, the management AND the residents.   I enjoy joining him for lunch in the dining room and talking with the staff and residents.   It  is such a blessing to know that my father is living with people who care about him.   Facility is extremely clean and uplifting.  The activities are varied and fun. My father wishes he had moved to Provident Crossings sooner.    HIGHLY recommend !

reviews_list.author: Maia Perimon
reviews_list.text:
We came to celebrate a birthday with my Dad tonight. Provident Crossing provided a beautiful special meal for the monthly celebration. This is a delightful senior community with a focus on bringing residents together to enjoy life.

I am so grateful that my parents get to enjoy this season of their lives in a home where they are valued, respected, and treated with dignity and kindness. Everyday is full of varied activities, deliciously prepared meals, and opportunities to explore the local events.

The management is present and accessible, always going above and beyond to keep Provident Crossing operating smoothly so that the residents need only be concerned with enjoying their day. Great place, we give them 5 stars!

reviews_list.author: Darla Zeltman
reviews_list.text: My parents have lived at Provident Crossings for the past three years.  This place has truly been a God send for my parents.  The managers Jay and Joy are amazing and caring in every way.  They go the extra mile for the residents to ensure that they are safe and happy.  The chef, kitchen staff, and house keepers are superb. I highly recommend Provident Crossings to anyone that is contemplating finding an excellent assisted living home for their family member.

reviews_list.author: Jeramy Davis
reviews_list.text: My parents have lived at Provident Crossings for a year. Provident has made many changes in the past year - most recently they are under new management and have a great new chef! We are extremely happy with the way the facility is now being run and the food is expertly prepared, fresh, delicious, and there are a lot of choices. The residents are  very friendly and make you feel welcome. It has been a wonderful experience for my parents who moved from their home to a two bedroom apartment. The management and front desk girls are well trained and go out of their way to help the residents. They also have Halcyon Health Care in the building to help residents with any extra in-home care they may need. A good move for all of us to a wonderful facility!!

reviews_list.author: Bonnie Bruce
reviews_list.text:
I’m so thankful for Provident Crossings. After my father passed, my Mother moved in with us and while we thoroughly enjoyed having her and she enjoyed being with her grandkids everyday, she is still very active and I felt bad for her sitting alone at home while we were at school/work.

She has been at Provident now for six months and has joined the choir, the Wii Bowling team, the bean bag baseball team, has joined fitness challenges, and has made friends her own age. She also enjoys the outings they have to Museums and plays and has even taken my daughters with her on outings. For days when she’s not feeling social they have movies on their in-house channels in addition to her regular cable and internet.

I feel she is well taken care of at Provident. She enjoys the food there and probably eats better in the day than she did when she was alone at my house. There is a maid service, and even a driver that will take her to shopping, medical appointments and grocery shopping.

She has fully enjoyed her fellow residents and the staff there, all of whom she is on a first name basis.

I encourage to go visit if you are looking for a senior living apartment. Thanks, Provident!

reviews_list.author: Patti & Sean Daly
reviews_list.text: We have felt blessed from the very beginning to find this extraordinary residence. The first thing that struck both of us was that we felt like we were on a cruise ship with special conversation rooms, a library, Billiard room, poker room, a fabulous daily salad bar, noon and night, and apartments loaded with great features like bars in the bathroom and electrical outlets a plenty. We were immediately reminded of fabulous cruises we had taken. There was a fountain as we entered with fish, swimming in it, music to our ears. There were friendly people everywhere who greeted us. The dining room was extensive and well laid out, full of decorations and pictures. Weekly housekeeping was offered to keep our rooms neat, clean, beds made. And the staff are just excellent. But let us talk about the most important piece probably right now (after. our two years here). That is our managers, Joie and Jay!  It is hard to describe to the outside world what it means for us to have a mother and a father figure who really really care about us. They are a loving, caring couple Who are everywhere, at all times of the day or night, exactly where they need to be to be of help to someone. Their way of handling all of us, of being committed to see every server, and every helper in the building is taken care of, of the way they handle issuesbrought before them with care, patience and concern, is just what a resident like this needs We always hear, the residence talking about how they feel like they’re part of a family. That comes right down from the top! Let me not forget Holly, our activities Director Who is also so committed to her job of pleasing us and keeping us interested in varying activities. And Pete, our driver, who goes out of his way to take us to appointments with wheelchairs, relators, etc. He gets off the bus and often holds the door to the office for people. Again, always with a smile. The staff members who work on the desk also go way above and beyond with their abilities to help us and serve us. Let us not omit all the dedicated, caring, managers, and servers in the dining room. They always have a smile, remember our names, get special treats for us when they see us coming, and are so appreciated. And one last place, definitely not to be overlooked, is our phenomenal kitchen, our very obliging and excellent chef and all of the staff that works in the kitchen. There are probably six languages spoken in that kitchen and everything works like clockwork within the budget They are allotted. There are always two options for entrées and beautiful desserts, rolls and extra treats. On Sundays, Jay, gets up extra early to get special donuts, made here in Round Rock, coming in with boxes of donuts , especially for us. Sean and I were evacuated from Sanibel Island in Florida with the last hurricane, losing everything, including our car, and really believe that we were brought by the universe to the perfect place for us. Please come join us.❤️

reviews_list.author: Ashley Dunn
reviews_list.text: Kim and Rex are so friendly and educational! Love their matching outfits too 😁

name: Amberlin Georgetown
description: Amberlin Georgetown is a apartment complex in Georgetown, TX, offering apartment complex, apartment building services. With a 4.8-star rating from 43 reviews, they are one of the highest-rated senior living communities providers in Williamson County.
shortDescription: Amberlin Georgetown provides quality senior living communities for seniors in Georgetown, TX.

reviews_list.author: Jennifer Leal
reviews_list.text: I have lived here almost 1 year and I am very happy. Love my apartment, and the community is the best! Our custodian, Terry, keeps everything so tidy and clean. Peter and Tyler, Maintenance, respond quickly and professionally to requests. Ashleigh and her office staff are great as well. The amenities are modern, and the community events are fun! The event calendar is packed every month!

reviews_list.author: Kathleen Chatmon
reviews_list.text: Amberlin Georgetown has very nice apartment plans to select from. They have a lot of different activities to keep you busy on a daily basis. The people that live here have been very friendly, helpful, cordial, and supportive to me. Where the apartments are located, everything is very convenient. If you really want to, you can walk to the Outlet Mall, HEB, and the corner stores. Casey, Matt, and Shelly are awesome people who’s very helpful here at Amberlin Georgetown.

reviews_list.author: Patricia Perry
reviews_list.text: Ive lived at Amberlin Georgetown for 5.5 months. The staff here are the best from ensuring my move was positive. Housekeeper, Terry Connor is the most caring person and consciously available working with Maintenance crew to ensure our community is safe and clean.

reviews_list.author: Tamara Wilson
reviews_list.text: I have lived here for about a year and we love the complex we love the amenities we love the staff, especially Terry Connor. He has done a wonderful job keeping this place clean and everything is always clean and well-maintained and make sure that the outside too where all the amenities are cleaned and trash cans emptied, and windows sparkling clean.  The entire staff has done a great job of keeping everything as a well oiled machine from upper management to leasing agents to maintenance to housekeeping.

reviews_list.author: Dennis
reviews_list.text: Nice place to live. Friendly tenants. Great staff, especially the maint. crew Peter and Tyler, and Terry the cleaner is always keeping things tidy. Ashleigh and the rest of the office team are new since I moved in over two years ago and have made some great improvements.

reviews_list.author: Keith Steiner
reviews_list.text:
I wanted to give an update about Amberlin Georgetown since my last review. We continue to love living at Amberlin. There is so much to enjoy.

My wife and I moved into Amberlin of Georgetown this past January.  We love it here. The staff is amazing and this includes Peter, Tyler, who takes care of maintenance and Terry who takes care of keeping all of the public areas looking clean. We appreciate the Amberlin Management and Sales team as well.

The residents are wonderful. There are so many activities to enjoy including get togethers ,themed events, bocce, pickleball, the pool, the fitness center and so many other activities. The location is superb. We like to walk and can walk to the HEB, restaurants and the outside mall and we are also near Baylor Scott & White. At the same time, you can just get in your vehicle and be at all of these places in minutes.  I've gotten involved with Pickleball and there are many fellow residents who I've gotten to know through this sport.

This is an amazing Active Adults Community and we are so glad that we moved here. Be sure to check it out.

reviews_list.author: Gloria Bradshaw
reviews_list.text: Terry is the best! His housekeeping skills make all of the common areas sparkle. Besides that, he is willing to go the extra mile to help residents who request help with various tasks. I have lived here for 1 1/2 years now and enjoy the space and the interaction among residents.

reviews_list.author: Erica Visser
reviews_list.text: Terry Connor is doing a great job taking care of the facility. My mom and grandma live there and it always stays clean and updated. They say it is thanks to Terry who is the kindest man!

reviews_list.author: Bonnie Klohs
reviews_list.text: All of the staff are fantastic, but especially want to mention Terry as a wonderful maintenance man. Our complex has never been cleaner (or smelled better!) since he started working here. Thanks to Terry for his prompt and thoughtful service!!!

reviews_list.author: Sandra Smith
reviews_list.text: This is my first apartment life and it is outstanding. Management, especially Shelley, are always on top of things. There are always interesting and varied activities. For the very few maintenance issues, maintenance is always on top of it and there within minutes! Even on a Saturday!

name: Heritage Oaks Active Adult Community - Jimmy Jacobs Custom Homes
description: Heritage Oaks Active Adult Community - Jimmy Jacobs Custom Homes is a retirement community in Georgetown, TX, offering retirement community services. Rated 5 stars based on 1 reviews, they provide quality senior living communities for Williamson County seniors.
shortDescription: Heritage Oaks Active Adult Community - Jimmy Jacobs Custom Homes provides quality senior living communities for seniors in Georgetown, TX.

reviews_list.author: Amy Edwards
reviews_list.text: Beautiful homes for the 55+ homeowners/buyers.

name: Reserve at Round Rock
description: Reserve at Round Rock is a retirement community in Round Rock, TX, offering retirement community, apartment building, apartment complex services. With a 4.9-star rating from 31 reviews, they are one of the highest-rated senior living communities providers in Williamson County.
shortDescription: Reserve at Round Rock provides quality senior living communities for seniors in Round Rock, TX.

reviews_list.author: Sue Pacifico
reviews_list.text: The reserve very nice and warm atmosphere. I feel right at home here. Eleanor the young lady that we took the tour with was very sweet very knowledgeable. She really knows her job. Eleanor is very professional  The people that live there I had the pleasure to play a Game with . They were very kind and informative everything is a positive vibe here. Everyone is just so kind and helpful but Eleanor what a lovely young lady my daughter and I hit her with 1 million questions and every time she had the right answer for us. We really enjoyed her company and I can’t wait to move in.

reviews_list.author: KTM
reviews_list.text: The Reserve is a beautiful property with a very inviting atmosphere. Residents were very friendly and seemed genuinely happy with their community. We toured with Eleanor Johnson who was excellent, she was professional and knowable. She was very patient with us, answering all of our questions and provided us with a very thorough tour. One of the nicest communities in the surrounding area.

reviews_list.author: Gaming Bro’s Game all the time
reviews_list.text: Eleanor Johnson is professional, welcoming, friendly, and kind. She is amazing and is very knowledgeable and loves what she does. She always has a smile on her face and compassion for everyone she encounters. I've had the pleasure working aside her to make our community better!!💕🙏💜

reviews_list.author: m pcc
reviews_list.text:
Since the moment we walked in to the Reserve, everything just felt right. Our first encounter was with Kim, who was very attentive and helpful. She truly went out of her way to accommodate us. Our following visit was with Jenna, who made the leasing process easy and stress-free.
It was such a pleasure to deal with someone like her. She was professional, welcoming, friendly, and kind. We couldn't be happier so far with the entire staff. The location is fantastic, the environment is attractive with a wonderful sense of community. It is one of the finest new active senior living

reviews_list.author: Rita Carranza
reviews_list.text: We couldn't be happier. We love our new home and the staff is amazing. Special shout out to Eleanor and Ciara for their top notch service and genuine caring personalities.

reviews_list.author: Melissa McCallihan
reviews_list.text: Mostly things are great. There's just some cleanliness issues in the hallways, stairwells and elevators. The same used tissue will be in the elevator for days, while the grounds are spotless and well maintained. I haven't figured out why things are out of balance in this way.

reviews_list.author: Alan Bradley
reviews_list.text: Jenna Taylor at Reserve at Round Rock was amazing to work with! Super responsive, really attentive, and always made time to answer all my questions. She made the whole leasing process easy and stress-free. Highly recommend her if you’re looking for a new place!

reviews_list.author: Nadine Fav8
reviews_list.text: Jenna Taylor is very knowledgeable, professional and obviously loves her job. I am very pleased with the staff here. Everyone is kind and attentive.  Gabriel and staff are always available to help with anything needed in my apartment. I would recommend The Reserve for your next home.

reviews_list.author: Pasca Opira
reviews_list.text: Check out The Reserve at Round Rock ..it is awesome! They have amazing apartments with tons of layout choices and a super friendly team that makes you feel right at home. They have everything you need at a location that can't be beat. You'll love how this community just feels right. Definitely a solid spot to call home.

reviews_list.author: david harrison
reviews_list.text: Love the apartment but the configuration is not good. All units including Summit should be 55 and up.

name: Autumn Leaves of Georgetown
description: Autumn Leaves of Georgetown is a assisted living facility in Georgetown, TX, offering assisted living facility, senior citizen center, aged care services. Rated 4 stars based on 28 reviews, they provide quality senior living communities for Williamson County seniors.
shortDescription: Autumn Leaves of Georgetown provides quality senior living communities for seniors in Georgetown, TX.

reviews_list.author: Veronica Beals
reviews_list.text: Autumn leaves is such a clean, loving community. I really love how involved staff is with residents from activities, to the being greeted when you first walk in. They provide exceptional memory care with a warm, compassionate staff who treat residents like family. Their monthly Family Nights are a standout feature, allowing loved ones to stay engaged and connected through fun activities and special events. The personalized care, dignity, and respect given to each resident will be a peace of mind. If you’re looking for a memory care community that values both residents and their families, I highly recommend Autumn Leaves! Great job guys, keep up the amazing work 🫶🙌

reviews_list.author: Bella Hardolzge
reviews_list.text:
I recently had the pleasure of attending a family day with my cousin, where I encountered a familiar face. As I was about to greet her, she was engaged in providing care to a resident. My family and I initially met Ana in 2023 at another facility, and she has consistently demonstrated a warm and compassionate demeanor, exemplifying a personalized approach to care.
Autumn Leaves is indeed fortunate to have her on staff, as she delivers heartfelt care to loved ones.
Reviews from various facilities consistently highlight her exceptional dedication.
Notably, Ana consistently goes above and beyond, performing tasks beyond her job description, including those that may be considered unpleasant.
As a Med-aid/Staff Coordinator and a Resident Assistant, she demonstrates unwavering commitment to her work.
Ana Pritchard provided care to my mother until her passing, and our family remains deeply grateful for her remarkable dedication.
It is clear that Autumn Leaves would be well-advised to retain her exceptional services. I informed my cousin about Ana, and I am delighted that my aunt has settled on this lovely and cozy facility.
Furthermore, Autumn Leaves is a very nice, clean, and well-maintained facility, with a staff and administrators who are highly engaging with the residents and exceedingly pleasant.

reviews_list.author: Masreth Fatima
reviews_list.text:
Autumn Leaves has been the perfect home for my Dad and for our family. My dad's health has improved in the last year with the care and love from the staff at Autumn Leaves. They have taken such good care of my Dad, I don't know how to thank them enough. The home is beautiful, comfortable, and a happy place for all the residents. The staff holds several activities throughout the month and engage the residents and families to be involved. We absolutely love the current staff with Sandra Jefferson as the Director, she is so professional and goes above and behind to provide care for the residents. Her loving personality along with her experience in care taking gives my family such peace of mind, knowing Dad is in good hands. Thank you Sandra for everything you do for my Dad!

The home also has support group meetings for loved ones to attend and connect with other families. I have gotten to know the residents family members very well and we help support and care for eachother.
The facility is clean and staff pays extra attention to ensuring all rooms are cleaned and each resident is getting care.
We are one family, we love all the residents and enjoy spending time with everyone.

Thank Autumn Leaves for all your hard work in caring for our loved ones. Highly recommend 10/10 stars.

reviews_list.author: Alice Moyal
reviews_list.text:
The topic of elder care is a deeply personal one for many. When my mother's needs of care were beyond what we could provide, the search for a proper facility became a focus for us. I toured and interviewed a dozen or so facilities in the Central Texas area. We settled on Autumn Leaves, and it has become a second home for my mother and a source of reassurance for our family.

The care provided to my mother has been nothing short of exceptional. From skilled nursing care to daily activities and everything in between, the entire team's dedication is palpable. The compassion with which they approach their work is reflected in the subtle nuances of care – the softness of tone when assisting with a task, the patience during mealtimes, and the love shown during moments my mother needs it most. It is a level of care that extends far beyond professional obligation; it is genuine and heartwarming. We feel mom is treated as an individual, with unique needs and preferences. The attention to personal care is meticulous. The staff took the time to understand my mother's history, likes, and dislikes, adjusting their approach with astuteness and finesse. Mom is encouraged to participate in activities. The calendar is filled with a variety of activities that engage and bring her joy. I've gotten photos of her dancing with a staff member, enjoying music played by guest musicians, and "bowling."

Autumn Leaves has created an environment that is not only aesthetically pleasing but also inherently designed for the safety and comfort of its residents. The facility is immaculate, providing a clean and serene environment that is conducive to comfort and happiness. The security measures in place are reassuring, ensuring that the vulnerable are protected and any risks are mitigated proactively.The staff is diligent in providing for the residents' needs, ensuring that they are comfortable not just physically, but also emotionally. My family and I find solace in the knowledge that mom is in such good hands.

My experience with Autumn Leaves in Georgetown has been a positive and enriching one, a beacon of hope in what can be a daunting phase of life for many. I write this piece not just to share my journey but to adamantly state that there are sanctuaries where the elderly are not just cared for, they are cherished.

The peace of mind that comes with knowing my mother is safe and comfortable is immeasurable.

reviews_list.author: Nurse Kathy
reviews_list.text:
Mother is doing well. 2nd month. Dogs can visit too with vaccination. Mom adjusted after a couple of months. I believe it is the family's decision making this emotionally tormenting time more aggressious with only 1 star reviews. These 1 star reviews have not seen some of the places I have visited over the last 2 years.

When mom first arrived back in July 2021, I came twice a week. First night mom was tired and I just put her in bed and she went into deep slumber. I gave The Reserves at Georgetown 5 Stars 🌟 because the program is ****Montessori. If you are not familiar with Montessori it's basically the caretakers gives care at the level the individual is at in their life.

My mother is absolutely physically healthy. Her brain may have lost memory but her body and character is still blossoming. Michele and Dorothy are two of my favorite employees there. They send me pictures, helped me in my personal grieving process. They keep me updated as I am a traveling nurse (25 years as RN). Giving the entire facility 1 star 🌟 as a health-care professional auditor shows "anger." Realistic expectations has to be understood by people who are not aware what actually is happening when you are not there. I am there. I see people doing pleasant activities or doing whatever they physically can do based upon Montessori.

My mother plays the Grand Piano daily. Her last facility made all residents stay in their rooms because of fear of CV19 and told her not to play the piano because of noise. My mother also functions as a "helper" in the nutrition department. She needs to be worthy or goal oriented so I asked if she could have a "Job." Mom believes she is there as a nutrition attendant. She absolutely loves telling me about her new role. I can't tell you how many things Michele and Dorothy do Monday-Friday to ensure my mom is happy. My mom is a hard person to manage because she is a born princess.

Yes, my mother can be a pain because she wants tons of attention but the facility gives my mother anything she needs and more. Her hair stylist colors and cuts her hair, mother's room is beautiful and spacious. The janitorial workers are always cleaning and shampooing the carpet, furniture, and touch surfaces. I maybe biased because I am a nurse. I don't see how anyone there could have bed bugs? The place is luxury living. The price point is right at moderate for accommodation.

My mother never danced in her life but is now full on dancing, fashion shows, and of course her avid love of music and Korean Netflix Movie.

I decorated my mother's suite. I am happy she has this beautiful place with real opportunities to continue to live forward to than to be at my home. We were so guarded that we both slept all the time and I had to tell my entire neighborhood to watch out for my mother wondering.

Mother says she is having fun. She also has friends too. As with all friends, she has fall outs but they make up after few days. She is like 16 years old (mentally) but actually 74. I am confident that no one there goes to work saying they are going to be "nasty, mean, unprofessional" intentionally. I haven't seen that but I had to rewrite my post because the Good News is our community does have a smaller 43 beds Memory Care Only Facility right in the heart ❤ of Georgetown,TX.

Thank you guys at The Reserves. You are amazing and I look forward to coming by soon. P.S. My mother says the food is delicious.

Thank you again! God bless you 🙏 and all His workers there at The Reserves in Georgetown!!!!

reviews_list.author: Susan Kosiba
reviews_list.text:
My heartfelt advice is to not move your loved one to Autumn Leaves at Georgetown.  They are not trained, staffed or skilled to deal with patients requiring memory care, regardless of what they tell you on your tour.   An outstanding memory care facility should work to divert patients and provide cognitive stimulation activities, physical activities (especially outdoors), gardening, art or music therapy, group activities, sensory stimulation, individualized activity plans and educational or informative sessions.  Autumn Leaves shuffles patients between the TV room and the dining room and has a morning exercise session that is led with minimal enthusiasm or attempt to engage the patients.    The building has a few beautiful outdoor, protected areas but in the two months my loved one was there, only one day saw the doors unlocked so the space could be utilized.   The majority of the patients spend most of their day crammed into one  living room with a random sitcom on the television.   A small group of patients walk the halls for hours at a time.

The line staff for the most part tries hard to care for the patients  but they are understaffed, overworked and only able to provide the most basic of care.  My loved one was also under the care of hospice.  Had we not had their oversight and direct care the situation would have been much worse.  Basic necessities were often neglected including feeding assistance,  toileting, clean bedding, clean clothing and most critically, timing of scheduled medications and nutrition.  Staff turnover is extremely high which exacerbates the situation and any needed sense of familiarity for the patient.

Over the time period we were at Autumn Leaves there were many issues raised to management and the responses were either defensive, denials or proclaiming that they would do better.  However they did not.   Any escalation to the corporate office also resulted in no improvement.  At the point where we realized we needed to move our loved one to a facility with a higher standard of care, their health unexpectedly declined rapidly and we stayed in place to maintain hospice continuity.   My sadness at losing my loved one is overwhelming but overshadowed by knowing the discomfort and poor care that they endured from Autumn Leaves in their final days.

reviews_list.author: Brian McNulty
reviews_list.text: Autumn Leaves of Georgetown has provided excellent care for my aunt since we moved her into the Georgetown facility in August. The staff provides compassionate care with dignity and respect for each resident. I highly recommend them.

reviews_list.author: Sandy Waters
reviews_list.text: My mother has been at Autumn Leaves for sometime now. I started to visit her in June 2024 with my daughter. I went 3 times with my daughter each time. She had to clean up bathroom full of BM. Take trash out. My daughter stopped going I go couple times a week and weekend. Autumn Leaves is a horrible place. I found my mother covered with feces. Plus her bedding, clothes and walls. Autumn leaves is not a certified memory care facility. It's listed as a nursing home. Autumn leaves doesn't have extra annuities. No chief . No farm to table food. No salon, no activities ( they just hired.Library. Movie night. Laundry service is not available right away. I waited 4 weeks. Housekeeping comes every 2 days. Movement exercises. It's all false advertising. Never an administration on duty ( should have 1) 24/7. Residents keys were taken away so they roam the hallways like Zombies. After lunch everyone inTV room aka zombie room.  Beautiful courtyard secured no they don't let residents outside. Now the do. I have called the health and human state agency 3 times. I've been there on weekends with only 1 caregiver and medication tech. Never enough staff which residents don't get care need. I had a meeting with VIP of operations from corporate office. We discussed serious issues. I even suggested outside volunteers. Beauty College learning to volunteer services. This will help students learn and residents could have an operating salon. No call button in room. No water available to drink. Residents are on their own. Even if my mother was not a resident. I would advocate for others residents. If no family is visiting they don't know how degrading and disrespectful this facility really is towards their family. I have pictures. Videos and audio. Caregivers are mostly there for the patients. Many don't stay long due to lack of support from management. Autumn Leaves is one the most expensive facility in Georgetown. Money that is not used to take care of your family member. VIP of operations made convenient problems solving issues. I have called her and messaged her no response. I contacted Senator Ted Cruz office about violating at Autumn Leaves Georgetown. I will be contacting local news channels to report false advertisement, one staff for whole facility. No administration is available. Never in office or building. Staff have no support, low wages, overworked, training?, caregivers cook but they have to have a food handler permit which a major violation. Please don't let Autumn Leave tell you about all the wonderful things they offer because they don't. Autumn Leaves is about getting more residents for financial reasons. Your welcome to ask me more questions , pictures and audio. Please visit as many facilities your can and I pray you find one that is honest. You can feel comfortable living your love one there. I worry nonstop about my mom. My situation is different I can't move her out. I have tried many many times to contact corporate in Grapevine Texas. I will make sure Autumn Leaves with have standards, guidelines, residents in mind and heart. Improve caregivers support, training , pay increases and what they job duties are. I was a childcare director for 30 years. Common sense if you don't have good/great staff. You will have a good business. Please be aware that everything I wrote is true facts.

reviews_list.author: Lisa Wimberly
reviews_list.text:
Our sweet mother was cared for by The Reserve for many years and we are so grateful for the compassionate care she received. The number of staff that it takes to meet the needs of residents is considerable and we were delighted at the warm relationships built from the personnel at this facility with our mother. I have memories of a variety of staff members across the building helping her with a need, providing a hug or a smile, showing kindness and love, respecting her personal preferences, understanding her facial expressions or loss of words, letting her visit their work space, painting her fingernails, providing her with snacks, keeping her hands busy, helping her with movement issues, etc. The friendly staff was a huge reason our mother was content.

The community atmosphere at The Reserve, with other residents around her dealing with similar issues, also helped our mother not feel so alone in the progression of dementia. She developed friendships with other residents and was able to spend time with others in a safe and caring place that met her daily needs.

Our mom especially enjoyed music at The Reserve whether it was special musical presentations and guests or music playing in the living areas. She appreciated the coffee table books on a variety of subjects with lots of pictures, and the pillows on the furniture. Our mother loved looking at the outdoor spaces or walking around the courtyards. She was comforted by holding baby dolls and feeling useful.

She was blessed by friendly staff to watchcare over her, a beautiful space to live, other residents to do life with, and fun activities and entertainment to give meaning to the days of her life. We are grateful for The Reserve and the respect and value they expressed in the care of our mom.

reviews_list.author: B Reyes
reviews_list.text: Autumn Leaves in Georgetown is an exceptional memory care with caring and attentive staff.A warm  and welcoming environment to all who reside there and visit this community.

name: Lakeline Oaks Retirement Community
address: 1905 S Lakeline Blvd, Cedar Park, TX 78613
description: Lakeline Oaks Retirement Community is a retirement community in Cedar Park, TX, offering retirement community, apartment building, apartment complex services. With a 4.9-star rating from 29 reviews, they are one of the highest-rated senior living communities providers in Williamson County.
shortDescription: Lakeline Oaks Retirement Community provides quality senior living communities for seniors in Cedar Park, TX.

reviews_list.author: Dawn Hawks
reviews_list.text: We are very pleased with our experience here at Lakeline Oaks. Our staff is excellent and friendly, showing concern and personal interest in each resident. Lakeline Oaks provides many opportunities for activities and engagement, and the common areas as well as the individual apartments are lovely. We whole-heartedly recommend Lakeline Oaks to our friends and neighbors.

reviews_list.author: Donna Price
reviews_list.text: We moved our father here 4 months ago and this has been the best place we could have ever expected. It is so clean, nice, and updated. The food is incredible and there are so many activities to keep anyone busy. They offer transportation and have regular outings. We feel very fortunate to have been able to secure a place here for him.

reviews_list.author: Janet Sheffield
reviews_list.text:
We celebrated my Mother, Molly Jacobi’s
birthday at Lakeline.  The kitchen staff:
Chris, Jada, Brayn, Ryan, Tyrone were EXCEPTIONAL!!!!!!  They arranged a WONDERFUL MENU!!!!   The food was DELICIOUS… especially the pork ribs!!!!!!
They made sure all were seated comfortably!  They set up a buffet line in the game room for us!!!  Drinks and foods were refilled without us even asking!!!!!
Lakeline is so LUCKY to have such a WONDERFUL STAFF like these people!!!!!
What is also ASTOUNDING IS THAT ALL ARE PLEASANT AND SMILE ALL THE TIME!!!!!!!  Truly AMAZING!!!!
But know that you HIT THE JACKPOT when you hired Kenny and Mary Lou to be the managers!!!!!!  Honestly, my family NEVER comes to Lakeline to see our Mother that we do not arrange to visit with them… and Kenny’s Mother!!!!  They are now our extended family!!!!!!
Bless all of you for allowing these WONDERFUL PEOPLE INTO THE LIVES OF OUR PARENTS…. As well as OUR LIVES!!!!!!
Thank you,
Janet Sheffield

reviews_list.author: Brent Clem
reviews_list.text: 5 stars doesn’t begin to describe the experience at Lakeline Oaks. My Mom has lived there for over 6 months and loves it and I sleep well knowing she is in an environment that is safe and very social. There are always activities and outings, the food and service are first class, and all of the employees take pride in their work. It’s a little bit more money than most but worth every penny.

reviews_list.author: William Smithwick
reviews_list.text:
Lakeline Oaks is a beautiful apartment complex with a warm friendly atmosphere. It's been easy to get to know our neighbors because residents wear name tags and have gone out of their way to make us feel welcome to the community. The management and staff treat the residents like family. Almost everyone knows each other by their first names. The dining room has a chef with a professional staff that do a wonderful job providing a diversified menu of delicious food and excellent service. We have really enjoyed their Sunday Brunches, Thanksgiving and Christmas dinners. The social calendar is very thoughtfully constructed with creative activities that are always a lot of fun! They have a beautiful movie theatre and show current titles as well as classics each week. They also have a hair salon in the complex and the beauticians do a wonderful job. We are so happy we found Lakeline Oaks, our mom really enjoys living in her new community with her new friends. It has exceeded all of our expectations in every way!
• • •

reviews_list.author: Kevin
reviews_list.text: Had a wonderful stay while visiting family. The staff could not be more friendly and helpful.

reviews_list.author: Steven Miller
reviews_list.text: My folks live at Emerald Oaks in San Antonio which is a Sister community to Lakeline Oaks and they were to book the guest suite here in town for a visit. I got to sit down to a lunch with them and the atmosphere, food and service was fantastic.

reviews_list.author: Kristy Swanson
reviews_list.text:
My husband, Jerry, and I lived in a similar RLC community in Nevada so when we moved to Texas, we wanted to live in an RLC community again. Well, we luckily found an RLC close to Austin called Lakeline Oaks located in Cedar Park, TX.  The minute I walked in the door and saw the beautiful Koi pond, I breathed a sigh of relief. I was home. Lakeline Oaks is second to none in their care of the residents. The staff is just outstanding. Our managers, Kenny and Marilou, are a joy: personable, thoughtful, and hands-on in making sure the residents are happy. We are also privileged to have an award winning chef, Chris, who, along with his sous chef, Ryan, prepares delicious food in an upscale, clean and well organized dining room run by Marc. Our servers are courteous and in every way, exceptional. We have extremely helpful  and caring concierges, Blake, Tosh and Daniel. The facilities are well cared for and the common areas bright and clean. There are many amenities: Weekly maid service - our housekeeper is Margarita and she is a doll.  Maintenance is run by Billy, a talented and reliable magician who can fix just about any ole' thing. Tracy is our bus driver and provides safe transportation for those who no longer drive. We have a busy hair and nail salon, a billiards room, a library, a poker room, a gym, and a theatre, just to name a few. Our Entertainment Director, Dina, organizes an abundance of fun activities from bingo, to card games, to yoga, to religious programs, to live entertainment during Friday Happy Hours. Residents can also host fun activities on their own. My favorite is "Round Table" run by one of our residents, Bob, where we discuss current events.  I would recommend anyone looking to make the move into independent living in the Austin area of Texas, to give our Senior Living Consultant, Jacqueline, a call and make an appointment to tour  Lakeline Oaks, in Cedar Park, TX.
...and, as the old saying goes...."We'll leave the lights on..."

reviews_list.author: Mercy Intexas
reviews_list.text: Lakeline Oaks is a great place for independent living if you can afford it. It's like living in a luxury hotel. All of the staff are friendly. The front desk guy, Blake, is the best!

reviews_list.author: Candace Lambert
reviews_list.text: Always well maintained, exceptionally friendly and helpful staff. The retirees living there seem very happy when we visit. Our loved one who resides there loves it! Great work LORC!!

name: Verena at Leander
description: Verena at Leander is a retirement community in Leander, TX, offering retirement community, apartment complex services. With a 4.5-star rating from 50 reviews, they are one of the highest-rated senior living communities providers in Williamson County.
shortDescription: Verena at Leander provides quality senior living communities for seniors in Leander, TX.

name: Bouquet Homes Assisted Living & Memory Care - The Primrose
description: Bouquet Homes Assisted Living & Memory Care - The Primrose is a assisted living facility in Round Rock, TX, offering assisted living facility, home health care service services.
