With a 4.9-star rating from 44 reviews, they are one of the highest-rated memory care providers in Williamson County.
shortDescription: Bouquet Homes Assisted Living & Memory Care - The Primrose provides quality memory care for seniors in Round Rock, TX.

reviews_list.author: James Roettgen
reviews_list.text: Rhonda spent some time with me and helped with lots of useful information even though my mother wouldn't be able to be placed here. She also has a passion to ensure veterans are looked after properly. If things were this wonderful without ever discussing if my mother could be placed here, then I can only imagine how great this facility's ability to provide care would be. Thank you.

reviews_list.author: Suzann Walsh
reviews_list.text: Moving my mom to Bouquet Homes was honestly the best decision for her and for us. The staff treats her like family, and it’s so comforting knowing she’s safe and happy. The house itself feels cozy and always clean. I’m just grateful we found them!

reviews_list.author: ReNisha Thompson
reviews_list.text: Bouquet homes is top tier! Staff is amazing including the manger and owner! I highly recommend the beautiful home for anyone needing excellent and exceptional care for their elderly loved ones! So much attention and love is poured into each resident! I don’t feel as if I’m just a family member of someone they care for but as though I am family!

reviews_list.author: Steve Abbott
reviews_list.text: After touring several larger assisted living facilities and not being impressed with what we saw and heard, we were told to check out The Primrose and we're so happy we did! There's more care, better food, nicer rooms, staff that seems happy to be there and genuinely knows every resident and their families. It's night and day! 100% recommend Bouquet Homes! We became very well researched on our local options and are very happy with our choice!

reviews_list.author: Vimala Kumar
reviews_list.text: Based on my experience in the healthcare industry, I am thoroughly impressed with Bouquet Homes. They maintain a low staff-to-resident ratio, ensuring each resident receives attentive care. The premises are regularly cleaned, and the atmosphere is warm and welcoming. The head nurse, Rhonda, is experienced, professional, and responsive to clients' needs. Alessandro and his team are compassionate and genuinely dedicated to creating a family-like environment, providing family members with peace of mind that their loved ones are well cared for. I would highly recommend them to anyone who is seeking this kind of care and accommodations for their loved one.

reviews_list.author: Alisha Paiva
reviews_list.text: Bouquet Homes is unlike any other. The facility is absolutely stunning with a warm and inviting atmosphere. I loved seeing residents enjoying the space, socializing, and participating in activities. The owner, Alessandro, and his staff are present, knowledgeable, and kind. You will have peace of mind knowing that your loved ones are safe and being treated like family.

reviews_list.author: Julie Garrett
reviews_list.text: How lucky we were to find the Primrose. My mom, who was 95 years old and suffering from dementia, didn't want to live away from family. Rhunda and all the caregivers were so kind and patient with my mom, making her feel comfortable. They gave her so much attention and love and treated her like their grandmother. We are so thankful for the staff taking such wonderful care of my mom.

reviews_list.author: Rachel Guerrero
reviews_list.text: Bouquet Homes is my absolute favorite personal care home in Williamson County.  Every time I have visited, the staff is very caring and loving to their residents.  I have referred a friend here and they were most pleased with the compassion that the entire staff and team provided. The dedication that the owner, Alessandro has for his residents, families and staff, is a beautiful blessing.  Rhunda, the home's manager, is dedicated to exceptional quality care and love to each of the residents as well. The home is always clean and smells wonderful.  You can simply feel the love when you walk in.  I can't wait for them to expand because we need more personal care homes with Alessandro's dedication to detail.  The Primrose tends to stay full because it is THE BEST.  Even if you think it isn't quite time, contact them to place your loved one on their waiting list.  You won't be disappointed even if it is for a much needed break to recuperate from your devotion and dedication to your family member.   Rhunda and Alessandro are there to help you with the next steps, even if it may not be time for a move, just yet.

reviews_list.author: B McBride
reviews_list.text: My husband has been at The Primrose for some time now, and overall, I’m very pleased with the care he’s receiving. The staff are attentive and treat him with respect, and it’s clear that they genuinely care about the residents. The facility is clean and well-kept, and the environment is welcoming.

reviews_list.author: Christina Roberto
reviews_list.text: What an amazing option for compassionate care for your loved ones!  I personally toured their community and was blown away.  Several of my family members spent time in a home similar to this, but Bouquet Homes is definitely a step above.  Allesandro and his staff truly care about their clients.

name: Round Rock Assisted Living
address: 16708 Marsala Springs Dr, Round Rock, TX 78681
description: Round Rock Assisted Living is a assisted living facility in Round Rock, TX, offering assisted living facility services. Rated 4.9 stars based on 9 reviews, they provide quality memory care for Williamson County seniors.
shortDescription: Round Rock Assisted Living provides quality memory care for seniors in Round Rock, TX.

reviews_list.author: jon wilke
reviews_list.text: My mom was a resident for just over a year.  I really appreciated Don's guidance through this process.  The staff is amazing.  They treated mom like family. There was always positive energy in the home.

reviews_list.author: Jennifer Guardiola
reviews_list.text: So homey and beautiful. Food is homemade and delicious. Caregivers were trained in dementia care and really love and care for the residents. Loved this place!!

reviews_list.author: Lisa Lindberg
reviews_list.text: Our mom has been under the care of Round Rock Assisted Living a little over a month now.  The care she is receiving is exceptional.  Don and all the caregivers there are amazing.  My mom has someone 24/7 there to help and take care of her and the other residents of the home.  As a family, we are so relieved knowing the care she is receiving.  She is doing better than she has in years.  We highly recommend talking to Don to see if RRAL is the place for your loved one.  We never could have imagined our mom would be in such a wonderful caring home.

reviews_list.author: Fred Miller
reviews_list.text: I was looking to find the perfect place for my mom, she had been in the hospital and needed more care than I could provide. I toured several options a while back, none of them were perfect.  While the home was reasonably  clean,  nicely furnished, and appeared to be run well, I did not pick this homely option. The atmosphere felt a bit disingenuous. While I typically support  small businesses, I was unable to warm up to this humble little place.  I am certain the rustic domestic environment is endearing to some, it was just not what I was looking for, for my mom.

reviews_list.author: Gloria Adair
reviews_list.text:
My mom is a resident at Round Rock Assisted Living and I'm thrilled to have here there. She gets excellent care and the staff and owner are very caring and kind to the residents. Such a great place for loved ones that need extra help and attention.
Gloria A.

reviews_list.author: Susannah Amiss
reviews_list.text: This place is wonderful!! I am a Home Health Clinician and I've been able to go in and out of this Facility ; Don, Cindy, and Mindy are really caring and hard working people who are so giving & attentive to their residents & family members, every day. Such an amazing and beautiful place.

reviews_list.author: Cystral Lynch
reviews_list.text: It's a very nice place to take mothers, great employees... owner is awesome and down to earth, he'll get his hands dirty to get the job done. Competitive salary for employees.

reviews_list.author: Cindi Valles
reviews_list.text: Such a wonderful environment with nice, caring staff. Such a warm atmosphere.

name: Avalon Memory Care
address: 2215 S Lakeline Blvd, Cedar Park, TX 78613
description: Avalon Memory Care is a assisted living facility in Cedar Park, TX, offering assisted living facility services. Rated 4.5 stars based on 16 reviews, they provide quality memory care for Williamson County seniors.
shortDescription: Avalon Memory Care provides quality memory care for seniors in Cedar Park, TX.

reviews_list.author: Margaret Hardy
reviews_list.text: Since Cecilia Garza, who goes by Cece, became the new director, the change at this memory care facility has been remarkable. She has truly turned the place around — from hiring a new cook to addressing staffing issues and holding people accountable. The facility and individual rooms are now consistently clean, the food is warm and good, and there is a noticeable sense of care and liveliness throughout the building. Most importantly, the residents are well cared for, and you can feel the difference in the atmosphere. I’m incredibly grateful for the improvements and the leadership Cece has brought.

reviews_list.author: rebecca fowler
reviews_list.text: The decision to place my family member in someone else’s care was a difficult one.  The moment I met with Kiley, I was comfortable with my decision.  The facility was clean, open floor plan , and the employees all had smiles. They quickly got to know my family member and took the time to account for his preferences, likes and dislikes.  Spoke to him by name, always treating him with respect.  Of the other facilities I visited, Avalon is hands down the best!

reviews_list.author: Cindy Sneed
reviews_list.text: Mom was in the best care I could have ever imagined at Avalon Memory Care. I found this place to be my second home. Several times per week I would look forward to visits and  got to know the staff, all the residents and their families. Avalon has a warm, home-like feel, not a cold facility feel. The time and attention the staff gave mom was above and beyond just their job. They loved her like their own mother and made her feel like the queen she was. Thank you Avalon. I will be back to visit soon!

reviews_list.author: Martha Meeks
reviews_list.text:
At first we blamed delusions. On days he wouldn’t wake up, or his speech was unusually slurred, we blamed the dementia. But the family began to notice more: his clothes were filthy, his hearing aids were never charged. Injuries were “falls”. His toenails were so neglected that we feared he could lose at least one toe. We moved him. The first week, he continually asked new caregivers, “Are you going to hurt me? Hit me? Pinch me? Push me?” Today, tho the dementia continues to steal his mind, he smiles. He’s relaxed. He’s so much better!
BEWARE of Avalon!

reviews_list.author: texas Vana
reviews_list.text:
Our family is deeply grateful for the care and compassion shown by Avalon to my great uncle during his time there. From the moment he arrived, it was clear that this facility was more than just a place—it was a community of caring individuals dedicated to their residents' well-being.

The staff treated my great uncle with dignity and kindness, ensuring he was comfortable, engaged, and well cared for until the very end. Their understanding of memory care and their patience with residents and families alike truly stood out. They not only supported him but also provided guidance and reassurance to us during a difficult time.

I would wholeheartedly recommend Avalon to anyone searching for a memory care facility for their loved one. Their commitment to excellence and genuine compassion makes all the difference. Thank you, Avalon, for everything you did for my great uncle and our family.

reviews_list.author: Lida Boland
reviews_list.text: Avalon Memory Care staff were always cheerful, helpful, and responsive to any expressed needs, changes, suggested foods, and the attitude/mood of my husband during his stay there (almost 22 months).  His room always smelled fresh and he was seldom left in a state of disarray if he was feeling good.  Staff were attentive to his needs, friendly and compassionate.  We were very well pleased with hus care.  I recommend Avalon for it's family oriented care and concern.

reviews_list.author: Slbrewha
reviews_list.text: I moved my mom in from a larger Assisted Living facility & even though she only lived two weeks at Avalon before she passed away I witnessed a great group of employees who helped her during her last days.  She was treated with dignity, respect, and compassion.  I saw the staff treat all the residents that way.  The staff also kept the facility very clean.  Very impressed with Avalon & thankful they were there when needed.  Thank you, Sharon Brewster

reviews_list.author: Lauren Galea
reviews_list.text:
I am in awe of the compassionate care provided by Avalon. My grandmother has been here for a few months now. I was quickly, and consistently have been, blown away by the genuine care, patience and immense sweetness shown to my grandmother by staff members.

I’m a helicopter granddaughter and have a 24/hr camera in my grandmother’s room. I check it often. I’ve been brought to tears by the patience, and tenderness that my grandmother is treated with especially in her most vulnerable moments. Dawn, Jay, Cleo, and Jennifer are staff members who I’ve spent meaningful time with and have absolutely blown by mind with their sweetness and care. Kasey, the ED is extraordinary. She is infinitely more involved, present, and invested than the ED at my grandmothers past facility.  It’s evident how deeply and truly she cares. It’s beautiful to see her spending time playing games and socializing with the patients. She clearly loves it and them. These people truly care. I don’t know how Kasey does it, but every single person I’ve seen her hire into the facility seems to possess genuine passion and care for the people they take care of. These people have one of the most difficult jobs in the world - and they show up with love and care every day. In my eyes they’re angels.

Couldn’t be happier with our decision to bring my grandmother to Avalon. During Nanna’s time at other facilities she was very unhappy to be away from home. It was beautiful and such a relief to see how at peace Nanna is at Avalon. I haven’t seen her this happy and peaceful since the initial fall that required her to have 24hr support. I think this is because she knows she is cared for and in good hands and enjoys her connection with the people caring for her. I sleep easy at night knowing my sweet grandmother is in their care. I’m so grateful.  Thank you Kacey and team.

reviews_list.author: Anne Kee
reviews_list.text: When it became obvious that I could no longer care for my husband at home myself we did a lot of research. Some years ago my father-in-law was in a memory care facility, and it was nowhere as nice as Avalon. We asked many questions and spoke to several different facilities. We spoke to our attorney that dealt in elder care. From him we learned what questions to ask and what to look for. The staff at Avalon was very caring and Jim soon adapted to living there. He even got gifts from the staff on his birthday. It was not a negative experience for him and for that we are so thankful.

reviews_list.author: Christine Hughes
reviews_list.text:
Even though he lived here at Avalon only a short time before passing away, my father was well taken care of. The staff is dedicated and kind. During his first few days, Dad was disoriented and scared at times. The staff anticipated this and gave him extra time and attention, sometimes just sitting in his room with him, watching TV or reading aloud to him. When they were briefly locked down for a positive Covid test, the staff made sure each resident got extra attention. One young staff member spent an HOUR in my dad's room, helping me get the new TV set up! My family and I were free to come any time and we were always welcome to participate in whatever activity was at hand. Dad was always clean and his room and bedding always fresh.
There is such a negative connotation with "putting your parents in a home" but that's unfortunate and unfair. The vast majority of people working in assisted living/memory care/nursing homes genuinely care for their residents, and treat them with kindness and gentleness. Besides, few and far between are those of us who can center their entire lives around physically caring for an elderly relative. My father, unfortunately, needed years of care before he passed. By allowing others like Avalon to help me with Dad's care, I was able to remain my father's daughter instead of becoming his nursemaid. I was able to avoid burnout, and able to walk in love alongside him during his final years. Avalon gave me that gift. Thank you, Avalon.

name: Georgetown Living - Assisted Living - Certified Alzheimer's Facility
description: Georgetown Living - Assisted Living - Certified Alzheimer's Facility is a assisted living facility in Georgetown, TX, offering assisted living facility, home health care service, nursing home services. With a 4.6-star rating from 31 reviews, they are one of the highest-rated memory care providers in Williamson County.
shortDescription: Georgetown Living - Assisted Living - Certified Alzheimer's Facility provides quality memory care for seniors in Georgetown, TX.

reviews_list.author: Beth Breidenbach
reviews_list.text:
We were so grateful to have dad be able to live here.  The caring and attention he received at Georgetown Living were excellent.

Dad needed iv antibiotics before coming here, and had to stay in a nursing facility until that treatment was done.  THAT experience taught us that a prettily decorated facility means nothing - it's the care , staffing level, and empathy of the caregivers that make the difference.

I visited dad multiple times a week and was always happy with how well dad was cared for at Georgetown Living.  I have recommended them to several other friends.

reviews_list.author: joy schneider
reviews_list.text: Dad has been at Georgetown Living for over 2 years. He has been loved and well taken care of the entire time he has been in this facility. Jane and the staff are very kind and considerate. The caregivers are engaged and caring. It is hard when your loved one has to go into this type of care but Georgetown Living has helped us make this hard transition. They communicate regularly and stay on top of any treatment or need Dad has. It is clean and Dad is well groomed. They make sure he eats and is well fed since he has difficulty feeding himself. I could not be happier with this facility and the peace I have leaving my father in their care. In my opinion there is not a better place for your loved one if they need this type of caregiving.

reviews_list.author: Dave Huset
reviews_list.text: My Mother-in-Law has been at Georgetown Living for over 2 years, and I have been very pleased with the care she has been receiving.  It is always clean and cheerful when I am there.  The staff is very attentive and pleasant, and the communication has been excellent.  My Mother-in-Law is very content and well cared for.  It is a relatively small facility and doesn't feel institutional at all.  It is a pleasant environment, and I am so happy that we were able to get her in to Georgetown Living.

reviews_list.author: Janet Harvey
reviews_list.text: We feel so grateful to have Georgetown Living taking care of Mom. Jane and Heather and the rest of the staff have been truly caring and very communicative. They really treat the residents and their families as if they are part of their own family. Their memory care is informed by the latest methods, and and they only do Alzheimer's care, so all the caregivers are well trained and very gentle with the residents. The caregivers really get to know the residents, down to details of their lives and what their favorite foods are, and treat them like part of the family. Thank you GL for making us part of your family!

reviews_list.author: Sue Marshall
reviews_list.text: The dedicated and committed administration and staff at Georgetown Living Alzheimer’s Community truly go beyond the highest standards of memory care for individuals and their families experiencing the sad and devastating consequences of dementia.  They are fully engaged in making each resident feel important, cared for, and take the time to bring joy and laughter to the daily activities.  After a bad experience at a large, corporate and poorly run facility, the friendly, homelike, peaceful and rural environment of Georgetown Living is exactly what I think helps the residents feel safe and calm.  I am so grateful that my husband is there.  As one of only a few Alzheimer’s Certified communities in our area, I highly recommend them without hesitation. They are the best.

reviews_list.author: Gary Allison
reviews_list.text: Georgetown Living is the best. The staff is just amazing and gives such great care to my Mom. Alzheimer's is very difficult and the whole team at GL does everything possible to make it easier. Georgetown living is a wonderful, small home environment and feels very personal. They truly care for your loved ones and are very attentive to their needs. We appreciate all they do for us!

reviews_list.author: Daniel Pace
reviews_list.text: Georgetown Living has been taking care of my Mom for a couple of years now and the staff is outstanding. They genuinely care about the people living there. It's so nice to have a small facility so she gets plenty of attention and it's super easy to visit and spend time with her. I've had no issues with her health and they have been great at accommodating various needs like physical therapy.

reviews_list.author: Marc T.
reviews_list.text: From our first visit to Georgetown Living, it was apparent the staff truly does care for their patients.  My father as been in their care for just over a year now and the entire team there has made this transition much easier than I thought possible.  I'm there 4-5 times a week and amazed at how each faculty member there provides my dad with the patience and understanding that goes with his memory loss.  I'm truly thankful for Georgetown Living and the wonderful work force that tenders care and compassion to not just my dad but to all of the people in their care.

reviews_list.author: Randall Scrivener
reviews_list.text: I am happy to recommend Georgetown Living to anyone looking for a quality facility for a loved one or family member who needs specialized memory care.  My mother has been a resident for almost a year; I live close by and see her most every day.   She gets the medical, nursing, doctor and therapy care she needs; the staff quickly learned her likes and dislikes (give her something chocolate and sweet and she’s your good buddy!) and they treat her with love and affection.  What I appreciate most when I visit, however, is not so much how the staff interacts with her, because when I am visiting she usually does not require a lot of attention; it is the attention and encouragement I see the other residents getting when they have no family members present.  Problems are handled calmly; everyone is treated with respect.  Seeing the staff care for the residents in such personal ways gives me confidence that my mom also receives this same care when I am not there!

reviews_list.author: Roger G
reviews_list.text: Georgetown Living has been the perfect place for my mother to feel safe, secure and well taken care of. They have a wonderful variety of activities to engage a wide range of interests. It has taken such a burden of worry off my family's and my shoulders seeing how well mom is cared for. We're so thankful and grateful for Georgetown Living!

name: Sundance Memory Care at Brushy Creek
address: 3000 Glacier Pass Ln, Cedar Park, TX 78613
description: Sundance Memory Care at Brushy Creek is a nursing home in Cedar Park, TX, offering nursing home, adult day care center, home health care service services. Rated 3.7 stars based on 22 reviews, they provide quality memory care for Williamson County seniors.
shortDescription: Sundance Memory Care at Brushy Creek provides quality memory care for seniors in Cedar Park, TX.

reviews_list.author: Sherrie Gilbert
reviews_list.text: My father has been living here for 2 years after his condition started to decline. I knew he would be needing 24 hour care, and after receiving a recommendation from a caregiver concierge about Sundance Memory Care being the best place to help him, I decided to give them a call, and I am so glad I did. I am very thankful for this facility and especially their employee Renate who has been a blessing for my father, always making sure he is well taken care of. She sends me photos of him, makes sure he is ready to go on time for drs appointments, and she just keeps me up to date on how he is doing, which helps me feel comforted in knowing that he is well taken care of. I am also thankful for Lena who has always been very helpful on the administration process. Everyone I have spoken with and know at this facility has always been very helpful and caring. I easily recommend this place to help take care of your loved one.

reviews_list.author: ndamon
reviews_list.text: Sundance is amazing!  After Dad had "Gone to Glory" we needed to find a memory care facility for Mom.  I feel like we struck gold.  It has been several weeks now, so I believe I have a good feel for how things are.  I visit almost daily, at all different times of day.  The caregivers are all friendly, happy, and most importantly caring.  All of the staff is wonderful and open to talk about anything.  The activities they provide are appropriate to the residents capabilities.  I love how they use the "Montessori method" with residents, allowing them to have choices of what they want to do, eat, participate in, even when they feel like going to bed.  Sundance IS their home, and the people who work there strive to make the residents feel totally comfortable.   I go often, not because I feel like I need to "check up" on things, but because it is enjoyable to be there.  You can feel the LOVE.

reviews_list.author: Michael Blackburn
reviews_list.text: I’m at Sundance nearly every day and I love walking through those doors. I was in a bad spot with my mom where she was previously. She had no supervision or care. I worried about her when I wasn’t there. Two staff for the whole community of 30 people. I even heard from a staff member that they would “hide” my mom in her room when they were giving tours. My mom needed a higher level of care than she was being provided and that’s exactly what she’s given here at Sundance. The best decision I ever made (regarding my mom’s care) was to move her. Sundance has become a part of my family. Holly, Renate, Sarah, Kelly and Jillian are all incredibly nice and helpful. The caregivers love the residents and it’s nice to see the same faces when I walk in to visit. They have slowly come to know my mom even better than I do. Anytime someone talks to me about needing care for their loved one, I tell them Sundance without a moment’s hesitation. I know they will be as pleased with care as I have always been. It helps that the building was well thought out. It is resident-friendly and promotes the residents’ ability to be independent. I also regularly eat meals with my mom and can attest that the food is delicious.

reviews_list.author: Kim Conley
reviews_list.text: I think Sundance Memory Care is a really wonderful place! I have been a hairdresser/family friend of L's for almost five years and I have been a regular guest of hers at three difference places she has lived in the Cedar Park/Leander area. I have never seen Miss Louise happier than she is here at Sundance. She gets a lot of personal care from all of the kind people who work here. She always looks well tended to and always has a smile on her face. If I ever need anything on my weekly visits here the staff is always so quick to respond and is always so friendly to both myself and Louise. If my mom were in need of a memory care community, this would be the only place I would choose. I think both Holly and Renate as well as every member of the staff that I have had the pleasure of meeting are all awesome. Keep up the good work!

reviews_list.author: Melanie Orris
reviews_list.text: I really think the people who left the 2 bad reviews are leaving them for another facility... NOT Sundance. I disagree a million grand times with those reviews. I can not be any happier with the care my mom is getting.  I am at peace with how my mom is flourishing in the Montessori program at Sundance. It is unbelievable how they provide a purpose for daily living. Montessori approach is creating an environment that engages people to be independent in every aspect of themselves which in turn gives them a sense of purpose, dignity, and trust. I always thought, if I ever had children I would send them to Montessori school. Switching roles with my mother from child to caregiver I am happy I still held on to that dream and chose Montessori for my mom. I have kept my promise not to just “put my mom away in a nursing home”.. She is LIVING at Sundance (her new home) with amazing people, thriving, and enjoying stellar quality care. The staff have been like no other- I have several of their phone numbers in my phone along with the owner Matt. They are ALWAYS within a texting reach or phone call. They always respond! During these hard times with Covid, Lena and Renate have been so understanding and accommodating with setting up Skype and FaceTime for my mother and I to visit any time I want. The owner, Matt... There is no other person on this planet I have ever met who has genuinely cared so much for me and my mom. He has spent a lot of time with me, especially in the beginning of the transition from home to Sundance. He sympathized right along with me when times were hard and always reassured me it will get better. He has really set the bar extremely high! Matt has also included me in weekly webinars about Montessori and Dementia which have been so very helpful for me to understand the disease. I knew literally nothing about dementia before I met Matt. We were lost and I was very scared I was not going to be able to find proper help for my mom who is a retired nurse. I only wanted the best because I know she deserves it- she has cared for people her whole life... Sundance has changed our lives for the better because of how they respect my mom for the life she led prior to dementia and they give her purpose. Also, Matt has been excellent through the whole Covid shutdown. Very very strict on keeping the residents safe beyond all means and I really appreciate that. His staff has made unbelievable commitments to 100% shelter in place other than going to Sundance to take care of some of the most vulnerable people for work. I have felt so safe for my mom to be there when other senior facilities have fallen short and had covid breakouts. I could seriously write a booklet on how Sundance is the bees knees lol. I feel like the luckiest girl and I feel like my mom must have been a saint in her past life because she is the luckiest of all. Oh! and my mom loves the food. All the residents have a hand in menu planning whether it is cotton candy or NY strip steaks, Sundance accommodates. She likes to tell me she is the "Dietary Director".. Simply warms my heart.

reviews_list.author: rose pijaca
reviews_list.text: This place is really truly terrible. First to start, my grandfather had thousands of dollars worth of items stolen from him and his room. We still don’t know where they went. Then, he was pushed by another member ( they have dimenta- these things happen) but when it came time for an incident report, they tried to hand us false documentation that stated he fell. Until we played a recording of a worker stating he was pushed by such member. Then, he ended up weeks later after no one got him help, needing hip surgery. After that surgery he went back to sunflower. They did not give him the proper care, cleaning, taking care of him etc. he had to go back to the hospital for emergency surgery to get rid of MRSA. ( when I visited they had dirty clothes and diapers shoved in random places in the room). This place is not fit to take care of absolutely any human being, let alone an elderly person in need. I am so disheartened by how they did everything. When we removed him, not one person asked how he was doing. How he is, or felt sorry for what has happened to him. If you love your loved ones; do not send them to this place. Please.

reviews_list.author: Tammy Quarles
reviews_list.text: I’ve had an excellent experience here! I live an hour away and they take the best care of my father and it’s so relieving knowing he’s safe and cared for here. He needs 24 hour care and it’s been so high quality. He talks about Renate and how good she is with him, she’s his favorite. He has been there about 2 years now. They’re all so kind to him and help us the best way they can.

reviews_list.author: Derek Steffen
reviews_list.text:
As a risk management specialist and past counselor to those with brain injuries, I cannot recommend Sundance Memory Care at Brushy Creek and the Sundance team enough! It is clear through their usage of the Montessori approach that they put their residents needs first. In the conversations I have had, and in the personal reviews and onsite visits I have conducted, this facility is top notch. The owner, Matt Stanley is extremely driven to care for his residents, and it shows through his actions and regular on-site activities. If you dont believe me, call the community and ask to connect with Matt. Matt knows each of his residence names, their stories, their likes and their dislikes. He is a true leader within his communities and our community.

One of the biggest issues in the US right now is that many tend to lose site of our seniors, they forget that they are people too, and often they become invisible. Fortunately for all of us there is Sundance. The Sundance team clearly takes time to learn each residents abilities, likes, and uses those to help guide them while in their care.

Choosing a care giver/memory care facility for those we love can be an extremely difficult task, but knowing there are people and organizations out there like the Sundace team helps me sleep at night. keep up the great work, and thank you for your incredible efforts in taking care of our seniors!

reviews_list.author: Melissa Moore
reviews_list.text: I appreciate everything the AWESOME staff at Sundance has done for my mom. I truly believe the way they all loved on her helped her to adapt to group living. She had lived alone for so long and fought us (her family) whenever we tried to get her out to mix and mingle. It took a little time, but not nearly as long as I had anticipated. The morning crew made her feel so welcome, always having her "cup of the good stuff" (aka hot chocolate) ready by the time she reached her chair. It was great seeing her start to express joy and excitement again, even cracking jokes from out of nowhere. Her speech therapist noted the change. She tested higher on her assessments at Sundance than when at home. The socialization and activities that you all have set up made the difference. I will be forever grateful!!

reviews_list.author: Worlanda Williams-Neal
reviews_list.text:
A family member was a resident in this facility until the staff left him in his bed for almost 8 hours with a dislocated hip. My daughter and I were on our way for our visit when she received a call from the OWNER Matt Stanley which we thought was strange. Matt said he was ordering a mobile x-ray because he was acting like his leg hurt. He was in bed when we arrived at the facility. The direct care worker (DCW) said he had been in bed since her duty began and told us that the DCW on the previous shift said they showered him and noticed he would not stand on his leg.

We get to his room, and he's lying in bed, rolling his hands and having a frown on his face. My daughter called his name and tried to sit on the bed near him, and he grimaced. She pulled back the covers, and I tell you I went screaming, "Call 911 right now and get an ambulance here NOW". What kind of freakin place would leave a DV patient in a bed all day with a dislocated hip! Ray Charles could see his hip was dislocated.

The fire department and ems came, and they were so gentle with him and made sure even though they knew he didn't understand, they took the time to tell him what they were doing. They lifted him like a baby and took him to the hospital for surgery.

My daughter goes every day to make sure he is OK. Just think, if she had not been there, and how long would they let him remain in that condition? Check on your people, please.

name: University Village Memory Care
address: 4701 Campus Village Drive, Round Rock, TX 78665
description: University Village Memory Care is a assisted living facility in Round Rock, TX, offering assisted living facility services. Rated 5 stars based on 13 reviews, they provide quality memory care for Williamson County seniors.
shortDescription: University Village Memory Care provides quality memory care for seniors in Round Rock, TX.

reviews_list.author: Monica Aguilar
reviews_list.text:
If I could give 10 stars I would!! University Village Memory Care is truly the best memory care community. The staff—especially Terra, Donnetta, Dorie, and the caregivers—are some of the kindest, most compassionate people I have ever met. They are incredibly patient with my mom and took the time to truly get to know her as a person, not just a resident.

I live far south and drive over an hour to visit, and I do so with complete peace of mind knowing my mom is genuinely well cared for. She is safe, supported, and—most importantly—actually enjoying her time there. That alone means everything to our family.

If you are looking for a memory care community where your loved one will be treated with dignity, kindness, and genuine love, I cannot recommend University Village Memory Care enough.

reviews_list.author: Lisa Dragoset
reviews_list.text: University Village is truly the best of the best! The staff are patient and kind with both residents and family members. The care coordinators and many of the staff have been there for years. The most amazing thing is how happy most of the staff are! I mean, their job is one of the hardest on the planet - caring for people whose brains are being ripped apart by disease and who can no longer communicate with the rest of us in a normal way. And yet, many of the staff members go through their whole day with a smile on their face and love in their hearts - it is truly amazing! Thank you, Terra, Dorie, Donnetta, Abby, Mardi, Craig, and all the staff, for everything you have done and everything you continue to do! We deeply appreciate you.

reviews_list.author: Peggy Wilson
reviews_list.text: Terra and all of the staff at University Village are incredible.  We are so grateful we had our Mom there, and even more grateful for the care provided.  The facility is small, so the ratio of staff to residents is really good.  In addition, there is an onsite Hospice and Home Health facility that was able to complete my Mom's care until she passed away. Terra focuses on her staff and does everything she can to keep them happy working there. Many have been there for years.  Also, you get to know the caregivers well.  She has two resident care managers, that are always available, and extremely responsive to any questions or updates.  They are happy to communicate by text, email or phone.  The facility has alot of natural light and open areas.  The kitchen is like one in a lovely home.  They even have a labradoodle named Sophie that lives there and visits every so often.  I highly recommend University Village Memory Care and Assisted Living for your loved one.

reviews_list.author: Larry Cohrs
reviews_list.text:
I want to publicly commend University Village Memory Care for the excellent care for nearly 9 years for my brother Dale Cohrs. From all the parts of my brother’s care over those years he had beyond above average care from all the loving folks that have worked there over the years. I don't know how they find their employees but whatever method they use is has to be very thorough to have such great staff. I have visited many care facilities over the years and never have I seen such loving and caring folks all in one place. With many folks with mental and physical afflictions of all sorts they handle it well. The atmosphere in the place in my opinion is uplifting to a patient in their conditions. I always felt at home with all that worked there! They love to see family involved with the persons they care for. Of course with humans there can be a problem crop up but if that ever happens they are quick to act, they listen to family concerns, and the patient is at their upmost importance. I doubt that there is another facility like this on in the area.
I'm saying you will have to look long and hard to find any better facility to care for you loved one!!! My brother was buried today from complications of Alzheimer's which had suffer may years with along with a stroke that disabled him at the early stages of Alzheimer.
I thank everyone at this facility for the excellent care and love you bestowed on my brother and my family members.
Larry Cohrs

reviews_list.author: Michelle Pollock
reviews_list.text: We have moved my dad numerous times before coming to UVMC. My dad was diagnosed with Lewy Bodies and has a number of other mobility and health issues. He has improved since coming to the facility. Terra and the team are outstanding.

reviews_list.author: Abby Reeves
reviews_list.text: University Village has the most caring and attentive staff.  The staff goes above and beyond for all of their patients and families; each one of them truly have a passion for their jobs and it shows! This is an amazing community.

reviews_list.author: Mardi Benedict
reviews_list.text: University Village has an amazing, welcoming staff. Really, really outstanding care! It feels like  a family setting  and you can see that this culture radiates from the smiles and happy attitudes of the residents.

reviews_list.author: Bob Frazier
reviews_list.text:
University Village Memory Care is without a doubt, the best possible solution for the needs our of family members.  My father in law was in need of a place that was good with memory loss and UVMC exceeded our expectations.

What makes UVMC special is how they care not only for the patient, but also the needs of the family.  My father in law just past away and UVMC ensured he was cared for, but also made sure we were comfortable and have everything we needed in his last few days.

Watching the staff at UVMC and how they truly care, ( praying with and crying for the my father in law)  and seeing the relationships they develop with the residents is very touching.  I only wish I could express how I feel with a rating higher than 5 starts.

reviews_list.author: Jo Anna McGinnis
reviews_list.text: I can’t say enough good comments to explain the wonderful care my mother received here. The staff here is patient and they truly care about their residents. The nurses, managers, and all the staff are really wonderful at what they do. They treated my mom like family and were truly amazing.

reviews_list.author: Donna Bender
reviews_list.text: The best staff, caring and they are all accommodating with a great sense of humor... good food for residents.

name: A Touch of Home
description: A Touch of Home is a assisted living facility in Round Rock, TX, offering assisted living facility, home health care service, hospice services. Rated 4.8 stars based on 19 reviews, they provide quality memory care for Williamson County seniors.
shortDescription: A Touch of Home provides quality memory care for seniors in Round Rock, TX.

reviews_list.author: Keshia Paniagua
reviews_list.text: A Touch of Home is a wonderful establishment. The environment is warm and welcoming, and the staff treat residents with genuine care and respect. You can feel the family-like atmosphere the moment you walk in, and it’s clear the residents are well cared for and comfortable. I highly recommend!

reviews_list.author: Winifred Ebele
reviews_list.text:
Exceptional Care and Compassion!

I am thrilled to give A Touch Of Home Assisted Living a well-deserved 5-star review! My loved one has been a resident here, and I have witnessed firsthand the outstanding care and compassion provided by the entire team.

The staff are warm, friendly, and genuinely caring, always going the extra mile to ensure the residents' needs are met. The care home itself is very well maintained, with a warm and welcoming atmosphere that feels like home away from home.

I recommend them to anyone.

reviews_list.author: Engr. Kemjika Nwoke-Ekpo
reviews_list.text:
I am absolutely delighted with the care and support my beloved Aunt has received at A Touch Of Home Assisted Living. The staff are truly exceptional - well-trained, friendly, and genuinely caring. They go above and beyond to ensure the residents feel comfortable, safe, and supported.

The care home itself is immaculately maintained, with a warm and welcoming atmosphere. The facilities are top-notch, and the activities and events organized by the staff are engaging and enjoyable for the residents.

But what really sets them apart is the quality of care provided. The staff are attentive, responsive, and knowledgeable, and they work tirelessly to meet the unique needs and preferences of each resident.

I have complete peace of mind knowing that my Aunt is in such capable and compassionate hands. I would highly recommend them to anyone seeking a care home that truly delivers exceptional care and support.

Thank you to the entire team at A Touch Of Home Assisted Living for all that you do!" 🙏

reviews_list.author: Elizabeth H
reviews_list.text:
When your loved one needs more care than you can give them, it can be tough to know where to start your research. Of course, you want to be prepared and provide your loved one with the best care possible.  My family and I were extremely lucky to find A Touch of Home for my Mom. The environment they have created at A Touch of Home is calm, safe, and has become familiar for my Mom.  I am confident that she is provided with the safety, care, dignity, and quality of life she deserves on the daily basis.

A Touch of Home implements daily routines that have helped ground my Mom and eliminate some confusion and frustration she previously experienced while living at home. The activities such as group exercise, games and crafts have helped give my Mom a sense of independence and accomplishment.

The owners and staff at A Touch of Home continue to be extremely patient and help my Mom through any difficult experiences. Their trained and licensed staff including Doctors and nurses are available 24/7, ensuring that my Mom always receives the assistance she needs at any time of the day or night. I have complete peace of mind that my Mom receives the utmost best quality of care at A Touch of Home. I highly recommend this assisted living facility to anyone looking for care for their loved one.

reviews_list.author: Linda Lang
reviews_list.text: A Touch of Home has been a very loving and kind place for my mom.  Everyone is so sweet.  They care for each one of their clients with tenderness & love.  Teresa goes above & beyond to make sure everyone is safe & comfortable.  I highly recommend this home.  It is truly one of the best in the area.  The grounds are well maintained, & everyone loves the back yard deck with shaded tables & comfortable seating.

reviews_list.author: Cristy Brannan
reviews_list.text: I toured this assisted living for my Mom.  The property is nestled in a very nice community and feels like you are coming home.  The acre lot has a neat forest with a walking path and a huge inviting deck.  The staff and owner seem very friendly and engaging, and mealtime looked organized and healthy.  We will definitely will be considering the home when my Mom is ready.

reviews_list.author: Mark Mahoney
reviews_list.text:
If you are looking for a place for you mom, look no further.
A Touch of Home met her needs and made us feel comfortable in the care and love she received from them.
Leaving a loved in the care of someone else is never easy, there are plenty of big places out there, but at this stage in our mom’s life, she needed a small place, that knew her, and was willing to give her the extra attention she needed, when she needed it.
A few things I really liked.
•	It’s smaller place I think a max of 15 patients.
•	I met the owner, she spoke with us often, and let us know when there were issues, or mom needed something beyond the normal.
•	They treated her with respect and love, not as a customer, but as family…
•	It’s also all ladies
I can’t say enough positive things about our mom’s  about having our mom there.

reviews_list.author: Michelle Knight
reviews_list.text: I can't recommend this place enough! My mother has lived at A Touch of Home for 6 1/2 years.  She has many health issues. The staff has always taken wonderful care of her.  Theresa ( the owner) has beenthere for anything we need help with. I can call/text her and she always reply's. She has made lots of friends. My mother is now on Hospice. It is so nice to know she will be able to stay at A Touch of Home with her friends until she passes.  We are so blessed to have found A Touch of Home!

reviews_list.author: Meredith Todd
reviews_list.text: My mother has been a resident there for 6 months. Theresa and the staff have been wonderful. I could not have asked for better communication to help mom get settled and make sure her needs are met. When she lived on her own I was always worried about her, I don’t worry anymore. She loves being with the other residents and the staff. Very thankful for A Touch of Home.

reviews_list.author: Kelly Stueve
reviews_list.text: We had my husbands mom at A Touch of Home for some time before she needed extensive care.  She was very well taken care of by the healthcare providers.  Everyone was very kind and responsive to our requests  as well as her needs.

name: The Waterford at Round Rock
address: 7230 Wyoming Springs Dr, Round Rock, TX 78681
description: The Waterford at Round Rock is a retirement community in Round Rock, TX, offering retirement community services. Rated 4.1 stars based on 49 reviews, they provide quality memory care for Williamson County seniors.
shortDescription: The Waterford at Round Rock provides quality memory care for seniors in Round Rock, TX.

reviews_list.author: elizabeth alvarez
reviews_list.text: I attended the family support group at The Waterford at around Rock and was so impressed! The staff was incredibly welcoming and made me feel comfortable right away. The building itself is beautiful—warm, clean, and inviting, with a very positive atmosphere. The speaker did a wonderful job explaining the different types of dementia and shared helpful ways to cope and better support my loved one. I left feeling informed, encouraged, and grateful for the experience. Highly recommend this facility and their support programs!

reviews_list.author: Patrick Moran
reviews_list.text:
The Waterford at Round Rock (formally the Rose at Round Rock) is in transition in 2024.  New company means new policies and management.  Some directors and support staff were recently released.  As such, there is a lot of new norms being established at time of this writing.

My mother is a newer memory care resident, and this review is of her first 6 months.
Pros:
*  Staff is diligent in supporting my mother.   Bathing, simple medical needs, feeding, all meet expectations.
*  Our room spacious and is well apportioned; 2 closets and full walk-in shower.  Overlooking garden areas.
*  Memory care area is very large compared to many other facilities in the Round Rock/Cedar Park areas.  This allows residents to move around, and, if desired, obtain some level of privacy.
*  They have normal daily activities.  But best are the days the little service dogs come and visit with residents.
*  Occasional wine mixer events.
*  The experience with the memory care staff, for me, has been excellent.  They are communicative when issues are found.  And available to me without any managerial filtering (a welcome change from other facilities.

Cons:
*  Management turnover in our 6 months has been very, very high.  At times I don't know whom to contact.
*  On-site playground needs updating.  Our grandkids came and found the site lacked end of slide soft landing materials, and the wooden playscapes are in dire need of sanding to remove spurs.  Better yet, full replacement with more modern materials.
*  Meals is always an item that can be improved.  In general, it is just okay.  A wider selection of soft foods would be welcomed.
*  Within the first month one hearing aid was lost within the memory care center.  Which of course required replacement and was an avoidable cost if properly managed.

reviews_list.author: Kit Friedrichs
reviews_list.text: Great experience touring with Leann, Director of Sales. Nice to meet Megan the ED  and Kayla the DOAL. Very friendly team and staff. Clean and very attractive AL and MC community. Looking forward to recommending clients to The Waterford in Round Rock!

reviews_list.author: Cheryl Miller
reviews_list.text: Beautiful place, friendly staff, Dr Smith is very happy there! Guests are always welcome. Loved it!

reviews_list.author: Tim Carter
reviews_list.text: The staff has been very helpful with trying to keep Dad healthy. Their monitoring program has engaged the proper medical evaluation and healing teams necessary.  From inhouse physical therapy, blood pressure, and other health checks the staff has kept him alive and truckin'.  He enjoys 3 meals aday. Getting some needed rest.  I hope he will continue to enjoy this location, the Waterford at Round Rock.

reviews_list.author: Denise Wilkerson
reviews_list.text: The staff are great. They have made not only my mom but all of the family feel very welcome. It is such a relief for my mom to be in a place where she she is not alone can make new  friends and really enjoy life. Thank you!

reviews_list.author: Cyndi Neff
reviews_list.text:
My parents have lived at the Waterford at Round Rock for 6 months now. Their health is so much better since moving in, thanks to well balanced, delicious meals. They are actually blooming.
There is always some form of recreation to be experienced, and the smiling staff are so helpful with even the smallest request. The chef is a culinary artist, which makes Dad look forward to every meal. Mom has always been a picky eater but is finding so many new foods that she likes (plus the deserts!!) Best decision!

reviews_list.author: Donnie Strybos
reviews_list.text: Very clean, well staffed. The dining facility is wonderful. The fireplace in the front sitting area is a very relaxing touch

reviews_list.author: Melissa Cereceres
reviews_list.text: The staff and management here are phenomenal. Meg and her team treat the residents like their family and it shows. I would recommend The Waterford for assisted living and they have a wonderful memory care unit too!

reviews_list.author: Jeff Jones
reviews_list.text:
My feedback is I don’t want to have to take the survey every single time I come to visit my mother. Please correct this.

If I have feedback to give, I will provide it personally rather than through an online survey.

name: The Cottages at Chandler Creek
address: 2351 N A W Grimes Blvd, Round Rock, TX 78665
description: The Cottages at Chandler Creek is a assisted living facility in Round Rock, TX, offering assisted living facility services. Rated 3.7 stars based on 21 reviews, they provide quality memory care for Williamson County seniors.
shortDescription: The Cottages at Chandler Creek provides quality memory care for seniors in Round Rock, TX.

reviews_list.author: Fabienne Cattell
reviews_list.text: The Cottage North and South are committed and dedicated to offering personalized support to each resident. Each facility has expertise in addressing the needs of residents with cognitive disorders. The amazing staff including myself makes sure that the people who have lost all or some of their autonomy feel safe. The warm, friendly, and family like atmosphere makes them feel like they are living at home.  The daily fun activities , services, and comfort offered help maintain the independence and serenity essential to aging well. Everyday, as an Activity Coordinator for Divinity Hospice, I enjoy making a difference in their life and seeing a big smile on their face.  For sure, they enjoy the weekly live music, dancing, singing, bingo and different games. If you have a love one who needs special care I would highly recommend The Cottages.

reviews_list.author: Garner Vogt
reviews_list.text: My mother has been a resident at the cottages for 2 years. She reports that the staff are kind and very generous. The entire facility is very clean and well managed. My mom is genuinely happy and always well taken care of. I can recommend the cottages without reservation.

reviews_list.author: M A
reviews_list.text: Had my mom here for a couple months- if you love your family do not put them in this facility. They’re dismissive and neglectful. I spoke to a woman named viola she screamed at me over the phone then hung up in my face. Took my mom out of this facility immediately

reviews_list.author: Mindy Powell
reviews_list.text: My Mother was at the Cottages for 1.5 years.  They were attentive and those caregivers that got to know my Mom showed devotion and compassion.  The Executive Director, Maryjane, knows how to run a memory facility.  She is very involved with the residents and extremely responsive to family.  I loved the activities that were planned as it broke up the monotony of the day to day for my Mother.  They hosted some beautiful parties that were such fun and festive. My Mom was always clean and she enjoyed the food.  Her room always spelled good and was clean. She had 2 cats and several staff members really took to them and helped to clean their litter boxes and feed them.  When you are placing a loved one, no place is perfect - even home with a full-time caregiver.  What makes a difference is getting to know the leadership and the staff and making frequent visits.  The Cottages truly became part of what I consider our family. We will miss seeing their faces and their love and care.

reviews_list.author: introspective healer
reviews_list.text: It has taken me nearing two years to write this review regarding this facility. This facility has an interesting dynamic – management does not know how to speak to their employees or diffuse or handle situations “professionally”. I observed while visiting on several occasions the way this specific facility is ran and I would not recommend residential stays whether it be respite or long term for your family member nor individuals seeking employment. I have had family in other facilities, and I know it is hard at times with staffing and things can at times go undone, but this place has no recourse. The director and her team play a façade when you first admit, and that charm and professionalism goes away. I have heard their employees’ discussing things about situations they have been in and seen first-hand the hostility from afar. I commend the hired hands that are working to try to facilitate the best they can for the people living there and us as families trusting that our loved ones are cared for. I hope this review helps anyone who is in question of The Cottages of Chandler Creek in Round Rock, TX.

reviews_list.author: Cynthia Amaya ('The Angel')
reviews_list.text:
Sad that there are soo many negative reviews.
The sites are ALWAYS clean and neat. Several staff have been there for YEARS!!! Meaning they LOVE what they do and patients are like family to them :)

They hold many events for the members staying there :)
Caregivers are always busy either cooking, cleaning, comforting or planning for the next event to get involve patients and family members to enjoy quality time together.

Staff is readily available on the floor doing their jobs.. we have to be mindful that this facility is for Alzheimer not a regular "nursing home".

Thank you to all the staff members who have such a great heart and care for everyone there :)

God Bless

reviews_list.author: Jon
reviews_list.text: I wanted to share my experience with The Cottages in Chandler Creek in Round Rock. This includes Caregivers and the the peolpe in charge. My Mother has been in care for almost 5 years and is was anything but easy at first for me and my Mother. The Cottages staff and Supervisor's had my back every step of the way and let me tell you it was a lot. I needed them and they were not only there in person for me and my Mother (of course) but they where there for me via texting, calls, Facebook, whenever I needed them. To this day I will call them "My family". My Mother calls The Cottages her "home" and even goes to groups now! It is amazing. I have never been disrespected by any of the staff only love, respect and kindness. I have considered moving but would never leave my Mother and I would never want her to leave The Cottages. This is my experience.

reviews_list.author: Ross Wisdom
reviews_list.text:
I have been meaning to write this review for some time as a thank you for my Dad who had the privelege of living at The Cottages in Round Round for the last two to three years of his life. When he was discharged from the hospital he was heavily sedated as he had tried to "escape" many times. They were actually trying to place him at a secure psychiatric facility but there was no bed available, thank god. The Cottages assured me that they were a no restraints facility and could deal with him in a humane manner.
After the first day, I knew he was in good hands, they explained to me that instead of putting him in a raised bed with protective bars so he would not fall during the night, they had decided to put his mattress on the floor, that way he could move around without injuring himself. I knew then that they knew what they were doing. He loved it there, actually recovered very well. His doctor doubted that he would be able to get around without a walker; he was walking on his own within a few days, and he was happy! He made new friends! Unfortunately after two and a half years he worsened, with very advanced alzheimers and had much difficulty eating and swallowing, still they took excellent care of him until the very end; he died peacefully in his bed from pneumionia and asphyxiation, with our permission, we had granted him hospice care status so he would not need to go back to the hospital which would have only been a nightmare for him. The director even attended his funeral, we hugged and cried together; he was well liked there. This is a very special place for alzheimer patients; and I don't think this was an exception, most fellow residents seemed to be happy there and told me so. And yes, I have been to many other places where that was not the case. God bless The Cottages at Chandler Creek.

reviews_list.author: Nathalie Sterling
reviews_list.text: My relatives room smells like urine and food is left in room for hours. Not well taken care of.

reviews_list.author: Debra Sterling
reviews_list.text: They rarely answer phone so you are able to check on relative. Not a good choice for loved ones.

name: Sage Valley Senior Living
description: Sage Valley Senior Living is a retirement community in Pflugerville, TX, offering retirement community, retirement home services. With a 4.7-star rating from 47 reviews, they are one of the highest-rated memory care providers in Williamson County.
shortDescription: Sage Valley Senior Living provides quality memory care for seniors in Pflugerville, TX.

reviews_list.author: Roy Myles
reviews_list.text:
This location is absolutely gorgeous.  The staff are humble and I can see the take great pride in the work they do. Lots of activities going on.  I could see the joy of each of the residents faces.  I give a special shout out to Charles the resident chef.

Thank you Sage Senior Living for hosting our CarePatrol Team.

Warm Regards,
Roy

reviews_list.author: Shawn Decker
reviews_list.text: Just Wow!   This place is beautiful!   The staff is even better.  Great activities, attentive team, and a safe environment.   My mom is so delighted to be there… which is huge because she was very resistant.  Tracy was so patient and helpful through the process.  She answered all of my questions and welcomed me to visit often to make sure I was confident in my decision.   They literally rolled out the red carpet for my mom when she arrived… an incredible welcome!   Highly recommend!   We love it!

reviews_list.author: Kathryn Scott
reviews_list.text: The community is beautiful, the staff is welcoming,  and the residents appear active and social. We had lunch while we were there and it was fresh, appetizing and appealing.

reviews_list.author: Rhonda Myles
reviews_list.text: Staff was wonderful! Very accommodating. The food was really good!!! I absolutely love your residents.They're so adorable

reviews_list.author: JJ Barber
reviews_list.text: Visited this beautiful community and enjoyed the delicious food prepared by Chef Charlie. Concierge Julia was supremely friendly and helpful.

reviews_list.author: Wendy Tatlock
reviews_list.text: The food is amazing, the building is immaculate, and the staff is very kind and cheerful.  If you are considering assisted living, I encourage you to tour this community!

reviews_list.author: Teri LIDGEY
reviews_list.text:
My mother moved to Sage Valley a little over 2 weeks ago.  The improvement we have seen in her overall well being in just 2 weeks is unbelievable. She has a history of digestive issues and that is one of the main reasons we had to move  her.  The food at Sage Valley is delicious.  They realize the negative impact that processed food has on the elderly and strive to serve freshly prepared meals.  Chef Charles prepares not only healthy food, it’s tasty. This has enabled our mother to eat and enjoy the food prepared at Sage Valley.  She’s also able to enjoy the company of other residents during meal time.
Since moving to Sage Valley, mom has already developed friendships and has participated in more activities and outings than she has in the last year.  Samantha, the activities director, is so caring and has made mom feel very welcome there.
All the staff, from med techs to meal servers, have made mom feel at home in her new location.  This has been such a positive change for our mother.  Moving her to Sage Valley has been the best Christmas gift we could have ever received.

reviews_list.author: Cory King
reviews_list.text:
I can’t say enough good things about Sage Valley Senior Living. From the moment I walked through the doors, I knew this was the right place for my mother. The level of care, compassion, and professionalism shown by the entire team has been nothing short of extraordinary.

A very special thank you to Alicia Jackson, the Resident Care Director, whose dedication and attentiveness have brought me so much peace of mind. The care she provides my mother is deeply personal, thoughtful, and filled with love—and that makes all the difference.

Amber Turner, the Executive Director, sets the tone for excellence with her professionalism and top-notch leadership. You can feel her influence in every part of the community—from the warmth of the environment to the efficiency of the operations. My mother literally would not be here if it weren’t for her.

And to the incredible caregiving staff—Sergio, Jacob, Tess, Oliver, Sade, Shamoyra, and so many others—thank you for being the heart and soul of Sage Valley. Your kindness, patience, and consistency do not go unnoticed, and I am endlessly grateful for all you do every single day.

Sage Valley isn’t just a senior living facility—it’s a place where people are truly cared for, seen, and valued. I’m so thankful my mother is in such loving and capable hands.

reviews_list.author: Nathan O'Connor
reviews_list.text: Both of my parents Debbie and Dan have been living at Sage Valley for a little over a year. I can't say enough about the staff there. They are so caring and really get to know each individual person, their needs, their likes/dislikes. Recently, Quentin from the Generations side went out of his way to find activities my Dad would be more interested in (assembling toy trucks, assembling woodworking). He noticed he wasn't as engaged in some of the arts/crafts. Very thoughtful!! Great job everyone.

reviews_list.author: Carol Robbins
reviews_list.text: My mom has been in Memory Care here since June 2024.  The facility is clean and bright; mom especially loves the outdoor space. There have been staff turnovers since she arrived, but the staff currently there are wonderful and caring and have worked to get to know mom well.

name: Rainey & Rainey, Attorneys at Law, LP
description: Rainey & Rainey, Attorneys at Law, LP is a estate planning attorney in Georgetown, TX, offering estate planning attorney, elder law attorney, personal injury attorney services. With a 5-star rating from 32 reviews, they are one of the highest-rated estate planning providers in Williamson County.
shortDescription: Rainey & Rainey, Attorneys at Law, LP provides quality estate planning for seniors in Georgetown, TX.

reviews_list.author: John Galloway
reviews_list.text: The team at Rainey &  Rainey are wonderful to work with. They are highly professional and easy to work with. James is an excellent listener and we are blessed to have found his firm.

reviews_list.author: Linda McNiece
reviews_list.text: It was a pleasure to work with Rainey & Rainey at the Georgetown office. They listened to what I needed and were able to make some updates on my legal documents which has provided me peace of mind. They were prompt in keeping appointment times and efficient in getting my requests completed.

reviews_list.author: Lloyd Heller
reviews_list.text: We chose Rainey & Rainey because of their high google reviews. The attorney Chris Freyder worked with me and my spouse. Chris is patient and caring and understood what we wanted. He's a down to earth person whos' friendly and easy to talk to. He explained things clearly and was understanding when we needed more discussion about specific details. After we signed our documents he asked if we had any questions. He answered several other questions and was genuinely interested. I recommend Rainey & Rainey for elder law services.

reviews_list.author: Marla Bretches
reviews_list.text: We moved to Georgetown in 2022 and needed to update our California trust. James Rainey and his staff were able to efficiently make the changes we needed in a reasonable amount of time. They were friendly and knowledgeable and we appreciated their Texas hospitality. Thank you James and staff! Well done! We would recommend them to anyone who needs a trust.

reviews_list.author: Laura Parsons
reviews_list.text: Chris F is a true professional and helped us style three major trusts and grandchildren trusts in addition to our Wills and Advanced Directives to healthcare providers. He incorporated ideas we had never considered and raised issues that might have caused problems with probate and taxation. We are so grateful and while he is younger, he is brilliant and captures quickly and accurately our intentions in giving. If you need a review or new documents, Rainey and Rainey in Georgetown is wonderful to work with and worth the wait! There’s a reason you might need to wait a month for your appointment-that becomes crystal clear when you meet!

reviews_list.author: Michael Costello
reviews_list.text: My wife and I used Rainey and Rainey to have our trust documents updated. We used Chris FREYDER and could not be more happy. He is so professional and made sure that everything was done exactly according to the way we wanted it. He is very knowledgeable of Texas law and I highly recommend anyone who needs trust services or state planning services to use this company.

reviews_list.author: Akilah Forbes
reviews_list.text: I needed to get some legal documents for my mother who’s in a nursing home. Rainey & Rainey helped me. Attorney Chris Freyder handled it quickly and efficiently. He explained everything and extended help if I needed anything else. I will definitely use this law firm again

reviews_list.author: Bruce Jones
reviews_list.text: Needing trust, wills, powers of attorney, and other documents either to be updated or written, we worked with attorney Chris Freyder at the Georgetown office and legal assistant Emilee Garner. Chris, with patience and understanding, explained what needed to be done, and why. Emilee assisted capably and ensured that the process moved along smoothly. Payment for services was more than fair. We are confident that the professionalism and friendliness we encountered with everyone we met at Rainey and Rainey is natural for the entire firm. We strongly recommend them for help with any aspect of elder law and estate planning.

reviews_list.author: Rich Dennehy
reviews_list.text:
The staff at Rainey & Rainey are very friendly and professional.  Attorney Chris Freyder was such a pleasure to work with assisting us setting up our Trust. He is very knowledgeable, professional and easy to  work with.
I highly recommend using Rainey & Rainey firm for all your Trust needs.

reviews_list.author: Lisa G
reviews_list.text: We are extremely pleased with Rainey and Rainey.  We needed to update our estate plan and Joseph Greer provided very helpful input as well as improvements to our documents.  We appreciated that he was able to communicate with us in understandable terms, not just legal jargon.  We are so glad we visited Rainey and Rainey and highly recommend Joseph Greer for estate planning needs.

name: Heritage Law
description: Heritage Law is a legal services firm in Georgetown, TX, offering legal services, estate planning attorney, family law attorney services. With a 4.9-star rating from 170 reviews, they are one of the highest-rated estate planning providers in Williamson County.
shortDescription: Heritage Law provides quality estate planning for seniors in Georgetown, TX.

reviews_list.author: Rhonda A.
reviews_list.text: After much searching to find a knowledgeable, wise attorney who would patiently guide us through estate planning, my husband and I can proclaim with no hesitation that Attorney Keely at Heritage Law is our answer to prayer.  Attorney Keely is extremely knowledgeable, patient, kind, and shares practical examples to help one understand different documents. We never felt talked down to nor incapable of changing our decision during the process. She is a fantastic listener who truly desired to understand our personal situation. Heritage Law is clearly mission driven to succeed in supporting their clients. From the first call to the office through the last step of finishing our estate planning, Bonnie Siversten blessed us with hospitality, answers via phone calls, and always with a smile. The peace of Christ was experienced as soon as we walked into the building, which is beautiful, clean, and refreshing. The rates are extremely reasonable. Estate planning completed; we are thankful!

reviews_list.author: Donna Johns
reviews_list.text: Wendi Lester at Heritage Law was referred to me by a very good friend.  My husband and I needed to update our legal documents as we moved to Texas last year.  We found Wendi to be very helpful in making our decisions based on Texas laws.  She is very efficient and answered lots of questions that we had.  We would highly recommend her.  The papers were done in a timely manner and recorded with the State.

reviews_list.author: Dodie Murphy
reviews_list.text: Keely has been a delight to work with on my estate planning. She is smart, thorough, well versed and very organized. I would HIGHLY recommend her to anyone thinking about estate planning.

reviews_list.author: Heidi Moga
reviews_list.text: I worked with Keely to get my affairs in order.  Keely is sharp, and she’s easy to talk to.  I am so satisfied with the work she did on my behalf and I was surprised the cost is so reasonable.  I’m so happy I have my plan in place allowing my daughter to ease through the eventual.  Thank you Keely!

reviews_list.author: Angela Achee
reviews_list.text: Saw Keely Freund who handled my Mom’s estate/probate when she passed in May. She has been so helpful, explained everything so we could understand easily and walked us through everything. Made this process stress free. I have seen her now and she has done estate paperwork for me and now I feel relieved I have done it and it’s a gift for my children to have everything laid out. She is so easy to work with and very knowledgeable. Thanks Keely!!

reviews_list.author: Carr Family
reviews_list.text: We needed to update our will and create some other estate documents. Wendi was so easy to work with. She explained the legal terms well and we left feeling at peace that our affairs are in order. Highly recommend the team at Heritage Law for your estate planning needs.

reviews_list.author: Dianna Amescua
reviews_list.text: Contracted Heritage Law firm to update wills and directives. Appointments were easily obtained and the cost was reasonable. Keely and staff were knowledgeable and easy to communicate with; explaining legal jargon and promptly addressing our concerns. A detailed and sometimes complex process was made to feel very simple and within a week was completed.

reviews_list.author: Don Bowen
reviews_list.text: Keely Freund guided us skillfully and patiently through the complexities of estate planning documents.   We found her both extremely knowledgeable and pleasant, and all the people that we met at Heritage Law seem fully competent and very nice.  We would very much recommend this law firm to anyone needing estate planning services.

reviews_list.author: Bryan Bootka
reviews_list.text:
You will want to hire Wendi and her team for your estate planning needs if you want peace of mind and to be treated with the utmost care, whether you have modest means or significant resources.

She helped alleviate the concerns my wife and I had when updating our will to reflect the changing needs of our family. She guided us through the process, helping us avoid pitfalls we were not aware of.

Whether your family is just getting started or you have grandchildren you want to leave something to, reach out to Wendi and her team today. You will rest better having done so.

reviews_list.author: Miguel
reviews_list.text: Keely was extremely helpful and professional throughout the whole process. She answered all of our questions and made everything as easy as possible. If you need help with your estate planning or just an amazing estate attorney, Keely is your person! 100% recommend!

name: Texas Trust Law
