description: Texas Trust Law is a estate planning attorney in Georgetown, TX, offering estate planning attorney, attorney, legal services services. With a 5-star rating from 34 reviews, they are one of the highest-rated estate planning providers in Williamson County.
shortDescription: Texas Trust Law provides quality estate planning for seniors in Georgetown, TX.

reviews_list.author: Jon Huss

reviews_list.text:
We used Slaton Schauer to prepare our Estate Plan and highly recommend their services. Regina, Andrew, and their paralegals were all very approachable and accessible. They created a customized Trust for us, explained everything, answered all our questions, and told us our next steps. I consider them to be a worthwhile investment of our time and money.

We first met them at one of their free seminars which I also highly recommend. I realized right then we needed expert advice to create an Estate Plan specific to our unique situation. They are all good listeners and I always felt heard even if what I was asking seemed unconventional.

reviews_list.author: Tracey Goertz
reviews_list.text: Regina and her staff have simply been amazing! She has helped not only me and my husband, but also several family members. Most recently she helped my parents with estate planning, and when my mom was unable to travel to the office, she and her staff drove to them. This entire office goes above and beyond to make sure you are taken care of, and I cannot say enough wonderful things about them. I highly recommend Regina Schauer and her entire staff! reviews_list.author: besties 4 life
reviews_list.text: A very professional and warm practice, with utmost integrity and honesty. I felt very welcomed and comfortable, and received thorough and wise counsel. Highly recommend! A++

reviews_list.author: James Wegner
reviews_list.text:
Slaton Schauer Law Firm

I wish I could post more than five stars for this wonderful law firm.
After recently being the executor of my mother’s estate, I realized that my will from 45 years ago was woefully out of date and I needed to get my estate into a trust.  I could not use my mother’s estate firm as they are in California, but they highly recommended this law firm.
When I returned to Texas, I gave them a call and they set up an initial meeting less than a week away. Kim was my first point of contact, and she made sure that I got a good head start on what I needed to consider and bring to the introductory meeting.
I met with Regina a few days later and she walked me through the entire process under Texas law and explained every detail I asked about in a way that made sense to me. I walked away from that meeting with a much broader view of how I wanted to structure my trust.
I made what I thought was a comprehensive outline of what I wanted and submitted it by email. Kim got back to me a few days later and we walked through my outline and she pressed me for as much detail as possible in order to have the finished trust meet my expectations.
In the end, the signing meeting went flawlessly.  We didn’t need to change a single word and I cannot imagine how it could have been better planned, constructed or executed.  From start to finish, the process and end result were clear, concise and exactly what I wanted. Both Regina and Kim are exceptional at what they do and how they do it.  I look forward to working with them over the years as life changes things.
(Six stars…)

reviews_list.author: Wendy A
reviews_list.text: Slaton did an excellent job of reassuring our family trust was handled thoroughly with care. This is so valuable information that everyone needs. A Trust keeps money in your family and not towards taxes. Call them today.  Andrew & Regina great kind attorneys.

reviews_list.text: Amazing experience setting up a family trust! Regina and staff are personable, professional and knowledgeable, not to mention patient with all of our questions! Highly recommend and can rest easier knowing we have our estate in order.

reviews_list.author: Michael Chegwidden
reviews_list.text: WOW! The Silverleaf Legal Group is informative, professional, caring, and extremely knowledgeable. We attended one of Thomas Fortenberry free seminars thinking we had a great understanding of Wills, Powers of Attorney, Trust and asset protection. We left the seminar with a lot more knowledge than expected. After attending his free workshop, he even offers a free hour of time at his office to talk about personal specific items or whatever you want to talk about. In that meeting we learned even more. We now feel much better about our future since we have addressed the issues we were concerned with prior to the workshop. Everyone at Silverleaf has been fantastic, they have earned our business for life!

reviews_list.author: Joseph Bury
reviews_list.text:
We recently worked with Tom Fortenberry at the Silverleaf Legal Group to create our will, and we couldn’t be more pleased with the experience. Tom was incredibly easy to work with—professional, patient, and genuinely focused on helping us make the best decisions for our situation.
He explained everything in clear, easy‑to‑understand terms and asked thoughtful, relevant questions that helped us consider details we might have overlooked. We also really appreciated how upfront he was about the cost. Everything was transparent from the start with no surprises.
If you’re looking for an attorney who is knowledgeable, thorough, and truly client‑focused, we highly recommend Tom Fortenberry and the Silverleaf Legal Group. He made the entire process smooth and gave us real peace of mind.

reviews_list.author: Diane Davis
reviews_list.text: My son (who is my executor and also one of the beneficiaries of my estate) and I attended one of Tom's seminars and found it very informative. Since I was anticipating an update to my current plans and documents, I signed up for the free one-hour consultation. When my son and I met with Tom, I had already prepared questions that he addressed, my son also asked questions - to which Tom gave incredible insights into the rationale to proceed in a certain direction on my estate planning. His incredible expertise, friendly demeanor and professionalism were all qualities that instilled the confidence we both were looking for to proceed with my legal estate planning using the Silverleaf Legal Group. Thank you, Tom Fortenberry, for helping me protect my estate, family, and future. I look forward to working with you and the Silverleaf Legal Group!

reviews_list.author: Jorge Torres
reviews_list.text:
I went to a seminar about wills and living trusts with Tom from Silverleaf and was more than I was waiting for, he has a lot of experience and has a facility to explain the different options in a simple and clear manner. He was also very well versed around all the topics that mattered to me: How to leave my family with assets and not problems when I die (living trust), real state investments including sub-2 and ll creation, and how to protect those assets from lawsuits, divorces, etc.

After the seminar I scheduled a meeting that lasted around 1-1.5 hours, were we explained all our plans, needs and wants, he understood and made them even better. My wife and I were very happy at the end of the meeting as all our plans were possible and all our questions were answered.

Then, after the meeting he sen't us like a 3 page email with a summary of everything that was discussed in great detail and what would be needed to move forward.

I think that it's implied already but our experience has been great with Tom and I would recommend to at least give him the opportunity if you don't know where to start.

reviews_list.author: Linda Stephens
reviews_list.text: I went to a workshop that was very educational and beneficial. The info Tom presented was very detailed and the info packet is very useful. I learned so much from the Seminar. I knew when the Seminar was over that I wanted to go with Silverleaf Legal Group. I was scheduled for a consultation with Tom right away. He came up with a plan that works for my needs. Looking forward to working with Tom and his team.

reviews_list.author: Marilyn Marti
reviews_list.text:

The one-hour complimentary consultation afterward provided really valuable insight and clarity. Tom walked us through our specific situation with thoroughness and genuine care. We left feeling very confident about our estate planning decisions.

We highly recommend Silverleaf Legal Group for anyone seeking trustworthy guidance and a team that genuinely cares and takes the time to help.

We highly recommend him and his group for any estate planning you may need.

reviews_list.author: Douglas Brumm
reviews_list.text:
I went to a seminar that Silverleaf Legal was presenting on wills, trusts, etc. It was very informative about multiple ways to manage your assets and  to prepare to pass them on. Tom Fortenberry offered a free hour of time to discuss any items you  needed to discuss. We met in his office . The office was nice and everyone was friendly.
In my case I needed to do a will. I gave Tom some information and he is preparing the will. Very easy.

reviews_list.author: Linda H.
reviews_list.text: Tom gave a phenomenal 2-hour presentation explaining the difference between wills and revocable trusts, along with personal experiences with clients, as to which he recommended, why and when.  During my consultation, he listened to my goals to protect my assets for myself and my family and together we decided on a plan to execute.  I am comfortable and confident with my decisions and would recommend Silverleaf Legal Group to anyone seeking estate planning advice.

reviews_list.author: Jean Shaw
reviews_list.text: I attended a free living trust seminar provided by SilverLeaf and was very impressed. Tom was extremely professional and knowledgeable throughout the presentation, explaining everything clearly and patiently. After the seminar, we also had a complimentary one-hour consultation, which was incredibly helpful and answered many of our questions. I highly recommend Tom and SilverLeaf to anyone looking to better understand estate planning or set up a living trust.

name: Sheehan Law PLLC

reviews_list.author: Frank Steiner
reviews_list.text:
what I am reviewing here isn't any actual engagement - it never came to that - it is the lack of response. After an initial consultant visit where we agreed on 3 items I needed legal assistance with, I never heard back from the firm. I called back 2 weeks later, asking for an update and they told me I had not returned the 'Engagement forms' (or whatever they are called to get going). When I explained I never received such forms, the office clerk (not sure if that is the correct title, no disrespect) apologized and promised me a callback the next day to get it all sorted out. Now it's 4 weeks later and I am still waiting for the callback (well, not really, I found help elsewhere).
I was looking forward working with Sheehan because I totally see the benefit of what they claim on their website:
>>> Larger firms can be constantly tied up in countless cases — while you may be able to reach the front desk, it can be difficult to get into contact with the attorney who is actually representing you <<<
However, for me, the exact opposite was true.

reviews_list.author: Lori Miller
reviews_list.text: Farren Sheehan and all of the staff, especially her paralegal, Helen, at Sheehan Law are excellent! If I could give more than 5 stars, I would!  I was the executor of a complicated estate and I had a lot of questions. Farren and Helen were patient with me and took the time to answer all of my questions in full detail.  They were very responsive with communications and filings to the court as well as with beneficiaries and debt claimants. I highly recommend Sheehan Law for all of your estate needs such as the creation of wills, power of attorney, medical power of attorney, and in the probating of wills as well. These matters are too important to leave to a firm that you don't trust. You can trust Sheehan Law!

reviews_list.author: Annette Rizzo
reviews_list.text:
Sheehaw law has been our family law firm for years.  Unexpectedly both of my parents passes away within 6 months last year and thankfully we were able to rely on this firm to get us through the complexity of probating two wills within months of each other.
Farren clearly explained the entire process to us and handled our court room proceedings with the utmost professionalism.  I also received excellent service from her office staff and paralegal.  I have recommended Sheehan law to three other friends and they have all been very pleased with the legal service they have received.

reviews_list.author: Aaryn Brown
reviews_list.text: Sheehan Law has always provided exceptional service. All staff I have worked with have routinely gone above and beyond with all of their services every time. Friends and family that I have referred always come back with glowing reviews of their services as well. I have been wholly impressed in every way. Thank you for everything!

reviews_list.author: Christina H. Gbadebo
reviews_list.text: Last year (2019) when I lost my mother, I hired Atty. Sheehan. She and her staff were thoughtful, professional, caring and supportive. Atty. Sheehan met with me and helped me navigate a very complex situation. She attended probate with me and guided me through the process. It was a very long road and emotionally draining for me. However, she and her staff helped to make the probate process transparent, affordable, accurate and less stressful. I have much appreciation to her and her staff for all of their hardwork and  I would recommend her services to anyone who hasn't gone through probate before.

reviews_list.author: Rita Cagle
reviews_list.text: As neither a patron nor employee of this firm, please be aware that an individual is leaving negative reviews due to the departure of the firm's paralegal, Helen. Until the matter has resolved, I recommend calling the firm directly. They are an ally to the LGBTQ+ community which, to me, says far more about a company than reviews about a single employee.

reviews_list.author: Mary Buratti
reviews_list.text: I am very grateful for Attorney Farren Sheehan for guiding me through the probate process when my husband passed away unexpectedly. I also want to thank Ms. Sheehan’s professional office staff for their help and assistance in this matter.

reviews_list.text: Sheehan Law recently updated an old, lengthy trust that we had from our time living in VA. From our first Zoom meeting with Farren Sheehan to subsequent phone meetings and our will signing with Helen Valenzuela, we couldn't be happier with their service!  They are very friendly and helpful and we couldn't be more pleased with the service we received from Sheehan Law!  We highly recommend this business!

reviews_list.text: Professional, respectful, and helpful during the process of making my will.  Sheehan Law PLLC staff was amazing Helen, Tarrah, and Finn.  It was an excellent experience.

reviews_list.text: Still working on the estate but the firm has made the process easier. Always responsive and timely, the Sheehan Law, PLLC, group is very professional at all times. I would not hesitate to recommend Farren Sheehan and her excellent staff to anyone needing estate services.

reviews_list.author: Mark & Gina Walker

reviews_list.author: Stephanie Obilom
reviews_list.text: Such a great environment! Got to meet the owner Alejandro and he was such a kind and gracious owner. Ester came and showed us the rules and coached us while we were playing. Such a good time playing with my girls, we are definitely coming back regularly!

reviews_list.author: Marc Adesso
reviews_list.text: Pickleland might just be the nicest pickleball facility in the Austin area- it is beautifully clean, the ceilings are very high, and the courts are pristine. This is what an indoor pickleball facility should be!!! Beyond that, what really makes the place special is the super friendly and helpful staff- I even got to meet the founder/owner, Alejandro, and watch him give an insanely helpful one-on-one coaching session. If you play pickleball or want to get into the sport, you owe it to yourself to check Pickleland out- I hear memberships are selling out fast, which is no surprise given how great this place is!!!!

reviews_list.author: Augusto Fossi
reviews_list.text: Pickleland is awesome,great courts, fun vibe, and super friendly staff. Everything is clean and well organized, and it’s a perfect place to play whether you’re new or experienced.🎾

reviews_list.author: Moira Velicaria
reviews_list.text: Good vibes, courts are awesome and they have a friendly staff!

reviews_list.author: Jacek Szymański
reviews_list.text:
Pickleland in Pflugerville is a fantastic place. The service is outstanding – super helpful, attentive, and genuinely friendly. You can really feel that the staff cares about the people who come here.

The atmosphere is very welcoming and relaxed. If you are looking for a more intimate, community-style place rather than a loud, crowded venue, this is it.

Highly recommended.

reviews_list.author: Reid Shultz
reviews_list.text: Very friendly staff and recurring attendees. Feels like a place where everyone is doing their best to get better while having a good time. Courts have decent space. Shop is small, but I don’t think that’s very important. I think the best thing about them is that they are regularly trying to run an inclusive list of events and grow the scene.

reviews_list.author: bruce montgomery
reviews_list.text: We brought our family here and it was awesome! Well lit, clean and inviting. Carter(the shift lead) got us all set up and took great care of us while we played! Great place for a family game or a competitive tournament!

reviews_list.author: Jeff and Daniel Pickleball Power Play
reviews_list.text:
PICKLELAND SUCKS

Here is why...

My experience with PickleLand was so unprofessional and discouraging that I feel obligated to share it. I contacted the club to join their 4.0+ group and connected my DUPR profile, where I hold a 4.8 DUPR rating. I was also personally invited by multiple players already in the group. By any normal club’s standards, that should have been more than enough.

Instead, I was told that PickleLand’s own “in-house rating system” overrides DUPR entirely. In other words, your earned rating doesn’t really matter — you only play if they approve you. And that approval is based purely on their opinion, not transparent criteria.

When I spoke with the general manager, Zach, he refused to let me into the group because my DUPR reliability score is a 1. The reason is simple: I don’t play tournaments, though I play frequently. Reliability is not the same as ability — something any knowledgeable racquet-sports professional understands. I calmly explained this, along with the fact that I’ve earned my 4.8 over time.

Instead of listening, Zach told me I would “water down the program” and insisted I pay for an assessment with one of their pros before I’d be allowed to join. For context, I’ve been a racquet-sports director for over 20 years. I have never seen a club impose this kind of arbitrary barrier at the 4.0 level. Maybe at the elite 5.0 level — but certainly not here.

What truly shocked me was Zach’s attitude. The moment I pushed back and tried to clarify my rating, he became irritated and dismissive. He then hung up on me mid-conversation and has not returned my call. That is not customer service — that is disrespect.

To make matters worse, he claimed that because my reliability was a 1, I was “probably more like a 3.7 or 3.8.” An entire point lower, based solely on his personal assumption . A difference between 3.8 and 4.8 is huge, yet he stated it as if it were fact.
This entire approach makes PickleLand feel less like a welcoming club and more like a gatekeeping operation built on subjective opinions. Players who have legitimately earned their rating should not have to jump through hoops or pay for unnecessary evaluations just to participate.

After this experience, I have absolutely no interest in supporting PickleLand. I’ll continue playing at clubs that value professionalism, transparency, and player respect — places like Pickleball Kingdom and others that actually understand how to treat their members and guests.

If PickleLand wants to build a strong community, they should start by reevaluating how they handle ratings — and how their general manager communicates with players.

Such a bad experience.......

And two pros were there to kindly humble people who thought they knew how to play. Shoutout to Tyra & Fed for helping make the event extra special! Everyone loved it. Thanks again.

⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

We had an amazing time at Pickleball Kingdom! The facility is clean, well-organized, and perfect for groups of all sizes. The courts are in great condition, the lighting is solid, and there’s plenty of space to play comfortably without feeling crowded.

The staff was friendly, welcoming, and made everything smooth from check-in to cleanup. You can tell they genuinely want guests to enjoy their time. We hosted a celebration here, and our whole family had a blast!

Overall, it’s a fantastic spot for both casual play and special events. Highly recommend if you’re looking for a fun, family-friendly environment in Pflugerville! We’ll definitely be back.

Pay-to-play options for reservations and all programs with membership options available too. Fun tournaments and events planned for the whole family and home to the Texas Sr Pro League and Texas Ranchers MiLP for the competitive one's. Glow in the dark pickleball too! Don't miss the best club in town!

reviews_list.author: Deja Ridgeway
reviews_list.text:
Pickle Kingdom has such a warm and friendly atmosphere! It really feels welcoming from the moment you walk in. Everyone is willing to play with you, no matter your skill level, which makes it such a comfortable place to learn and improve. We’ve already met so many new friends! We’ve also really enjoyed taking classes with Coach Bobo and Tuan -  they’re both great.

Our favorite thing has been drilling. It’s helped our game so much. Being able to book courts so easily has been awesome, and the staff is always understanding and friendly. I also love that they offer 3-hour open plays and that their pricing options fit my budget.

I’m really enjoying Pickle Kingdom and would definitely recommend it to anyone who wants to get into pickleball or who’s already on their pickleball journey!

reviews_list.text: This was a great place to host our annual fundraiser pickleball tournament! We were able to book a specific time slot and the number of courts that suited our event. Jared was very helpful and made the whole process run smoothly. The courts were great and there was plenty of room for friends and family to come and watch. Also, the upstairs area was perfect for younger kids to hang out. Thanks Pickleball Kingdom!

reviews_list.author: malik esam
reviews_list.text: Pickleball Kingdom is a top-notch indoor facility with well-maintained courts, climate control, and a friendly, welcoming community. Whether you’re a beginner taking their free Pickleball 101 class or an experienced player joining organized open play, there’s something for everyone. The staff is professional, the atmosphere is social, and the courts play like the best indoor surfaces, minus the weather worries. Memberships and drop-in rates are reasonable for the quality you get, making it one of the best places to play year-round.

Thank you Jared for coordinating the event from the beginning, answering all of my questions and even setting up the links to make things easy to access. S/O to the friendly staff on site, Tiffany took a picture of the group and was super professional and helpful setting up the day. Courts were nice and the benches and chairs were helpful for folks to take a break in between. I got caught up during the games and left my hat there and Jordan promptly found it and called me back about it. 10/10 customer service and experience, I would recommend PB Kingdom for your next event or birthday gathering, let Jared know.

I look forward to keeping Kingdom as my home base for competitive play and improving my game!
