They refinished a door that had been badly scratched, repaired a hole in drywall, replaced a window sill and painted everything.   Looks good as new.  The cost was reasonable and the response  and completion times were very fast.

7/29 I had them install a new bathroom vanity, light fixture and wall mounted cabinet.  Sam and Carlos did a great job and were a pleasure to work with.  Everything looks and functions well.  They cleaned up the job site.   I will use Cedar Park again.

10/21/25 Sam replaced 3 old ceiling fans with 3 new ones that I provided.  Price was very reasonable and the job was well done.

reviews_list.author: Nick Pape
reviews_list.text: Sam and Carlos did a great job repairing some drywall and paint damage from a leak. Super professional and very fast. They did a great job matching the existing pain. Everything looks brand new! Thanks so much you guys. We will definitely be calling again for other house stuff.

reviews_list.author: David Weatherington
reviews_list.text:
Excellent/Friendly service from start to finish.  Assessment and quote was very professional and quick. When the team arrived for the install, they were friendly and did great work.
Will definitely be calling back for additional help.

reviews_list.author: JoAnn
reviews_list.text:
I recently had Cedar Park Handyman replace an exterior custom arched window trim that was damaged. The experience was great and I definitely recommend the company.

Starting from the quote, I had no problem getting hold of them.  Amber always answered the phone and followed up as discussed. She arranged a quote and accommodated my schedule. John provided the quote. He chose material that would suite my needs well and also answered all my questions.

The handyman Wilson is very professional and skilled.  He showed up on time and listened to my requests. The large arch on the second floor was not easy to remove, cut or install. Wilson worked efficiently and did a great job. He also cleaned up afterwards. I am happy with Wilson's work.

Based on my experience,  I would use Cedar Park Handy Man in the future.

reviews_list.author: Wesley Flower
reviews_list.text: Jerry did a fantastic job helping us fix two door knobs for exterior doors.  One required shifting the entire plate lower.  He took his time and made sure that it work well every time.  He also assisted in fixing a cabinet door that wasn't on the original work order.  He went to Home Depot to get the appropriate bracket and had it done in 10 minutes. We appreciate him and the professionalism of cedar park handyman.  They followed up with a call next day to make sure everything went well.  Top notch

reviews_list.author: mary Ranker
reviews_list.text: Thank you Cedar Park Handyman for a great job.  Jerry was on time, very polite and very neat with his work.  He did a fabulous job replacing our bathroom faucets.  Jerry, you were a pleasure to work with.  Thank You!!

reviews_list.author: Puja Tripathy
reviews_list.text:
We recently had Jerry from Cedar Park Handyman come out to fix our patio ceiling and clean the dryer vent. He was incredibly efficient and professional throughout the process. Jerry not only did a great job with the repair work, but also took the time to explain exactly what needed to be done, which we really appreciated.

The communication from the company was also excellent — timely, clear, and helpful from start to finish. Overall, we’re very happy with the service and would highly recommend Cedar Park Handyman to anyone looking for reliable and skilled home repair work.

reviews_list.author: Laura Prosser
reviews_list.text: Wilson was very professional and displayed a lot of experience when installing my back patio ceiling fan. I highly recommend him!

name: Handyman Connection of Cedar Park
address: 2407 S Bagdad Rd Suite A, Leander, TX 78641
description: Handyman Connection of Cedar Park is a handyman/handywoman/handyperson in Leander, TX, offering handyman/handywoman/handyperson, bathroom remodeler, carpenter services. With a 4.9-star rating from 129 reviews, they are one of the highest-rated handyman services providers in Williamson County.
shortDescription: Handyman Connection of Cedar Park provides quality handyman services for seniors in Leander, TX.

reviews_list.author: Mohammed Adday
reviews_list.text: I couldn’t be happier with my enclosed platoon. Handyman connection of cedar park and Hayder did an amazing job. There were on top of it in every little detail making sure all my requests are met. High quilts, good communication and quilts of work. Keep up the good work. Thank you.

reviews_list.author: Saif Nadheer
reviews_list.text: They did great job replacing my old wood garage attic ladder to aluminium one. They dis great job framing and installing. They paid great attention to detail and did great finish. So thankful for their great communication and their craftsmanship.

reviews_list.author: Sinan Abdul
reviews_list.text:
Great Service and Professional Work!
I recently hired this handyman company, and they did an amazing job fixing everything around the house. They were on time, friendly, and paid attention to every detail. The quality of work was excellent — from repairs to small renovations, everything turned out perfect. Highly recommend them if you need reliable and professional handyman services! They fixed my outside porch and I was amazed how fast and knowledgeable they were ! Thanks for the team.

reviews_list.author: Toby Winters
reviews_list.text: We used the Handyman Connection of Cedar Park to remodel our 2-bedroom, 2-bath apartment. Hayder and his crew did an amazing job remodeling the kitchen and both baths. The bathrooms had the tubs and enclosures removed and replaced with beautifully tiled showers. The toilets, cabinets, sinks and faucets were all replaced. I was out of town during the remodel. Hayder is a very good communicator. He sent texts and photos of the progress almost every day. Read the other reviews! They are correct, The Handyman Connection is great to work with. I highly recommend them and would use them again.

reviews_list.author: Chuck Wilson
reviews_list.text: This is the first time I used Handyman Connection of Cedar Park and it won’t be the last.  I was very impressed with their response time, professionalism and quality of work.  Isaiah Woodruff was the craftsman that did the work and he did an outstanding job.  I highly recommend this company for all of your handyman needs.

reviews_list.author: Carli Kerr
reviews_list.text: We had Handyman Connection come out to fix a door frame that was installed incorrectly by another contractor. Both Hayder who did the initial quote and Isaiah our carpenter did an excellent job of explaining the work. It’s probably now the best installed door in our whole house. Definitely will use Handyman Connection for future work.

reviews_list.author: John Robinson
reviews_list.text: I want to give a shout out to Hayder with Handyman Connection. I had a Polygal panel blow off my pergola in a thunderstorm. This is a difficult material to work with,especially on a windy day! Hader preformed heroically, and completed the job correctly. I was impressed with the quality of his wok. I will have Handyman Connection back soon to caulk my windows. I would recommend Handyman Connection to anyone, who wants the job done right.

reviews_list.author: Corinna Binder
reviews_list.text: Highly recommend! Hayder (Owner) helped us move a recliner from Buda, TX to Liberty Hill, TX. He was professional, careful, and incredibly kind to us and my elderly parents. The move was stress-free because of him. Thank you Hayder!

reviews_list.author: Dian Gardner
reviews_list.text: He replaced a hing on our cabinete.  When here before we asked if he could help and he told us what to do to get the right part.  He's  efficient, friendly and does perfect work, even cleaning up afterwards.

reviews_list.author: Becky Shelton
reviews_list.text: Electrical, plumbing, various tasks - Barton was very professional, tidy, communicative and really just did a great job all around. We will be repeat customers soon.

name: Handyman Services by Larry
description: Handyman Services by Larry is a handyman/handywoman/handyperson in Hutto, TX, offering handyman/handywoman/handyperson, carpenter, electrical installation service services. Rated 4 stars based on 7 reviews, they provide quality handyman services for Williamson County seniors.
shortDescription: Handyman Services by Larry provides quality handyman services for seniors in Hutto, TX.

reviews_list.author: Harsh Pai
reviews_list.text: I needed some fence repairs done and wasn't sure of the current state of my fence i.e. would some patching suffice or the entire fence needed replacement. Larry came out the same day, reviewed the fence and gave me a quote. We agreed on the price and he replaced a few pickets the next day. His service was prompt, communication was clear and the work was great quality based on the pictures. He even gave me a receipt for my payment without asking. I recommend Larry for all your handyman needs and more.

reviews_list.author: Dmytro Konobrytskyi
reviews_list.text:
Asked Larry to cut some MDF precisely to specs provided. The price was reasonable but all pieces I got had incorrect dimensions and for my application they are not usable.
The only reason for 2 stars instead of 1 is that he actually got MDF from Home Depo and delivered it to my house but now I have a pile of useless MDF pieces.

reviews_list.author: David Sandler
reviews_list.text: Larry came by to patch, tape, seal, and texture a drywall hole in my ceiling. He was efficient and gave a fair price!

reviews_list.author: Debbie Dufour
reviews_list.text: Mr Larry installed a screen/storm door and it looks great. He was very polite and professional. Thank you

reviews_list.author: Danny Klos
reviews_list.text: Larry is pretty rude. Also, his website says he does services that he actually doesn’t do.

reviews_list.author: Sylvia Davis
reviews_list.text: The guy I  call for all my "honey-do" jobs!

name: 2020 Market Scratch Kitchen & Bar
description: 2020 Market Scratch Kitchen & Bar is a restaurant in Georgetown, TX, offering restaurant, bar, caterer services. With a 4.5-star rating from 1483 reviews, they are one of the highest-rated restaurants providers in Williamson County.
shortDescription: 2020 Market Scratch Kitchen & Bar provides quality restaurants for seniors in Georgetown, TX.

reviews_list.author: cambria Leigh
reviews_list.text: Went there to celebrate a birthday in the family. I got the stuffed trout, my fiancé got the BBq burger and we shared the loaded steak nachos for an appetizer. Our server was very attentive and nice, this would be a good place for brunch, family dinner, or date nights! Full bar, indoor, outdoor and patio seating. They have the games playing as well with daily desserts! We will definitely be coming back.

reviews_list.author: Shantelle Love
reviews_list.text:
We are visiting from NC and I wanted to take my husband somewhere to start his 60th birthday celebration. My aunts and I decided on this place and we were NOT disappointed. The atmosphere and staff were so pleasant and welcoming! Our server, Danielle, was AMAZING. I was able to tell her that we were celebrating my husband's birthday and she was in! She was able to articulate the menu and help us decide on what to order. Our drinks were superb and so was the food. Everything was hot and fresh!
We're moving back to TX (Dallas area), but will definitely visit each time we visit our family in the area. Thank you for a wonderful dining experience.
Oan the bathroom layout and community wash basins are top tier!

reviews_list.author: Kimberly Byrns
reviews_list.text: Wow!  We meet some friends here for dinner.  We had never been their before but it is one of their favorites.  Now we know why.  The staff was amazing from the moment you were greeted, service at the table and even all the thank you as we left.  The food was absolutely wonderful.  I ordered the shrimp and grits.  It came with pork belly and the sauce was the perfect medium to bring it all together.  My husband ordered the ribs and was very impressed.  That is hard to do because he is very picky about ribs.  The texture was great and the sauce was perfection.  This will be one of our favorites to visit when we are in the area.  Can't wait to try some of their other selections.

reviews_list.author: Marsha Russell
reviews_list.text:
We came here for the first time recently after Googling happy hours in Georgetown. 2020 Market was at the top of the list, and we were excited to give it a try. The atmosphere is vibrant, with big windows, lots of light, high ceilings, and very clever use of windmill fans as ceiling fans.

Seating includes booths, tables, and stools at the bar — a nice mix — and we were happy with the selection of beers on tap and wine. We ordered the happy hour priced brisket nachos and guacamole and enjoyed our drinks while we waited for the food.

The nachos and guacamole, however, were a letdown, prioritizing presentation over eating. Both come with 5 or 6 long strips of tortilla chip, instead of a basket of traditional ones, which makes both dishes look like big flowers. Yes, it’s an inventive presentation. But when it comes to eating, it’s weird. If sharing, you have to budget your 2 1/2 chips.

There were bigger issues for the brisket nachos. I am crazy about the brisket nachos at Ivar’s in San Marcos, where every single bite of the meat on a crisp tortilla chip is smoky and delicious, so I was expecting something similar. Instead, while there was meat scattered across, it didn’t have the smoky flavor I craved. That was the main reason we ordered them, so this was a disappointment. Even more of a problem is the flower-like design, with the chips radiating out from the center. They pour runny queso and runny sour cream over the whole thing, especially in the center of the spokes, before putting some guacamole on top. This results in soggy chips and an overall mess that has to be eaten with a fork. The manager came by when we had nearly given up, asking if we needed more chips. There’s no doubt that would have helped from the beginning, when we could have treated the whole thing as a dip. But by this point, we were just done with it.

The service was fine, though I wish our server had told us we could have more chips when she brought our food. Other things on the menu look good, but I’d be careful not to order something where presentation might trump substance/flavor/texture.

reviews_list.author: Brian Garman
reviews_list.text:
2020 Market Scratch Kitchen nails it. The atmosphere is lively, the service is super friendly, and the food is incredible.
​Brussel Sprouts: A must-order starter. So good!
​Steak Enchiladas: A clever and delicious take on a classic. The steak was perfectly tender.
​Grilled Chicken Club: You can't go wrong. A perfectly made classic.
​This is one of the best meals we've had in town. We will definitely be back!

reviews_list.author: Monica Narvais
reviews_list.text: If you find yourself in the Georgetown area, this restaurant is a must-visit destination. I highly recommend it. The service was outstanding. Although it was our first time there and we were told to book reservations in advance, they managed to seat us right away. The food was exceptional. The atmosphere was amazing.

reviews_list.author: Mari Bee
reviews_list.text: Absolutely delightful dinner on the patio. Food and service were phenomenal! We ordered the market spuds with queso, shrimp ravioli, Cobb salad, and frozen Margaritas, everything was delicious 🤤 Shrimp ravioli is a must try, my daughter ordered it as an entrée. Definitely ordering again the next time we return.

reviews_list.author: Mrs. G
reviews_list.text: If you LOVE locally grown and good food this place is for you. The atmosphere as soon as you enter makes you feel like you’re waking into “Cheers” where everyone knows your name. You’re greeted with a smile and the service is great. Matthew, our server kept a smile and a delightful demeanor. This is a must go place for a family even with little picky eaters, there’s something for them.

reviews_list.author: Bri Rodriguez (Bri)
reviews_list.text:
Clean inside and out. Friendly service upon entry. Waiter was friendly. Attentive. We did have to return tea it tasted sour.
Food was hot and fresh. Gave us the idis.
The alcohol beverage was delicious.

reviews_list.author: Nicole Welch
reviews_list.text:
Update: Came back looking forward to this place again.  All was perfect again! Our server Matthew was great and food was top notch.  Love the freshness.  Do not change a thing! I had the ravioli, he had enchiladas.  Both were amazing! Love the big chips with the fresh guacamole.

First time here. Loved it. Food was perfect and the server (from Lubbock) has been one of the best servers I have ever had.  I will be back and try more menu items.

name: Goodfolks
description: Goodfolks is a restaurant in Georgetown, TX, offering restaurant services. Rated 4.3 stars based on 1145 reviews, they provide quality restaurants for Williamson County seniors.
shortDescription: Goodfolks provides quality restaurants for seniors in Georgetown, TX.

reviews_list.author: Taylor Paul
reviews_list.text: We got to try Goodfolks a few weeks ago for the first time! We came on a Thursday evening around 5:30, and there was no wait. The atmosphere and vibes of the restaurant are very cute! However not every dish that we got was great. One of the things they seem to be known for are their biscuits, and I was excited to try them, but was left disappointed. They were very dry and hard. We also got the pimento cheese and crackers as a starter. It was basically cheese and crackers slapped onto a plate, with no flavor or added things to make it special. The chicken sandwich that I got was great, however! It had a super thick piece of chicken and had great flavor. I would come back to get this again, but not the other items!

reviews_list.author: Marsha Russell
reviews_list.text:
Love this place! We had a terrific experience here when we came for lunch on a Thursday. The space — a lovingly preserved corner of the 1896 Lockett Building on Georgetown’s square — is inviting, bright and airy, with a central room surrounded by a wraparound balcony.

Our server greeted us warmly and brought our drinks promptly. The full bar has a nice choice of craft beers on tap, cocktails, and wine. The menu also has lots of enticing choices; so many things sounded good! We ordered the chicken salad sandwich with sweet potato fries and the Fried Chicken Salad (pieces of fried chicken breast on mixed greens with bits of bacon and blue cheese crumbles), and both were absolutely delicious!

We couldn’t resist the dessert special, Strawberry Buttermilk Cake with fresh berries, crème anglaise, and ice cream, and oh my goodness gracious, it was divine! We told the server it needs to be on the regular menu and she said that’s the plan.

From the lunch crowd that was there that day, this is a very popular place, and based on our experience, it certainly merits that. We will be back again and again.

reviews_list.author: Aubrey Martin
reviews_list.text: Had a really great experience today. We’ve been here multiple times, but we finally had our “oh damn” moment. Shanna was our server and she was manning the entire floor so I was insanely impressed with how attentive she was. She gave us great recommendations and we went with them. Holy hell we are glad we did. The food was amazing (chicken tenders are a little comically large, but I’d rather that than comically small). Dipping sauces were SO good and yes, we ordered pretty much every sauce available. Shanna was also delightfully funny and kind. We had a great time today.

reviews_list.author: Liz Pool
reviews_list.text: Our server Leah was stellar! We came in about 2:00pm, so there was no crowd at all. We had the fried chicken and it was good but almost too done. I would have popped it out of the grease a couple of minutes sooner. But the chicken is hand cut because the pieces are huge. The biscuits were very dry. I ate mine anyway because it's still a biscuit! Coleslaw was good and I liked the kale. It was very clean, quiet and relaxing.

reviews_list.author: IrPaEsAr
reviews_list.text: We went last sunday, and even tho service is always questionable, food usually was always good, not this time. We got our usual chicken and waffles, tenders for the kids, well when i tell you the quality was worse than fast food, they looked and tasted just like those frozen already cooked pieces of chicken, same with the waffles. They used to make the fried chicken there, im not sure why they changed it, as you can see in the picture thats not made from scratch, literally frozen chicken tenders, we paid almost $90 for horrible food that we didnt finish, even the coffee was cold. I emailed the contact on the website and have not received any response. Such a disappointing visit!

reviews_list.author: Nick DeMarco
reviews_list.text: A really cool spot for dinner in a historic building on the square of Georgetown.  The sandwiches were really good and there was a solid drink selection as well.  The sidewinder fries were also a nice surprise.  Service was a little slow to start, but it got quicker after our drinks were eventually served.

reviews_list.author: Timothy Williams
reviews_list.text: This was a nice restaurant in downtown Georgetown. The food was pretty good and if you want fried chicken, this is your spot. I have different types of meals, but I think they mostly revolve around chicken. We got the fried pickles went great too! I wish they offered a barbecue or hot sauce, dipping sauce. Similar to what you would get on hot wings. I really like the layout of the restaurant and it was nice and clean with a really cool design. I feel the service was pretty good and overall we gave the food a thumbs up.

reviews_list.author: Michael Fisher
reviews_list.text: Atmosphere is great not your typical eatery has the old timely but new feel. Amber was great and was super speedy up and down the stairs with drinks food etc..def dont bring newborns here as those cries will echoooo. Unless you are into that. All around awesome spot. Food was good but not wow.

reviews_list.author: Troy Nissen
reviews_list.text:
A Quaint Spot with Amazing Service in Downtown Georgetown.
Goodfolks is a really cool, quaint little spot right in the heart of historic downtown Georgetown. The atmosphere and layout are fantastic, and even though we didn't have a reservation, we were seated quickly,.

The menu is definitely centered around chicken dishes, and everyone in our party had something different, from chicken sandwiches to chicken tenders. We started with the Honey Sriracha brussel sprouts, and they absolutely did not disappoint. For my main, I went with the Honey Sriracha chicken sandwich. The flavor was really good and it wasn't too spicy, but it was a little messy and mushy from the sauce. Despite that, the flavor was great, and it was a huge sandwich!

The absolute highlight of our visit, though, had to be our server, Alison. She was so nice and personable, and she took the time to walk us through the menu and give us some great recommendations. She made us feel right at home and did an excellent job taking care of us.

Overall, Goodfolks is a great place, and with service like Alison's, we'll definitely be back.

reviews_list.author: Askia Little
reviews_list.text:
I went to this spot for lunch around 12:30 with three other people, and the wait for a table was minimal—only about five minutes. From the start, the experience was smooth and enjoyable. The service was great, and our server was attentive throughout the meal and even offered helpful recommendations.

The drinks were also a highlight. I ordered a bourbon-forward cocktail, and it paired really well with my meal. For food, I went with the grilled cheese sandwich, and it was absolutely amazing. It was perfectly cooked, rich, and comforting. I also had the tomato bisque, which was equally impressive—warm, flavorful, and the perfect complement to the sandwich.

My friend ordered the four-piece chicken tender meal and loved it. He paired it with mashed potatoes and Brussels sprouts, both of which were really good. Everyone at the table enjoyed their food, and there were no complaints across the board.

Overall, it was a great lunch experience with good food, solid drinks, and excellent service. I’ll definitely be coming back.

name: The Cove
description: The Cove is a restaurant in Georgetown, TX, offering restaurant services. Rated 4.4 stars based on 19 reviews, they provide quality restaurants for Williamson County seniors.
shortDescription: The Cove provides quality restaurants for seniors in Georgetown, TX.

reviews_list.author: Sarah Guerra
reviews_list.text: I would put a zero but it’s not possible . My salad was terrible. I asked for lemonade and there was no lemonade and then talk to the general manager and she was the worst person to talk to her name was Carmen and she gave me attitude very disrespectful. I couldn’t put together a salad. I am so disappointed and I think that guy should come back to this restaurant and read it again, because I am more than sure he would take his face off of the wall.

reviews_list.author: Monica Santos
reviews_list.text: They have a grill,starbucks, and a convience store all in one  place. It's a place for college kids but they are open to the public too. 7am-2am M-F  7pm-2am Saturday and Sunday. Nive and friendly staff.

reviews_list.author: Kiya Osha
reviews_list.text: These five stars are for the staff! MS.DORA is my favorite human and always makes me smile when i get my morning coffee.

reviews_list.author: Christina Nissen
reviews_list.text: It's ok, but nothing special. It's standard fried cafe fare. Burgers, chicken strips, fries, tater tots etc.

reviews_list.author: Sandra Roth
reviews_list.text: Didn’t eat there but had a beverage and chilled

reviews_list.author: Tim O'Neill
reviews_list.text: Standard college grill and games. A bit noisy.

reviews_list.author: Omar Franklin
reviews_list.text: Cozy...good comfort food

reviews_list.author: Gabriel C. Macias (Bon)
reviews_list.text: Nice coffee 👌

reviews_list.author: Larvin Jefferson
reviews_list.text: Awesome...

reviews_list.author: Carter Welsh
reviews_list.text: I eat there

name: La Riv Wood Fired Italian
description: La Riv Wood Fired Italian is a restaurant in Georgetown, TX, offering italian restaurant services. Rated 4.3 stars based on 376 reviews, they provide quality restaurants for Williamson County seniors.
shortDescription: La Riv Wood Fired Italian provides quality restaurants for seniors in Georgetown, TX.

reviews_list.author: Becky Shelton
reviews_list.text:
We really like this place. It’s a HIGH FOUR STARS for us. Dim lighting cozy booths and bar seats and a staff that has great personality and really cares about their profession. Oh, and the food is consistently great. We are stuck on the meatball and polenta appetizer and pizzas but have enjoyed many dishes and always go back. Not great for kids, but not bad, good for date night. Creative but classic cocktails and scrumptious desserts.   The noise level is just right for semi-intimate conversation and bigger parties can all hear each other.

If I could change one thing it would be add an eggplant dish but so many good eats keeps us coming back.

See ya again soon, La Riv.

reviews_list.author: Cate Johnston
reviews_list.text: We recently visited La Riv Wood Fired Italian, and it was a wonderful experience! The staff was friendly and accommodating, and the ambiance was warm and inviting. We ordered the Carne pizza and Spaghetti Carbonara—both were outstanding. The pasta was rich and flavorful, and the pizza crust was perfectly crisp and delicious. It was hard to choose between dishes, but next time I’ll definitely be trying the Shrimp Scampi! Highly recommend this spot for anyone who loves authentic Italian food.

reviews_list.author: J C
reviews_list.text:
As we continue trying different restaurants in downtown Georgetown, we made reservations at La River Wood Italian Restaurant. After about a 15-minute wait, we were seated near the front door. The atmosphere was welcoming, and the staff overall seemed pleasant.

Our server was Paul. While looking over the menu, it felt like the restaurant catered more toward wine enthusiasts, as the wine selection seemed more extensive than the food selection. Having traveled to Italy and visited many Italian restaurants across the U.S., I expected more traditional Italian options. I was also surprised they didn’t have lasagna, and when I mentioned it, I was told it was more of an Americanized dish than Italian—which I personally disagree with.

For dinner, I ordered the Italian meatballs and spaghetti, but unfortunately it was very bland and under-seasoned. Normally I finish everything on my plate, but this time I couldn’t. My wife ordered the fish, and she felt the same way—it also lacked seasoning. Both dishes were presented well, but no one offered parmesan cheese, seasoning, or anything extra to enhance the flavor.

Service was decent overall, but the biggest issue was the long wait for our food—over 45 minutes. After checking with Paul, we were told the fish takes a long time, but that hasn’t been my experience. I later spoke with the manager, who was very professional and checked on the delay. He discovered our order hadn’t been entered in a timely manner and offered to comp our meal, which we appreciated. He also brought out extra meatballs while we waited—though they were also bland—and we were given a slice of red velvet cake, which was okay.

Based on this experience, we’re willing to give the restaurant another try in the future—possibly with different friends to get a second opinion—especially since it was clearly busy and popular. People must enjoy it for a reason, though from our visit, the food selection and flavor didn’t seem to be the main draw.

reviews_list.author: Chris Norris
reviews_list.text: Great quality Italian food - we had the short rib pappardelle and truffle mushroom ravioli. You could tell the pasta was fresh and the short rib was melt-in-your-mouth.  Excellent wine list and topped it all off with the delicious bread pudding.   Will be coming back!

reviews_list.author: Jeff Cortez
reviews_list.text: Food was excellent! Took the family there on Christmas Eve and we had a fantastic time. Never felt rushed, waiter was super attentive, food was the best, great cocktails and wine. Perfect setting for a dinner and then to walk around Georgetown square and soak in the lights and ambiance. Thanks for a great dinner!

reviews_list.author: Rodney Hair
reviews_list.text: My love and I had an excellent dinning experience. The food was exquisite, the cocktails were perfect and the night was excellent! Our server recommended incredible delights and im glad I've chosen the octopus. You should try it too!😉 My compliments ☺️ 💛

reviews_list.author: Judy Berkowitz
reviews_list.text: My husband and I enjoyed a delicious New Year’s Eve dinner at La Riv. The food and service were excellent as usual. I took away one star simply because it is a bit noisy.

reviews_list.author: MarivicB
reviews_list.text:
We had a fantastic experience at La Riv. It was our first time and we were impressed with the ambiance, food and service. We arrived early for a Thursday evening reservation but we were seated immediately and were able to choose the table.

The cheese board and shrimp appetizer were good, the main meals were excellent. The wine was good too. The prices are high but definitely worth it. Great restaurant in a good location. Highly recommended.

reviews_list.author: Diane Gura
reviews_list.text:
We  visited this restaurant on New Year's Eve. I ordered the Chilean sea bass special with sweet potatoes and spinach, which was delicious. My husband ordered the spinach ravioli.  My daughter ordered the rigatoni Bolognese which was also very good, but wished it had more homemade pasta.
It did take quite a bit of time to get our entrees, as the place was busy. The sides of potatoes, fingerland potatoes, the truffle sauce was very bland as was the macaroni and cheese. I definitely wouldn't get those sides again. The red velvet cake dessert looked like a grocery store cake. That tiramisu was good.

reviews_list.author: Shelley Hawthorne
reviews_list.text: Donny was our server and he was the best! The food was incredible. I loved the ambience as well. We celebrated our anniversary.

name: Blue Corn Harvest Bar & Grill, Georgetown
description: Blue Corn Harvest Bar & Grill, Georgetown is a restaurant in Georgetown, TX, offering mexican restaurant, bar & grill, southern restaurant (us) services. With a 4.6-star rating from 3386 reviews, they are one of the highest-rated restaurants providers in Williamson County.
shortDescription: Blue Corn Harvest Bar & Grill, Georgetown provides quality restaurants for seniors in Georgetown, TX.

reviews_list.author: Michael Magnus
reviews_list.text: The food here was delicious, with creative chef-inspired recipes and farm to table ingredients. I had the sweet potato enchiladas, which had an incredibly decadent sauce to it. My wife’s salad was very tasty, with some of the best goat cheese I’ve ever tasted. Definitely worth giving it a try.

reviews_list.author: Josh Poe
reviews_list.text:
We were walking around the square on xmas eve and were pleasantly surprised to find blue corn open at 7:30pm. No wait for our table of two and the staff was awesome, especially considering they're working xmas eve.

We had a bottle of tempranillo for half off for their wine off Wednesday special. It was great and for food, we split the oysters and the meatloaf. Both were fantastic and it was a perfect meal.

reviews_list.author: Aron and Janet Jarrett
reviews_list.text: Our first time here and we really enjoyed it. We sat at the bar and ordered dinner. Jill provided excellent service and food was delicious and fresh. The restaurant has a relaxed vibe with very friendly staff. Prices are reasonable and it’s definitely a new favorite spot. We ordered chicken fajitas and grilled jerk chicken salad. Both dishes were delicious.

reviews_list.author: Donna Turner
reviews_list.text: Decklan was fabulous!  Gave me a vegetarian menu when I mentioned I didn’t eat meat and recommended the Avocado Nachos, which I highly recommend. The salsa, as he bragged on, was indeed delicious!  Go visit and if Decklan is at the bar-sit there and he will take great care of you❣️. The staff and manager visited and also was incredibly attentive!  Great food and service. Highly recommend!

reviews_list.author: BradinHK
reviews_list.text:
This Blue Corn harvest Bar and Grill is located W 7th Street just off the main downtown square in Georgetown. There is free parking around the restaurant, opening hours are 11am - 10pm (weekdays) and 10am to 10pm (weekends). There is a nice indoor seating area and menu features a nice selection of home-cooked, traditional Texas and Tex-Mex dishes.

Had an early lunch here recently, found the Chicken fried chicken lunch to be very good. Chicken was nicely crispy fried yet still succulent and flavourful. Mash and gravy tasted perfect, as did the grilled vegetables. This was a very good lunch, good portion size and rightly priced as well. Would gladly return for another meal at Blue Corn Harvest based on this recent experience.

reviews_list.author: Amanda Courteaux
reviews_list.text: Everything was great. It was very comfortable which allowed us to be ourselves and have many laughs. Our server was spot on. The manager came over and introduced herself. We had a 1-year-old in our party and they still provided tremendous service. The only issue was the wait time. But the restaurant was full. To be expected.

reviews_list.author: Sandra Granger
reviews_list.text: I just want to thank Blue Corn Harvest and especially Zach and Rachel for helping me this past week when I held meetings at the restaurant. The hospitality and service they provided were excellent.  They went out of their way to accommodate our group and provided service with a smile.  The food arrived on time and tasted great!  Thank you, Zach and Rachel! I appreciate YOU! ❤️

reviews_list.author: Pattrick Vasquez
reviews_list.text:
We happened to come in during their happy hour. The deals are absolutely incredible. Half priced apps and they were absolutely delicious. Highly recommend the Taquitos and the Harvest #4. The service was fantastic. Our waitress, Joanna, visited our table many times and made sure we had what we needed. She was also easy to talk to and helped us be prepared to order when we come back!! And because we came during happy hour, all of the food in the photos was less than $35!

Awesome experience, will absolutely come back, especially during happy hour.

reviews_list.author: Neelima Putcha
reviews_list.text: The host gave us a nice table and our waitress was fine and helpful but acted a little strange. The food was somewhat disappointing but also good. The salsa and guac were great. But the sandwiches were just ok. They served a Roasted Veggie Sandwich on a burger bun which was weird. Would have been nice on some fresh sourdough. And the breading on my shrimp po boy tasted very stale. I asked the waitress for some fresh grilled shrimp instead and she brought it out with some resistance. She said she wouldn't charge me for it, but then included it on the final bill. Anyway, not a bad place for lunch, but a little weird.

reviews_list.author: Bryce A Elemond CAI,BAS
reviews_list.text:
We live in Fort Worth and stopped on on our way home to visit with family that loves coming to the place. We had a great meal, great service and we were able to get a military discount.
Thanks for a great meal.

name: Georgie's
description: Georgie's is a restaurant in Georgetown, TX, offering seafood restaurant services. With a 4.5-star rating from 145 reviews, they are one of the highest-rated restaurants providers in Williamson County.
shortDescription: Georgie's provides quality restaurants for seniors in Georgetown, TX.

reviews_list.author: Jon Deates
reviews_list.text:
Place was really nice, the food was tasty. We had the fried green tomato, bass, and chicken and farrow.

The fried green tomato was really good! Super tasty and Light appetizer.
The bass was tasty, felt a bit small, and had in my opinion too much garnish.
The chicken and farrow was a really good portion and tasty as well.

Recommend this place, if your looking for some fish food.

reviews_list.author: Baylee Shaw
reviews_list.text:
Celebrated our anniversary tonight and stumbled upon this hidden gem while searching for seafood in the area. From start to finish, everything exceeded our expectations.

Kerry was our server and she made the night even more special than it already was. Her recommendations were amazing & she paced everything perfectly so we could really relax and enjoy our time together. The food was fresh, flavorful & presented beautifully!

Highly recommend & we will be back!

My personal favorites were the oysters, ahi & bread pudding!

reviews_list.author: GK
reviews_list.text: Cool spot.  Maybe caught them on an off night.  Our first orders of food were thing don the menu but no longer available.  Or they were 86’d for the night.  Cocktails were ice but served room temp.  Portion sizes a bit on the small side.  Fried green tomatoes, fish and chips, Shepard pie all served room temp.  Charges you credit card fee.

reviews_list.author: Jim Nabholz
reviews_list.text:
Fantastic dinner experience this week at Georgie’s…. We concur with many of the online reviews that complain about how loud the place is …. The solution… get the early!  We arrived when they opened and had a great dinner!  Our waiter was Dave!  Thank you sir!  Excellent job!  By 5:30pm it was getting pretty loud…. We talked to some locals who said the owners are limited by mods they can make “historical building” stuff, cannot fix the sound issue.  Suggest lowering the volume of the music, let the banter be the noise!

We sampled across the menu… crab cake was delicious, one of the best we’ve had in a while.  Ceviche and ahi poke tacos were super fresh, all made to order, great taste!  The sake sea bass was awesome, cannot go wrong there!  The gumbo was good, but needed a bit more depth of flavor (more spices)… plenty of seafood in the and the andouille was great!

Cool place, nice vibe… the noise issue could be better, but improvements likely limited by building codes.  Dine early and often!  Highly recommend Georgie’s!

reviews_list.author: Alberto Battaglino
reviews_list.text:
Georgie’s is a very nice place with a warm, inviting atmosphere and excellent service. The food was beautifully presented — we had the fish and chips and the bluefin tuna, both perfectly cooked and full of flavor. The seasoning was subtle, refined, and never overpowering, which really let the quality of the ingredients shine.

To finish, we shared the bread pudding — absolutely amazing. The yellow raisins were delicately marinated in what seemed to be a fine liquor, adding depth and elegance to an already outstanding dessert. A wonderful dining experience from start to finish!

reviews_list.author: sayo zenyoji
reviews_list.text:
Everything was fantastic ! Especially bluefin tuna was excellent !! The sake-roasted sea bass reminded me of the familiar sake-lees–marinated fish from my home country, Japan, but with a fresh, modern twist. The new flavors were vibrant and wonderfully balanced.
Rosted beets was also so delicious.
Absolutely this is the one I wanna go again !

reviews_list.author: Dillan Stephens
reviews_list.text: Georgie’s is our favorite restaurant in downtown Georgetown, and we love it! The food is amazing; I highly recommend the ceviche, tuna poke tacos, and oysters. Honestly, everything on the menu tastes great. We visit once or twice a week, and our favorite spot is at the bar, where we can chat with Kevin. He’s the coolest bartender I've ever met, his drinks are fantastic, and he always knows how to make us laugh. Keep up the great work, Georgie’s!

reviews_list.author: Alonda Cepeda
reviews_list.text: We accidentally stumbled on Georgie’s and Im so glad we did! The food and drinks were phenomenal!! The ceviche is extremely fresh & flavorful. We thought it beat a michelin star rated restaurant that we drive to Austin for ceviche. My husband was very impressed with the oysters as well. For entrees, we had the fish & chips and the crab cakes. So impressed!! The atmosphere is clean, airy and bright. Our waiter was wonderful…actually the entire staff was really great! Finding this new spot in Georgetown completely made my night. This is going to be our new place for date night.

reviews_list.author: Kari Petruch
reviews_list.text: Upon entering the restaurant, the atmosphere was bright and welcoming. We did not have a reservation and sat at the bar. The staff is incredible. Najin was our server and the bartender. We had known her from another restaurant and knew that our service would be awesome and it was. We also had the pleasure of speaking with the general manager, Richard, who is stellar. We also met our Sous Chef. He was also very welcoming. The bar was set for a great meal with the menu. My husband had the sea bass and I enjoyed the redfish. The plating of our meals was on par with any great fine dining restaurant. My dish was absolutely perfectly cooked and seasoned. We will definitely return! Bravo! Don't miss this fabulous restaurant!

reviews_list.author: Michael Stine
reviews_list.text:
First time eating here for my wife and I.  Wonde
rful! Owner let us come in a few minutes early. Very thoughtful.  Great service, cocktails and food. We tried a little bit of everything. Sheppards pie, fish and chips, oysters, ceviche and apple pie. Old fashioned and Mexican Martini. Jade provided great service. Friendly, attentive and knowledgeable.  Highly recommend.

name: Fonda Marin Mexican Restaurant
description: Fonda Marin Mexican Restaurant is a restaurant in Georgetown, TX, offering mexican restaurant services. With a 4.9-star rating from 39 reviews, they are one of the highest-rated restaurants providers in Williamson County.
shortDescription: Fonda Marin Mexican Restaurant provides quality restaurants for seniors in Georgetown, TX.

reviews_list.author: Casey Davis
reviews_list.text: This is hands down the most authentic place in Georgetown I've found. It's family owned and operated which shows tremendously in their food. Prices are fair and the ownership is amazing. I typically don't write home about a breakfast taco but these people surpassed my expectations. Take note that their homemade corn tortillas and salsa caught my attention which is a great foundation to this style of cuisine. They have a new regular for sure! I love Fonda Marin!

reviews_list.author: Fritz Feltner
reviews_list.text:
1/2026 Don't let the location inside a convenience store fool you - this kitchen has some legit Mexican dishes.  Among the most popular they say are the Falutas, which were sold out by 6pm on my Friday evening visit. The fajitas grilled up fresh on order were delicious.

They have a nice selection of hot sauces  ranging from "f-yeah it's hot" to "holy cow I think I'm on fire" but those are optional and the dishes are moderately spicy, perfect for most people's tastes.

There are several tables for indoor dining, or grab a to-go to take with you.

reviews_list.author: Shelenia Nelson
reviews_list.text: Let me tell yall something right now! This place has the absolute BEST Menudo I have ever tasted in my life, Laaaaawd! The tamales are also really delicious. You gotta try this place.

reviews_list.author: Laura Meadows
reviews_list.text: This restaurant in the back of a gas station convenience store is the best Mexican food to be found in Georgetown. I had the cheese empanadas and chicken tacos. My husband has chicken enchiladas. The food was cooked to order, fresh and delicious. It was served with a flight of salas and warm tortillas.  Drinks are an assortment of Mexican sodas, ice tea, lemonade and water. The place has a friendly taco truck vibe. Our server was very sweet and attentive. The only thing missing is margaritas. We will definitely be back. Thanks Fonda de Marin for the good food!

reviews_list.author: Anush Diwan
reviews_list.text:
🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟
Absolutely wonderful experience at Fonda Marín!
The food was delicious — fresh, authentic, and full of flavor. You can tell a lot of care goes into every dish. The staff was friendly and welcoming, making the whole visit feel warm and personal. The atmosphere is cozy and inviting, perfect for a casual lunch or dinner with friends or family.

reviews_list.author: MT Garcia
reviews_list.text: This is a hidden gem in Georgetown!  Stumbled upon them inside the grab and go Shell gas station. They make the best cheeseburger in town and the flautas are so delicious! I will definitely be back!😋

reviews_list.author: Merrick Lovell
reviews_list.text: Best taco and alot of flavors. My favorite taco. The ladies can cook chicharron really good. No other place can cook better than them.

reviews_list.author: Olivia Lopez
reviews_list.text: The food was delicious.   I came for breakfast and I ordered the chilaquiles.  Loved it.    The ladies that work here are so friendly.

reviews_list.author: Blanca Monrreal
reviews_list.text: Best breakfast, lunch and dinner . I love the food here and will continue to go back. Very clean and the ladies are amazing. 10******* ----Blanquita

reviews_list.author: Yadira Martinez
reviews_list.text: It's a small family-owned restaurant. One of the best authentic Mexican food restaurants in Georgetown. As a Californian, let me tell you we love authentic Mexican food. Tamales 🫔 are delicious and all the Agua Fresca are great.

name: City Post
description: City Post is a restaurant in Georgetown, TX, offering restaurant services. Rated 4.4 stars based on 454 reviews, they provide quality restaurants for Williamson County seniors.
shortDescription: City Post provides quality restaurants for seniors in Georgetown, TX.

reviews_list.author: Rouseau Panicker
reviews_list.text:
Went to City Post for Sunday brunch. First thing’s first - Parking is difficult depending on when you choose to go there. Be prepared to get there early and hunt for parking. I parked on Myrtle rd few blocks from the restaurant. Second, on Sunday it closes by 2pm, so be prepared to reserve and get there early.

The restaurant is set in a gorgeous building and they have maintained the history of the place. The food is great, I loved it. I had the eggs Benedict with tenderloin and the eggs were just perfect. Paired with roasted potatoes, I had my fill of carbs for the day. The cocktails were the highlight - in transit and Georgetown sunrise - I’d recommend both :)
Topped off the meal with Affogato and that was the icing on the cake for such a great meal. It’s a bit towards the pricey end but enjoyed the atmosphere and the food.

The service was great as well. Overall nice place to go for lunch!

reviews_list.author: Brittney Gilmore
reviews_list.text:
Went for our anniversary dinner. This tomahawk porkchop was amazing. My partner enjoyed the fish. Will definitely be visiting again.

Then went to the Brass Peacock, and if you're at the city post do yourself a favor and go downstairs. Very unique experience!

reviews_list.author: Mike Cole
reviews_list.text: Only had oysters 🦪 and drinks, but both were very good. Service was very good, and they were very generous letting us sample till we picked what we liked. Cool and attentive staff with great service. Sorry my photos aren’t the best.

reviews_list.author: Alyssa Norton
reviews_list.text: We’ve been a few times now and had one of the best meals last night with the lamb chops that were enough to share. We split a salad and our entree came with some delicious mashed potatoes. It’s the next day and we are still talking about how amazing the meal was paired with fantastic service. I think we’ll be back sooner rather than later. Also get the country white cake! It’s amazing!

reviews_list.author: John “Mrjohncool2001” T
reviews_list.text:
Went there for my birthday and have to say was a premium experience. From the food, to our server Heidi making my birthday a truly special experience. She was attentive and very detailed in her service while helping us immensely with the menu on how  things worked in the restaurant since it was our first time. She was amazing, and was a treat to have as our waitress/server. The Speakeasy’s atmosphere was also awesome! Felt like I was at a secret chamber in New Vegas ( I’m a humongous Fallout fan so the old prohibition theme and music is perfect scenery for me since the games and the show have that mid century feel).

Will definitly come again, Thanks Heidi for the prime experience!

reviews_list.author: Christina Evans
reviews_list.text:
I rarely leave negative reviews, but our experience at City Post in downtown Georgetown was so bad that it deserves an honest account.

We were dining with family and genuinely looking forward to a great evening. Given the prices and the way City Post presents itself, we expected a polished, high-end experience comparable to similar establishments. That expectation was completely unmet.

The service was absolutely terrible from the start. Our server, Heidi B, was extremely snarky and rude which is unacceptable at any restaurant—especially one charging premium prices. When we asked to speak with a manager, things somehow got worse. The manager, Jenna, was dismissive and unprofessional, and her attitude made it clear she had no customer service skills. She should not be managing a restaurant that advertises itself as upscale, or any restaurant to be honest.

The food was just as disappointing.  My sea bass was so overly salted. My daughter’s sea bass was the opposite problem—dry, overcooked, and equally inedible. The side of green beans was undercooked, under-seasoned, and frankly not worth serving at all.

For the price point, this experience was shocking. Poor service, rude management, and food that couldn’t be eaten is not what anyone expects when choosing a restaurant like City Post. This was not just a bad night—it was a complete failure across service, management, and kitchen. We will not be returning, and I cannot recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a quality dining experience.

reviews_list.author: Tanya Skaarup
reviews_list.text:
Went to City Post for the first time on NYE with my boyfriend to celebrate almost a year of dating and was delighted by the service provided by everyone, even Sarah the lady who handled all the reservation craziness!
Our server was amazing, never wanted for anything. We enjoyed a delightful meal and never felt rushed or like we were part of a manufacturing plant process. ;p
After dinner, we had reservations for The Brass Peacock downstairs and enjoyed live jazz with a few other patrons from the same dinner service time (830p) for 12p Champagne Toast!
They even provided a background area for party goers to take group pics and selfies; bringing in 2026!!
Thanks for the experience and making new friends!
T & K

reviews_list.author: cws1184
reviews_list.text: Excellent high end chop house just off the square in Georgetown. What a Gem! Thank you Court and Austin at the bar. Where to start about our exceptional experience at City Post. Formerly the post office of Georgetown, with notes of such throughout the lobby and the dining rooms. Very upscale seating and atmosphere, quality customer service as soon as you walk in the door. We came in for brunch and got seats at the bar quickly, I would recommend reservations. We enjoyed a Mimosa and an iced coffee, the chefs designed an iced latte was incredible. After perusing the menu we thought to split the City Breakfast with the Corned Beef and Hash. We were not disappointed. The sauce on the biscuit is so clever, sort of a gravy/hollandaise mix with just the right amount of kick; and it goes good on everything. They have a great cocktail menu with something for everyone, including "Prohibition Style" drinks and even local beers on tap. The restrooms are an example of the sense of detail from this venue, they think of everything and excel everywhere. During our visit we were appraised of their Friday and Saturday speakeasy, the golden peacock, in the basement. We are looking forward to our next visit.

reviews_list.author: Tim Reedy
reviews_list.text:
My wife and I looked forward to our reservation at City Post. We like trying new places and this looked promising.

First, the good: The aura is great, and it felt upscale without being stuffy. We loved the little touches like the stamp on the ice cube in my old fashioned. Also, we added grilled shrimp to my entree, and I appreciated they removed the entire shell so that no meat was inside and only actual tail fins were attached. The service was also terrific. My wife's lobster roll was really good as was my dry aged rib eye.

The less than stellar: the fries with the lobster roll were all but inedible; not crisp, not very flavorful and almost seemed like an after thought. The lobster mac and cheese was ok, but we expected it to be really good given the nature of City Post. We like eating at restaurants that make better food than we do and those two sides just weren't up to that standard. We felt that fries should be a bumpset for skilled chefs and the mac and cheese should also be an easy score. So, for that reason, I rated the food lower. One last thing - my steak knife was about as sharp as a plastic butter knife. I get that I don't need razor blade sharpness, but I had to do quite a bit of sawing just to cut my steak.

With that said, we enjoyed our time. We had the perfect table and except for the sides, this would've been an easy 5 stars.

reviews_list.author: Khang Trieu
reviews_list.text:
The atmosphere was great. It’s more of a casual fine dining.  The seafood is immaculate. The scallop dish is the best I have ever had. It is sweet, savory and fresh. The oysters are extremely juicy and sweet. Straight from the ocean.
The steak was cooked perfectly. Very tender and well-seasoned. It’s important to pair it with the lobster mac n cheese because that dish is amazing.
The staff was nice and friendly. They were super attentive and refilled our drinks right on time.
The price is a bit on the high side but you get what you pay for. The quality is top notch and I will definitely be back here for the seafoods.

name: Monument Cafe
description: Monument Cafe is a cafes in Georgetown, TX, offering restaurant, american restaurant, breakfast restaurant services. With a 4.5-star rating from 5253 reviews, they are one of the highest-rated restaurants providers in Williamson County.
shortDescription: Monument Cafe provides quality restaurants for seniors in Georgetown, TX.

reviews_list.author: James Mavrinac
reviews_list.text: Very open and comfortable environment. The service was friendly and great! I got the biscuits with sausage gravy. Ok...scratch made biscuits and gravy...amazing. Also they give you a basket of the biscuits and whipped butter. My daughter got the waffles, they hit the target for sure! My wife got the breakfast sandwich with bacon. All of it was amazing!!

reviews_list.author: Kyle W. Knouse
reviews_list.text:
Great diner, very busy, delicious food. Well worth the ten minute wait for the table. Our server was very friendly and prompt on the coffee refills, that is always appreciated. I ordered two buckwheat pancakes with candied pecans and banana slices, with a side of two scrambled eggs. I left feeling very full and satisfied.
I will definitely return here again. Thank you Monument Cafe.

reviews_list.author: Diego Salinas
reviews_list.text:
The most solid brunch in Georgetown. My friends and I stopped by on our way to a hike from Austin. The options are southern comfort food, and the service is similarly warm with southern hospitality. I felt the servers and kitchen staff handled the weekend rush expertly. That said, it gets quite busy on the weekends so get there early or expect a wait!

Also the decor here is so great. What a cool vibe

reviews_list.author: Todd S
reviews_list.text:
We make it a point to stop at Monument Cafe whenever we are in Georgetown. This is one of the best cafes in central Texas. The menu is fairly small but that allows Monument to focus on getting everything on it right.
Breakfast is the star meal here. Everything from standard eggs and bacon to stuffed breakfast burritos (I love those) , breakfast tacos and migas. Coffee is smooth and kept full.
Lunch is mainly sandwiches and burgers. They look delicious but I can't ever seem to not order breakfast here.
We usually take a cinnamon roll with us for dessert later. They are so cinnamony ( I know that's not a real word).
Make sure you check the board next to the hostess on the way in for specials of the day.
Plenty of parking in the lot next door but street construction makes it a little challenging to reach the restaurant.
Definitely worth the trip for breakfast or lunch. Monument Cafe closes at 3PM.

reviews_list.author: Gabz
reviews_list.text: I’ve been living in Georgetown for over a year and I’m so upset with myself that I have only recently gone. Truly a Georgetown GEM. Extremely packed and bustling but rightfully so! Delicious food, friendly service, and cozy atmosphere which is odd to say because it’s packed and loud, but somehow, it felt homey. Everything from the biscuits to the pie was 10/10. If you’re in Georgetown or if you’re not, it’s worth a visit!

reviews_list.author: Kanchan Sil
reviews_list.text: What a fantastic brunch at Monument Cafe! From the very friendly hostess to the impeccably efficient service, the staff made the experience wonderful. Plus, the breakfast and brunch staples were delicious. Don't forget the sumptuous pies and cakes!

reviews_list.author: Susan Steele
reviews_list.text: What a great diner experience! You get your moneys worth, the food portions are huge. Even the lemonade is meant to be shared. Highly recommend the chicken fried steak with onion rings and corn beef hash. The chicken fried steak and onion rings are coated with light batter. They are really tasty but a bit salty for me. Nevertheless, they are still tasty. You will need to wait for a table for large parties, but for 2 people, we were able to seat at the counter with very little wait time. The biscuits are delicious and must try their coconut cream pie! Highly recommend this cafe with great service and food!

reviews_list.author: Chelsey Hilmus
reviews_list.text:
5 Stars – A Must Stop in Georgetown!

Monumental Cafe absolutely lives up to the hype and then some. We stopped in after hearing great things, and every bite proved the praise was well earned.

We started with Anna’s Granola: Greek yogurt, fresh berries, crunchy granola, and a drizzle of honey. It was light, flavorful, and right up my alley. The biscuits with sausage gravy were rich and comforting, and the eggs benedict were perfectly cooked and seasoned just right.

One of the highlights was the mimosa flight. Every juice was squeezed fresh in-house and you could taste the difference. The strawberry and watermelon were muddled to perfection, and the pulpy grapefruit and orange mimosas were bold and refreshing.

We also had the pearl sugar waffles (phenomenal), the egg taco, and a side of sausage and over-medium egg, all delicious.

The staff was friendly and attentive, and the atmosphere was warm and inviting. We will definitely be back the next time we’re passing through Georgetown!

reviews_list.author: Jessie Williams
reviews_list.text: A classic Georgetown staple! Great spot for delicious pancakes and southern style breakfast. The staff are always kind and attentive and the food never disappoints.

reviews_list.author: Mary Musa
reviews_list.text:
Great food, fast service, and easy parking!”
Monument Café is one of my favorite spots in Georgetown. The food is always fresh, flavorful, and served quickly. The staff is friendly and welcoming, which makes the whole experience even better. I also love that the parking is easy and convenient — a big plus when you’re in a hurry or visiting with family. Definitely a place I’ll keep coming back to!

name: Simmer Down Cafe
description: Simmer Down Cafe is a restaurant in Georgetown, TX, offering breakfast restaurant services. Rated 4.2 stars based on 850 reviews, they provide quality restaurants for Williamson County seniors.
shortDescription: Simmer Down Cafe provides quality restaurants for seniors in Georgetown, TX.

reviews_list.author: SAM Morrison Wilson
reviews_list.text: We will be back for sure. The biscuits and gravy were amazing? Iris, the woman serving us was kind and helpful. Love supporting local businesses.

reviews_list.author: Mei H
reviews_list.text: Good food and good service. The pick 3 and pick 4 weekday breakfast is such a good deal. The only problem I had was getting to the place, the driveway to the parking lot is not well marked at all, and even after turning in I had to drive around a bit to find the right lot for their building.

reviews_list.author: Eleanor Cliborne
reviews_list.text: First time here. We attended a private party here. Beautiful Christmas tree! Love the ambient feel, very friendly and inviting. Our waitress was just the sweetest. The chicken and dumplings were very good. I would've liked a few more dumplings but I'm a dumplings fan and the more the better. Several of our party ordered it and were pleased as well, also looking for more dumplings (we were all dumpling fans-haha). The meatloaf was very good. Nice size piece cut into thirds. Juicy and tender. Creamed corn was nice and sweet. Never saw onions on loaded mashed potatoes before, not a fan. Old style green beans-yum. Chicken fried steak was a nice size and crispy but a little too salty. Probably wont order that again. Side salads are huge! Kudos on that!! Liver and onions was also ordered but i havent heard the feedback on that yet. The pork chops were a huge hit. Tender but juicy. Definitely will come back to try breakfast.

reviews_list.author: Brittney Thrift
reviews_list.text:
Simmer Down absolutely blew us away! The chicken and waffles were incredible — perfectly crispy, flavorful, and cooked just right. The chicken fried steak was also amazing, tender on the inside with the perfect crunch on the outside.

We were lucky to have Miss Renee as our waitress, and she was the sweetest! Attentive, kind, and made us feel right at home. The atmosphere is clean, stylish, and such a comfortable place to enjoy a great meal.

Highly recommend stopping by — we’ll definitely be coming back!

reviews_list.author: MarivicB
reviews_list.text: A nice spot for lunch in Georgetown. We had a big group of 17 and the staff were happy to accommodate us : moving tables and chairs, etc. the food was good - what you’d expect for a diner. Definitely worth visiting if you’re in the area. Great prices too.

reviews_list.author: Shelby G
reviews_list.text: This is our first and last time here, I am confused on how they function. We ordered 2 appetizers; fried mushrooms and fried ricotta bites. We had to return the mushrooms because they were not fully cooked. They were just returned to our table still uncooked, they took the batch that we were given, that we touched and the waiter touched and put it back in the fryer and reserved them STILL under cooked. How?! I'm so confused. Dinner was CFS for both of us, with mac & cheese (not good either). After arriving with hope of this being a great new place for date nights, we left disappointed and let down. 🙈

reviews_list.author: Carol Medford
reviews_list.text: Chef Ramsey spent a week here at this restaurant a month or two ago. The staff told us the redesign was achieved overnight once they started it. The restaurant is beautiful. They were packed this morning, so service was a little slower than normal probably, but still very good. And the food was excellent. We will definitely be back.

reviews_list.author: Running Deep
reviews_list.text:
We stopped at Simmer Down Café in Georgetown on a Tuesday for lunch.  Thank goodness for Google maps, because I would have totally missed this place.  This is not in a traditional strip mall and parking can be a challenge.  To get a parking spot, we had to go several buildings away and we were worried that we parked someplace we shouldn’t.  If you go during a busy time, be prepared for a search to find a spot to park!

I saw some criticism in other reviews about slow service, and we experienced the same thing.  It was during the busy lunch hour, but, wow, the service was very slow.  Our server eventually stopped at our table and apologized for the slowness.  This is clearly a staffing issue.  The servers were hustling to serve customers and also bus the tables after people left and to seat new customers.  If you can’t get a timely lunch meal out, then you need more cooks.  From talking with our server, the management knows all this and is working to hire more people.  I hope they get it fixed soon, because despite the parking headache and the very slow service, the food was great.

We got the Chicken Fried Steak and the Rueben sandwich.  My wife got mashed potatoes and macaroni and cheese with her CFS.  She originally wanted creamed corn, but it wasn’t available.  You can clearly tell that the CFS and mashed potatoes are made from scratch in house.  It was a thick piece of meat with the perfect level of breading.  We both liked the mashed potatoes and white gravy.  The mac & cheese was in a white cheese sauce, and I liked it more than my wife.  The Rueben was also very good.  I would have liked more meat on the sandwich (especially for an $18 sandwich), but it was well put together and tasted great.  I got the fries with my Rueben and my wife and I finished them off fairly quickly!

I recommend that you go to Simmer Down Café and give them a try.  Be ready to deal with the valid negative criticisms and just go try it for yourself because the food is worth it.  They won’t fix the parking problems, but I have high hopes that they will get the staffing fixed.  Oh, one last criticism.  The system that they use for paying your bill at the table is terrible.  You can’t really review your bill before you are handed a small device with even smaller buttons to put in the tip and pay with your credit card.  My wife pushed the second tip option, which turned out to be 25%.  That’s fine, but she was just guessing when she picked.  Come on, this can be made so much easier!  Get a new better system!  Also, a pet peeve, they add a 3% fee for using a credit card.  We didn’t know this until we asked for a printout of our paid bill.  Credit card fees are a cost of doing business and should be absorbed in the prices.  I’m sure there will be people that disagree, but it’s just my opinion.

reviews_list.author: Jason Clark
reviews_list.text: Decided to try this place for breakfast after learning about it online. I was expecting a Cajun twist, "Simma don na" IYKYK.  Decor is nice, the server was very friendly and accommodating but the food took longer to arrive than it should have. Unfortunately, the food was bland and uninspiring. Pancakes were decent, biscuit/gravy were as expected, but everything else was bland. I had two main issues as to why I won't be returning. One was charging me a credit card fee. This is a cost of doing business plain and simple, especially now that we are a cashless society. There isn't an electricity fee, or a water fee, that would be ridiculous so why add some other random overhead charge. Second, the bland breakfast for two with tip and fees was $54. That is just way too much for what we got.

reviews_list.author: Larry W
reviews_list.text: Good experience overall. First time to have dinner. My chicken fried steak was good but due to some stringyness of the steak it could have been better. The crust was excellent. Green beans are awesome. My wife had the fried pork chops which were excellent! Okra was fried just right. Love the atmosphere. Very Texas!! We'll be back.

name: Wildfire
description: Wildfire is a restaurant in Georgetown, TX, offering steak house, bar & grill, restaurant services. With a 4.5-star rating from 2145 reviews, they are one of the highest-rated restaurants providers in Williamson County.
shortDescription: Wildfire provides quality restaurants for seniors in Georgetown, TX.

reviews_list.author: Kui Mew
reviews_list.text: Enjoy our dinner very-very much. Services was outstanding and food are very-very delicious...! The best French Onion soup we ever had..! Lamb and elk  were so good... so as the calami... We will definitely come back when we are in Georgetown TX again...!

reviews_list.author: Sarah Johns
reviews_list.text:
It's OK. I've dined here twice for lunch and the food has been mediocre, at best, both times. On this occasion, I ordered the Big Dipper: sliced top sirloin, caramelized onions, provolone cheese on a baguette with steamy au jus, with onion rings.
__________________________________
The sandwich: the meat was so overly cooked, it was tough to eat, burned, and even crunchy in spots. You truly had to rip it with your teeth just to manage a small bite, and they forgot to put on the cheese. It was just beyond dry-even with the au jus- and overly done, making it unappetizing. I cannot recommend it from my experience. The price doesn't justify what you receive.

The Onion Rings: They were OK. Much better than the sandwich.
___________________________________
Service: They offered phenomenal customer service, we were seated promptly, and there was not a long wait for our entrées.
___________________________________
Atmosphere: Beautiful restaurant and great ambiance.
__________________________________
Prior visit: I ordered the Texas Sized Pastrami Reuben and encountered the same problem: the sandwich was overly done,  not prepared well, and unappetizing.

I haven't had any luck with their sandwiches and the onion rings are just OK.
__________________________________
I'm not entirely sure I'll attempt a third visit, but as they say, "The third time is the charm."

If you go, avoid the sandwiches, or don't have high hopes in that department.

reviews_list.author: Jessica Benkert
reviews_list.text: The restaurant was upscale but quaintly decorated. Our server Brent was phenomenal. He gave us the perfect amount of time to review the menu, offered his opinion when we were indecisive on an appetizer, and came to check on us regularly. I never post what we ordered but it was absolutely noteworthy to share for first time diners like my friend and I were. We started with the Maple Glazed Crackling Pork Belly then shared the Veal Loin Chop Piccata and Flame Kissed Agave Chicken Breast. We both are huge chicken piccata fans, their veal picatta was to die for! Perfectly cooked and the sides were better than described on the menu. The chicken was cooked beautifully but a little on the sweet side, which we weren't upset with considering agave was used in the description. First time but definitely not the last dining experience here! Thanks Brent for making our experience memorable and we hope to see you again soon :)

reviews_list.author: M VS
reviews_list.text: The green chili pozole soup is a great start to the meal. Tender pork, hominy, beans in a light, slightly spicy tomato based broth. Topped with a bit of cabbage and cilantro, very yummy.  The chicken and dumplings is traditional with pillowy, tender dumplings covered in a white, very creamy sauce. Be sure and ordered some rolls to help get every last bit of sauce and chicken from the bottom of the bowl.  Another hearty option is the beef pot roast.  Fork tender with a bit of smoke sitting in a heaping helping of mashed potatoes.  Too much for one person!

reviews_list.author: Jake Hewitt
reviews_list.text: Have wanted to go to Wildfire for quite some time and finally went for a friend’s birthday. The lamb chop was delicious and would get this again! Shoutout to McKenna for the great service and recommendations. The steak unfortunately was lacking flavor but the kitchen took care of that and made a peppered steak instead which was much better! Make sure to save room for dessert!!

reviews_list.author: Ken Johnson
reviews_list.text: We sat at the bar...excellent service from Jacob, Liz and Angela.   I had the Jerk porkchop, delectable and hit the spot.  The feature was the carrot cake.  I love carrot cake and have had a lot of it...this by far the best!  Really carrot stripe on the plate.  Also pictured was the cowboy Riley and pecan green beans.  I would be wrong in not mentioning the collard greens...superb.

reviews_list.author: Jennifer Milligan
reviews_list.text: We were absolutely delighted with our first experience at Wildfire! I had the salmon and my husband had the ribeye for lunch and we were blown away by how affordable and delicious our meals were. Highly recommend this place and we will be back!

reviews_list.author: Ellie Ryden
reviews_list.text: We've been here many times. Atmosphere feels like you might be in the 1920s in a good way. Had the veal pork loin chop for the first time last night and I loved the combination of different flavors on the plate though the meat could have been more tender. We will definitely keep going back occasionally.

reviews_list.author: Ivan Perez
reviews_list.text: Went to this restaurant on a business trip. At first wasnt seated right away but its true good things comes to those who wait. After ordering the food it came back instantly and the taste was great. Great sear on the steak and Mckenna the waiter was nothing but polite.  Would definitely visit again and the price was amazing for this type of steak.

reviews_list.author: Sandra A
reviews_list.text:
I found this restaurant while passing by Georgetown. It was a total surprise! My daughter and I had only appetizers because we were late for our Christmas concert. So we ordered three appetizers: the salad with beets, the scallops wrapped in prosciutto and a bowl of corn chowder.
Everything was so delicious that I had to go back after the concert to experience a full meal. Unfortunately, the restaurant was completely full and there were no tables available.

name: Sweet Lemon Kitchen
description: Sweet Lemon Kitchen is a restaurant in Georgetown, TX, offering restaurant, bakery, breakfast restaurant services. With a 4.7-star rating from 1388 reviews, they are one of the highest-rated restaurants providers in Williamson County.
shortDescription: Sweet Lemon Kitchen provides quality restaurants for seniors in Georgetown, TX.

reviews_list.author: V
reviews_list.text: Very cute and cozy. Food and drinks were pretty good. I would come back, but I would ask to be seated away from the bathroom area due to too many people going in and out. Staff was great and punctual for anything needed. Good spot in downtown Georgetown area.

reviews_list.author: Kayla Breaux
reviews_list.text:
Soooo stinkin' cute! The sweetest house that's been turned into restaurant.
Closed Mondays. Open for breakfast-dinner Wednesday-Saturday.
Baked fresh daily chocolate and Nutella croissant...Served warm. Just as good as it sounds.
We had unsweet peach iced tea that was fantastic. We may or may not have snagged the brand name and already have it en route to our house.
The frittata Lorraine was fluffy and divine. Served with their signature house salad that comes with homemade candied pecans. Don't sleep on the salad!
My daughter ordered the Chipotle chicken sandwich and loved it. It was served with chips.
Great spot for lunch or brunch. We'll be back to try dinner, too.

reviews_list.author: Jessie Chism
reviews_list.text: We enjoyed lunch today. Chipotle chicken sandwich and grilled cheese were ample and mouth watering. The Arnies (tea and lemonade) were so refreshing and the prices were fair with value for money and taste. Our server, Summer, was pleasant and friendly. We didn't wait long at all for our food, around ten minutes. Here's a picture of the perfect Chipotle chicken sandwich. We'll definitely come back.

reviews_list.author: Valerie Nguyen
reviews_list.text:
Food was absolutely delicious. Steak was tender and moist and perfectly seasoned. Coconut cream pie was so good, just moderate sweet, which is perfect for me. Pumpkin patch latte was better than I expected. It didn't have much cinnamon taste. Ask for their seasonal drinks. I loved the view of the street from sitting outside.
Recommend this place!

reviews_list.author: Aquilla M.
reviews_list.text:
I have been in search for good cinnamon rolls for the longest and I finally struck gold!

This was my second time stopping by Sweet Lemon Kitchen, the first time I went they were sold out of the cinnamon rolls for the day. On my second attempt I decided to come earlier and thankfully the cinnamon rolls were fresh and hot. The cinnamon roll was so good it had me questioning if I’d ever tasted a cinnamon roll so good.

It took 3-4 minutes before anyone acknowledged me, but outside of that the visit was pleasant and worth the drive. The price was reasonable and I look forward to coming back to try more items on the menu.

The location was easy to find, parking was also readily available. The decor was warm and inviting and felt very welcoming. This location gives small town vibe and I loved it.

reviews_list.author: Richard R
