reviews_list.text:
Ordered the steak and egg sandwich and it was good. Soup of the day was alright as well but underwhelming.

Would have given 4 stars, but decided on 3 because I received dirty silverware with lipstick stains on it

reviews_list.author: Shane Anciso
reviews_list.text:
here's what you need to know before coming to this location

their shared parking around the area but depending on if it's the weekend this is 80% of the battle is just getting parking around this area cuz they don't really have like dedicated parking for this location per se

want to get past that though this place is a gym and a hidden little spot of just amazing things as follows

they have separate restrooms for men and women in pristine condition cannot say enough good things about this with hand soap that is definitely higher caliber everything in the restroom was higher caliber even from the design spotless

plenty of indoor dining area with Wi-Fi and outlets so yes this is the place to come and just knock out stuff on your laptop

they got coffees galore including a variation of flavors that definitely caught my attention such as a lemon latte special

but for me since they're 6:00 alarm is doing was just making a quick pit stop to the restroom and then pick up a drink somebody told me to try it must try to lemonade so I got their lavender lemonade 32 oz for about $5 Best investment ever best lemonade I've had all year long and that's saying something cuz I'm usually loyal to p Terry's for my lemonades this place had this very special something in there lavender lemonade not too much lavender not too much lemon not too much sweetness just a perfect balance of all of them that made me go to heaven :)

also they have an upstairs room for even more sitting and even more special options to do profit private events like they even were promoting a New Year's Eve private event that you can book

their customer service was phenomenal I got my lemonade literally I don't even think in a minute for my order

in addition to that customer service was very friendly we're staying on top of back-to-back orders inside outside and after looking after many I could see why cuz there are dinner menu has some very unique items worth paying attention to such as a very special French slow-cooked beef dish and a Mediterranean salmon dish that I know is unique and hard to find in all of Georgetown

and in addition you want a definitely take advantage of the outdoor dining which is just its own special environment but it's on artistic blair as I've included pictures of this is definitely a jam I don't know how I've missed this all these years until a friend told me about it and it was like The Matrix my eyes open up and I'm going How did I miss this place all this time thankfully I was in the area and finally made a pit stop to drop by and check them out and definitely worthwhile very special little spot here :)

depending on how you can navigate the stairs on either side entrance they have a side entrance I guess you could say a front entrance depends on the handicap accessibility I wouldn't say this place is handicapped accessible but it definitely have vegetarian options including a portobello mushroom sandwich that was definitely keep in my eye on cuz I just love Portobello mushroom not because I'm vegetarian I'm more carnivore right now but I know my there are some friends with dietary restrictions that could benefit from this place as well :)

reviews_list.author: Taylor Paul
reviews_list.text: We really wanted to enjoy our first dining experience with Sweet Lemon Kitchen. I had heard so many great things online and was really looking forward to eating here. I tried to make a reservation for lunch on a Saturday a week in advance and noticed that they only take reservations after 3 pm each day. I thought this was a little odd but hoped for the best. We arrived at 11:30 and were told it would be an hour and a half wait. We walked around a bit and were called back within 15 minutes, which was a nice surprise. The host hadn't asked if we wanted indoor or outdoor seating. We would have preferred indoor but were sat outdoor. The first thing we were told by our waitress was that they were completely out of cinnamon rolls. Bummer since that's the thing they are known for and what I was looking forward to! I do understand running out, but if it's your most popular item, you should definitely plan for more and then can do more business! 3 people at our table ordered French toast, and it wasn't until after the third person ordered that she also informed us they were out of that. They were also out of most scones. That's a lot of things to be out of by lunchtime on the weekend. I guess it was really busy, we never once had our waters refilled the entire time we were there, so most of us sat without any the whole meal. She didn't come back for long stretches of time and we actually had to go find her to pay since we sat there and were ready to go for 15 minutes after finishing. I think being a little more attentive would really go a long way. Half of our to-go order was missing but the party was ready to leave at this point. This is a really cute place and I hope they can work on making more food portions correct so we all can enjoy what the menu offers!

reviews_list.author: Elizabeth Ferry Pekins
reviews_list.text: Super lunch! Lovely outdoor dining. A very brief wait for a table. The chicken salad plate is delicious and I took home enough extra for another meal. Perhaps the best Arnold Palmer I’ve ever had. Will be back!

reviews_list.author: K Garcia
reviews_list.text: I booked a private tea party for a baby shower of 12 people. Sweet Lemon was very easy to work with. I was able to choose from a variety of different sandwiches and desserts. The service was wonderful and the room they provided was lovely. The food was delicious. I would definitely recommend Sweet Lemon to someone looking for a unique special event.

name: Willie's Grill & Icehouse
address: 1301 S I-35 Frontage Rd, Georgetown, TX 78626
description: Willie's Grill & Icehouse is a restaurant in Georgetown, TX, offering american restaurant, bar & grill, chicken restaurant services. With a 4.5-star rating from 3519 reviews, they are one of the highest-rated restaurants providers in Williamson County.
shortDescription: Willie's Grill & Icehouse provides quality restaurants for seniors in Georgetown, TX.

reviews_list.author: Sara Hayes
reviews_list.text:
Willie’s Restaurant absolutely crushed it. From the second we walked in, the vibe was warm and welcoming, the kind of place that makes you instantly feel like you picked the right spot. The staff was friendly, attentive, and on top of everything without being overbearing. Everything came out hot, fast, fresh, and full of flavor, and it was plated so nicely it honestly looked like it belonged in a commercial.

If you’re debating where to eat, let this be your sign: go to Willie’s. Great service, great food, and an experience that makes you want to come back.

reviews_list.author: Austin Mayer
reviews_list.text:
Nice icehouse with a very family-friendly atmosphere. I ordered the fried catfish, queso and chips, a chicken sandwich, and chicken salad. Everything came out fresh and quickly, which I appreciated.

There wasn’t a single standout dish that blew me away, but the food was solid and dependable. Prices were pretty standard for an American diner. Overall, a reliable spot that I’d visit again.

reviews_list.author: Patricia
reviews_list.text: This was my first time at Willie's Grill & Icehouse and I was pleasantly surprised! I ordered the Chicken Caesar Salad, and it was delicious. The chicken was flavorful and tender. The salad was fresh and well balanced. The staff was friendly and made me feel welcomed. The overall vibe was relaxed and comfortable. Great first impression! I will definitely be coming back.

reviews_list.author: M C
reviews_list.text:
SECOND VISIT:
Uh.... idk what happened. First visit everything was 5 star second visit 3 star.. really scared to come back a 3rd time. Food and service was eh.  Just shy of bad! Service was straight up BAD! Food was 🤨

FIRST VISIT;
I can't begin to tell you how awesome this place is!  Literally everything was in point!! So between all of us we tried the catfish plate,  the sweet and spicy chicken sandwich with onion rings, Cajun craw fish, and some plain craw fish and some peach cobbler!  Dayum! Everything cooked to perfection. Chicken was so good and as i continued to eat it it got spicier and just good.  Omg! The onion rings were heavenly!  So so good!  The catfish good the queso and salsa so good and the crawfish were so reasonable in price definitely made a huge impression.  The service was outstanding and just a great environment!  Our new go to spot! Come see for yourself!!!

reviews_list.author: Mark Kline
reviews_list.text:
Hey this place is really a great place. Atmosphere, food, and drinks. Do definitely come during happy hour. I had 4 drinks with a Willie Burger and seasoned fries. The server walked by and checked on me every 3  minutes.  The drink quality is good. Not girly drinks. Oh and less than $30. Wow.
Highly recommend
Enjoy. I sure did.
;)

reviews_list.author: Cam M
reviews_list.text: Ate here after inner space caverns. The catfish was really good! The Country fried steak was average and the shrimp basket was average as well. Nothing against it. The food was good. My son said the burger was really good too. Service was very attentive and food came out very quickly. It was a good environment.  I would definitely come back.

reviews_list.author: Nolimitdk __
reviews_list.text:
Always enjoy Willie's. Have never had a bad meal.
Services is always so friendly! It can tend to be loud when it's full but it is not overwhelming. Started with ribs & fries & had a margarita!

reviews_list.author: Di Leigh
reviews_list.text:
We went here on a Friday evening for the first time. The line to order was a short wait. We mentioned it was our first time visiting and I asked the order taker a few questions about their different tacos. He told me his opinion and why he liked one vs the other. I decided to go with his suggestion and ordered the Chipolte Shrimp tacos, blackened with their street corn and coleslaw.
My husband got a burger and gumbo. He said his burger was good but the gumbo didn’t have much flavor.
My tacos were full of flavor with the chipotle sauce, not too spicy considering the shrimp were blackened- which is what I was hoping for. I’m not much of a spicy food person! Their street corn was also extremely good, a little spicy for me but I couldn’t stop eating it! The coleslaw was different in a good way. It wasn’t big and chunky, not too vinegary or too much mayonnaise.
The place is decorated nicely and the staff very friendly and informative. Our server was very attentive, checking on us several times during our meal.
We had a great experience and will be waiting patiently for the new location to open in Leander - it’s “proposed” as of this review.

reviews_list.author: Chosen
reviews_list.text: Family and I've been coming here several times to eat one of our favorite restaurants that we like to partake in on the weekend. One of the things that we enjoy the most by far is the food but not only that is the servers that they have including one in particular that we've had on several different occasions that goes by the name Cameron. Cameron has waited on us a few times now, and she’s always a breath of fresh air. She’s upbeat without being over the top, and she keeps things running smoothly even when the place is busy. Our food comes out just right, she checks in at good moments, and she makes the whole visit feel easy. She’s one of those servers you’re happy to see when you walk in. Always makes it an enjoyable visit! You have a good work!

reviews_list.author: Aron and Janet Jarrett
reviews_list.text: First time dining here and didn’t know what to expect. You order at the counter and seat yourself. Once we found a seat we were almost immediately greeted by a server who let us know he would be taking care of our order. Food came out quickly and our server checked in a couple times to make sure we were satisfied. It is a scratch kitchen and our food was delicious. Would recommend looking at menu online prior to arriving if you want more time to review the menu. They have a good size menu with lots of options and we felt a bit overwhelmed trying to decide while standing at the counter.Casual atmosphere. We sat inside but they also have a nice patio area for outdoor seating.

name: The Red Door Kitchen by Wiseguys
description: The Red Door Kitchen by Wiseguys is a restaurant in Georgetown, TX, offering restaurant services. Rated 4.3 stars based on 151 reviews, they provide quality restaurants for Williamson County seniors.
shortDescription: The Red Door Kitchen by Wiseguys provides quality restaurants for seniors in Georgetown, TX.

reviews_list.author: Jessica Jones
reviews_list.text:
He was honestly a little hesitant to write this review because I don’t want you going there… I don’t want this place to be too busy for whenever I plan to stop by… 🙋🏻‍♀️
Bill, the owner, already told me that he sells out of lasagna every night and I want to make sure there’s some left for me!🤣
So for anybody that drives into Round Rock to get a good Chicago dog, now you don’t have to because they have come to Georgetown! 😍
I love the ambience of this place and the server was super sweet.
It was lunch so I did a half sandwich and half salad (I’m not sure how that salad counts as a half, it was big) and we also started with the fresh tomato basil soup. 🥣😋
I know my husband is going to be super excited to hear that the “Chicago dog place” that we used to have to drive almost 30 minutes to get to is now right around the corner! And they do a fabulous expanded menu for dinner.
All kidding aside I highly recommend this place

Dinner was great! The lasagne was as promised - huge

reviews_list.author: Jamie Peru
reviews_list.text: Definitely 5 stars for effort. Really great ambiance. Service is great. Not a complaint, but the lunch menu was disappointing. If you’re not up for a sandwich, then the lunch menu is anemic. The dinner menu is more weighted to pizza and pasta. Just wish the lunch menu offered more than hot dogs, sandwiches and spaghetti. Where’s the deep dish? Where’s the  muffuletta?  Calzone? Pizza- there are literally 5 places with awesome thin crust pizzas on the square. Bring the deep dish.  Nobody has the deep dish except via 313. Anyway. A for effort. C- for creativity. Secret: we’re looking for things nobody else offers.

reviews_list.author: Reese Lynn
reviews_list.text: The service right when we walked through the door was amazing.  I got the creamy chicken pesto and it was delicious, but next time i would ask for them to make it al dente.  The look and vibe of the restaurant is amazing and I loved the music they were playing. Definitely will be coming back.

reviews_list.author: Danielle M
reviews_list.text:
The food was average Italian. The mozzarella sticks were great and the broccoli cheddar soup was really good. But the spaghetti and Alfredo were bland and average. Service was okay, they were friendly but brought the soup and food at the same time and forgot to bring items we request. Wasn’t really worth what we paid to eat there. ($70 for 3 with an appetizer so 20$+ per person ) Atmosphere was nice,
restaurant is really cute.

reviews_list.author: Camille S
reviews_list.text: Great little place to come and enjoy good food as it’s a BYOB which is very suitable for everyone. The owner is wonderful as the friendly staff come check them out. Pizza after 4 is a must try

reviews_list.author: DrB DIY
reviews_list.text: We stopped by to check out the new place in town. There is good parking. The restaurant looks small but has two seating areas.  It has a NY Italian theme with pictures of Deano and Franko etc.  The food was okay. The iced tea didn't have a tea flavor.  The mozzarella sticks were tasty by very salty.  I had the chicken on salad. There was a lot of chicken. I wish they had more options for dressings.  My son had the lobster ravioli.  The plate looked lonely and the sauce was thick.  May give is a second try.

reviews_list.author: Ken Johnson
reviews_list.text:
Miguela was our server for the evening.  A person that truly loves what she does.  She is the best and I took all of her recommendations.

We had as an appetizer the meatballs.  You get 4 large meatballs that served 2 of us easily.  Some of the best I have ever had.  We also had house Ceasars and standard salads.  Both good.  I had the creamy chicken pesto was was absolutely wonderful.  Desert was the Italian Cream Cake..light and flavorful.

Very convenient to Sun City...we will be back.

Note we also found they have a private room that will serve 30 people that you can reserve.  Decor throughout was calming and delightful.

reviews_list.author: Millage Owens
reviews_list.text: Decided to finally try red door today for lunch I have been to the round rock location several times over the years. I was overall impressed with the Georgetown location very nice atmosphere. I ordered the club sandwich with Parmesan fries. Very good choice in my opinion. Will definitely try again when in the area

reviews_list.author: Nick M
reviews_list.text:
Fantastic food all around, the chicken pesto caprese was delicious and the pickle fries were phenomenal.

This has been a wonderful surprise, and they are punching way above their weight. I wouldn’t be surprised if it gets more and more difficult to get into the restaurant over the next few years.

reviews_list.author: curtis thompson
reviews_list.text:
Five stars aren’t enough!

We were celebrating a visit from my wife’s sister and decided to give The Red Door a try—and wow, what a find! Tucked away in Georgetown, this cozy little Italian spot was quiet on a Tuesday evening but delivered big on flavor and service.

We started with the fried mozzarella sticks, which were absolute perfection—crispy on the outside, gooey (but not runny) on the inside, with that glorious mile-long cheese pull you dream about.

For mains, our table had a variety: classic cheese ravioli in marinara, rich fettuccine Alfredo, a fresh and generous Caesar salad, and my dish—a chef’s choice that completely blew me away. Penne in creamy Alfredo, topped with a perfectly breaded chicken breast, all finished with sautéed peppers and jalapeños that gave the dish a flavorful kick without overpowering it. It was honestly the best Italian food I’ve had since my last trip to New York.

The service was top notch—friendly, engaged, and attentive without hovering. It felt like dining with people who genuinely cared about your experience.

The Red Door is a hidden gem just waiting to be discovered. I’d give them a bonus star if I could—for the food, the warmth, and the pleasant surprise. We’ll absolutely be back.
